Probably not the best game to pour 1000 hours or $1000 into, but for a free game it's pretty fun. Basically a more robust Sven co-op that makes it easy to launch the different game modes. The prophunt mode is great, probably the best I've played, and the user-made scenarios remind me of Spore Galactic Adventures. 

Not a fantastic MMO or Competitive FPS because of player counts, but if you have a group of friends this is a great, free game to mess around with. Most of the stuff that's P2W pertains to the zombies mode, and even then, it's PvE and you can just play on the difficulties that don't require the P2W stuff. I haven't played much of the competitive modes, so I can't say much about that.

As far as Free games go, this one is lightweight, easy to install/get started, and is surprisingly fun as a Gmod or less finicky Sven co-op alternative to play with 4-5 friends. The game tries to do everything and it does a few things quite well, just be wary of the P2W elements. I would not recommend this to solo players whatsoever, though.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Hello, I'll like to give some important notices about this game:

[h1] 1: [/h1]
Beware of the anti-cheat of this game, It leaves a open holes for hackers due to the insecurity of the anti-cheat.
XIGNCODE3 (the old anti-cheat Nexon used for FPS games) tracks your PC all the time for no reason what so ever,
Also, the encryption of this anti-cheat is crack-able to hackers, resulting in your personal information being sold or leaked,

[h1] 2: [/h1]
This game is filled with micro-transactions, but unlike CS:GO, it's not just cosmetics, these are OP weapons.
Generally, you'll gain these weapons by points or by real life currency,
Paid decoders are more valuable and give much rarer items than the point decoders and they don't have a purchase limit unlike point decoders, leading to more people wasting their money on more powerful gear.

[h1] 3: [/h1]
Your account can be wiped any time without any reversal or any compensation, Nexon is overall a greedy company and rarely will help with any financial support.
These wipes can be caused by server error or not agreeing to their "new terms" after a few days.

[h1] Conclusion: [/h1]
Please just buy Counter Strike 1.6, It will cost you less than this game and most of other Nexon games combined,

I think it's a LOT more cooler and better to play than in Global Offensive but it does have some weird stuff.

Let us start with positives, yeah?

It is pretty fun to play, with cool guns to use such as the Quantum Horizon, or a Guillotine that you can throw.  I like the models. They're a bit weird, but they look nice to look at. Other than when you're not playing Zombie Z, I think you'll have a great time with this game if you like cool characters and weapons to use, and a lot of zombies to fight, a lot of modes to play, Because, honestly playing modes other than Zombie Z here is fun and is less rage inducing. Which we'll get to.  Permanent stuff gotten from decoders is kind of worth it.. but which we'll also get to.

Now on to the bad stuff, yeah?

It's so annoying playing Zombie Z. I personally think Zombies need a buff, because you just keep getting knocked back by good human weapons.  
It is so annoying when sometimes, one slash with the zombie arm at close range does the job but other times, you think you are close, but you're not. Git Gud - but I don't think that would work either because of how good players are in this game.  It's like trying to deal with melee mechanics from the 90's whilst you're being shot at. In my opinion zombies need a buff. Why are items that expire are here? It's so sucky - but if Lady Luck's on your side then you'll get it Permanent!  But it is so annoying though. Most modes are entirely empty, and it's only a few which get played often. Earlier on, I had no problem trying to find a Human Scenario but later on there's nothing. Zero. I don't know if the players hate those modes if it's so empty, I wonder where's people playing all modes.

It is a good MMOFPS.. If you're willing to pay and enter the RNG cycle. If not it's still fun though. I recommend it to players who love killing zombies and love using the weapons they can get but the Zombie Z mode is annoying enough you might as well not play it.

Counter Strike: Made in China

Now the ACTUAL review.
CSNZ is actually pretty good despite it being made in China.
But the problem is that the newcomers see all these cool weapons that other players have, and then they feel obligated to get them.
All the special weapons AREN'T important, you can have just as much fun with the default weapons as the special weapons

Now onto the modes
Zombie scenario is the best one by far.
With the football mode surprising not being the worst one, even though it complete trash, it's hella fun with friend's.
Zombie Files is the worst mode overall, You're better off playing any other mode ever.
Theres alot of different modes, some I haven't even played

Now onto "Enhancing"
To be honest, I don't know how enhancing works, so I'm just gonna skip this part of the review

Now the Community made maps
I know this might seem like I'm talking mad shit over the community, which I am but that's because 90% of the maps are awful because the building system in the game if pretty limiting.
Either way I'm gonna talk shit over children in China that play this game

Point is, don't buy the special weapons, play Zombie Scenario, don't play the community maps

8/10

End Review of Counter-Strike Made in China

There are several interested games with various play styles. This game is ABSOLUTELY NOT A PAY-TO-WIN game. You can win mostly AI games without a good stuffs from pays and only need to pay when you reach a high difficulty of game. You can also enjoy various funny and excited games with your friends in here without paying anything. You can also play a classic game types (bomb, team deathmatch) without paying for any popular classic weapons. There is a lot of events that you may get most powerful weapons in the game, and you can make you're stronger by hard-working so don't say it's a pay-to-win game. Only your choice on some minor game types make you feeling this game is pay-to-win game.

I tried this only to play CS 1.6 without paying. Honestly, I had fun, the PVE and Deathmatch gamemodes are fun. You do not require a 10K PC because it¬¥s just modded old school Counter-Strike.

[h1] BUT... (the bad) [/h1]
Of course has p2w stuff. To have the "good or OP stuff" without paying, it required LOTS of hours playing, events, "grinding", and being part of a big clan or group. [b] And also, it seems that if you dont play this game frequently (as i didn¬¥t), you lose ALL your stuff (starts from 0) [/b]
I didn't and don't know this very well or how frequent it happens, but seems that the game does some kind of purge (I tried playing again after 2 years, and this review is long after I tried that). 
I was upset only for that and now I don't want to touch this game again. [spoiler] Yes, I really wasted 669 hours and I'm not proud of it [/spoiler]

-Not recommended due to lack of communication, fan support and balancing. Why? Cause the developers choose too, despite making money and releasing terrible content the community has problems with. 

-Released an Epic weapon that killed the game and it's playerbase. Making every exclusive weapons not bothered to be even use, pointless releasing them. The only playerbase you'll find are AFKs.

-Nexon not making independent events or a simple Email verification from new/old players to prevent smurfs.
Meaning it results them making and botting accounts.

-Tutorial for new players that doesn't even meet the current stupid state of the gamemode.
(Epic players, Rusty Wing spammers) If you're a new player that sees this, you'll already know this game just took a bad game design, and you won't find yourself be able to fit as a player. Nexon prefers you AFK and feed those payers. Yes, zombie auto-hunting mode.

-In-game report doesn't even work, why even make it a feature?
This will result to a large amount of cheaters, scripters that don't get banned, even if you do report them the way the developers want you too, but they won't take action because their so called Game Moderators doesn't banned them for paying the company Nexon and let them cheat freely.

-Before you expect, Map Abuse is a thing that can get you banned that doesn't even exploit the game's rules, even on a Zombie PvE gamemode. You'll even get banned without a warning. As such, why not only apply Map abuse for players that bypass the rules of the gamemode, especially in Zombie Scenario?

Epic weapons get aimbot in a FPS, a community forcing free/budget players to stop playing, a game not bothered to be advertised or supported because you get banned for showing in-game flaws/bugs to the devs and being called out an abuse and get banned. The only winners in this game are item scammers/bot accounts and the developers themselves. I do not ever recommend it. And Nexon themselves give Counter Strike a bad name.

Get killed by a Quantum Horizon aimbot 24/7 of the time, cheaters and alt account users populating to infest the game, no unique system to basically protect players from scripters even when you reported them.
Terrible game, don't ever bring the CS community to this garbage game, let alone call this garbage Counter Strike.

Here you will see why I love Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio, but in my review you will read about why I gave it a negative review due to some problems.

I love Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio I consider it Counter-Strike 1.6 added for free for purchasing Counter-Strike 1.6 that Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio is a Counter-Strike video game with zombie mods officially built into Counter-Strike 1.6 supported by VALVe and Nexon Korea Corporation, but I do hate the microtransactions being sold.

Now since Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio uses OpenGL because VALVe removed DirectX 8 from the Gold Source video game enginesupport and now with VALVe pushing Linux support and removing DirectX 8 from the Gold Source engine video games adding OpenGL support to the Gold Source engine video games I keep getting OpenGL errors every now and then and some freezing issues, which I do not remember ever happening with DirectX 8.

Here is a screenshot of one of the few OpenGL errors I experience here and there. Followed by freezing of the video games that use OpenGL, before crashing.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/887417416764768257/926930307003850792/OpenGL_errors_on_video_games_that_use_OpenGL_on_Windows.png


VALVe and Nexon Studio Corporation please add DirectX 8 support or at least a more up to date version of DirectX 9 support which supports 64-bit, which is DirectX 9.0C I believe?

Otherwise I cannot give Counter-Strike: Nexon Studio a positive review due to these technical issues, which I cannot seem to fix even if I reinstall Windows or Counter-Strike: Nexon Studio.

I would say VALVe and Nexon Korea Corporation please release Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio  for sale on gog.com, but since Counter-Strike: Global Offensive and Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio are both Free to Play (F2P) video games with microtransactions I do not want them sold on gog.com unless the microtransactions are removed. You have said with the Source 2 engine that video game developers developing video games on the Source 2 engine can release the video games that they develop for sale outside of Steam, without needing Steam as long as the video games are also released for sale on Steam.

This is the only official and free old school counter-strike. An excellent way to return to youth. The game has a lot of gaming modes. My favorite is the classic one and the zombie scenario. Of the shortcomings of the game, in my opinion, it is necessary to name the fact that at some hours the game lags a little bit and that the premium weapon in the version with zombies is much better than the standard one. But, these shortcomings do not spoil my overall impression of the game!

It's garbage. Fucking stupid beyond belief, meritless trash. Except... I love it. Sure, mechanically it blows. It's not good because of mechanics, story, or any particular player enviornment - It's the mood. It's the themes. It's like some kid playing with all his super cool flashy overdesigned  toys fighting his colored plastic zombie figures. It's garbage, but i highly reccomend it. It has highly positive recent reviews for a reason - It hasn't resolved it's issues, the community simply stopped taking itself seriously. Come and play if you think the idea of your knight girl with Eternal Laser Fists shooting beams at a xenomorph and then slashing up a bunch of zombies with her dual katanas, then swapping to her handcannon that when you shoot enemy the orb on the right fills with blood and then you can throw it so it explodes - The fun of this game is the absurdity, and playing with silly toys.

I played this game since it's title was Nexon Zombie, that time the game was P2W without a doubt and lots of reasons that you can see in other reviews why you should not play, then after it's title changed to Nexon Studio; the time with account wipe issue which it was a vary dick move from devs no doubt again, i gave another shot at the game

so far the gameplay is now great, although that active players are reduced to half and some modes are empty( not the good ones).

The P2W system now is more like advantage only: for example before, if you wanted to get a legendary gun like Paladin or python, dark knight... permanently you had to buy a decoder, which it was more expensive if you didn't want your chance be like a lottery some players described, now there are lot of events and missions to get weapons or decoders, there is a nooby friendly system that helps you know the game with awesome starter rewards. i played 10 hours before studio mode and bought 3 decoders which i lost them due to wipe issue, but i got all of them back in like no time (one perma Ak paladin and 2 perma characters)
and i have now like tons of good perma weapons and characters, however there are guns that you have to pay to get them.

The mileage auction system which is an event that you can trade your weapons for mileage or vise-versa
in it, Is a good time for grinding players to get almost any weapon they want ( with excludes that i think changes after each event i think)

overall for a Free-to-play game, Nexon has improved alot, but it's still not gonna be an awesome game in some players view. I recommend this game because it's fun , has a lot of content, got almost balanced, and going to be more sandbox type game like Garry's mode, but i don't recommend to support the devs by buying in-game items unless they guarantee they remain in your account, i mean wtf you pay for it to remain there.

Cons:

-a neverending drama about the relationship between NX and his DdoS-ers friends.
-developers just focuse in zombie modes.

overall, you must try to play this game.. dont forget to play for fun, dont play something just for increasing the number of your enemies or people who hates you.. the game is amazing though

I do enjoy the zombie mode for nostalgia and don't spend a cent on this game (and if you do the events, you do get weapons which will give you the tools to survive with like 2-3 players with Epic weapons). I only played the Zombie hero, Zombie Z modes so that's what I'll talk about.

Overall, while I enjoy the short rounds and the zombie mode, the game is frustrating as a casual player who doesn't want to grind to get items from events and who doesn't want to spend any money at all. I would not recommend this to my friends, who are often casual gamers.

Things to keep:
- (zombie hero) random weapon mode
- decoder/item events kept a newbie like me motivated
- short rounds: I dislike the long 30+ min games from MOBA, auto-chess etc, and really like that I get to try something different every 3-4 minutes
- (zombie hero) weapon ban list e.g. banning certain weapons from a game (this is something I've seen done on the Korean server)

What doesn't work so well (IMO):
- (common to both modes) limited maps: like it's difficult to play a map that isn't Dust, Italy, Assault, Abyss 2. I really liked the Joseon maps and yet none of the rooms could reach 5+ people beyond the first day of the map releases.
- (zombie hero) a disproportionate amount of players have weapons that mess up the balance: in a room of 32 players, if like 3-4 players have massacre weapons I think that's ideal. Current state is that in a room of 32, there's about 10-12 players that have massacre weapons. For a casual gamer, it feels like an absolute waste of time when I become the initial zombie when 10-12 players have OP weapons and I can't even get to the humans...
- mismanagement of game updates/bugs: it seems like the update for CSNZ comes DIRECTLY from the KR server (which is ahead by at least a patch or two). e.g. the bugs that existed in KR server version x.y.z exists when the same version ships to CSNZ.

I don't know, I like it. I just wanted to click a simple "thumbs up", I like this game. Short, quick feedback to help with some broader metric of data, which required very little effort on my part to impact, mind you. But now... this input text box shows up with checkmarks and drop down menus. I understand you'd like for me to ellaborate, sure. You got the inch from me, why not try for the mile? But at least allow me to bypass this milking of a review from me. 

I just wanted to answer your simple question, "would I recommend this game to other players?" In truth, on two seperate occasions I have. There is your answer. As indicated by the illimination of the "Thumbs-up-icon-that-says-yes" button and the dimming of the "Thumbs-down-icon-that-says-no" button. Now please, add a change event trigger to your "Post Review" button. Make the review a voluntary action of the consumer and if they start typing in this field, you can trigger that button to say "Post Review" In the meantime, it should say something akin to "Post Thumbs-up" or "Thanks for that" or probably hundreds of better examples. This review is lengthy, but I really just want to drive the point here and I don't mind beating a dead horse. I would've happily gone through my library in the time it has taken me to write this review and given you accurate thumbs ups and thumbs downs on it's entire contents. Granted, it's not an extensive collection, but it was going to be good honest feedback that I'm sure would be useful. Instead, you got this only review that I've ever given to Steam and it was long-winded and mostly useless. What a shame. So much time, wasted.

Sorry to anyone who happens to read it, I don't expect them to actually keep a review that I seemingly try to stretch on and on at length, not mentioning the game or it's contents. If I'm to be fair, I guess I did mention I like this game. I do, and it was true when I mentioned recommending this game. So if this review is live, thanks for coming on this journey with me. All we learned is that I don't like being put on the spot to write reviews. Remember, I logged in to play this game. It's you (Steam) and your incessant "Would you recommend this game to other players?" in my face when I trying to relax and take an hour or two and enjoy my limited free time. 

And now for a story:
I walk home from work everyday and I always take this particular route. Why this particular route? Those reasons are my own. Anyway, when I'm walking home I always run into this homeless man. Let's call him "Steam". Everyday I walk home and everyday Steam asks "Can you give me a dollar?" and everyday I politely say no and walk by. This relationship goes on for years. I'm content, Steam seems content. It's a harmless question after all, and Steam doesn't mind if I ignore him, but he is persistent. Very persistent...which is fine, as long as things don't get aggressive or confrontational, I don't mind Steam asking me every time I walk by, "Can you give me a dollar?". Then I realized one day, as I walking by Old Steam. He turned to me like he always does, and asked me that tired repetitive question. I paused for the first time. He only wants a dollar. Surely I could spare a dollar! "OK" I exclaim. "A dollar you ask and a dollar you shall receive!" I dig my right hand way down into my pocket. Further down than what seems even possible! I yank my hand out produce a crumpled Washington and stretch my arm out to him, like an olive branch. He stares blankly at me. I'll never forget what that ol' codger said to me. "It's all wrinkled". I stare blankly back. The excitement has left me. "I won't accept any dollar, I have conditions". Do you know what I did? I spent the better part of my day yelling at that choosy beggar. "Ha!" I besmirched myself. I threw that wadded up dollar in his face and turned to proceed on my route. "Keep the change ya filthy animal", I say as to Steam as he fades away slowly behidn me. 

Did it change anything, not really. I still walk down that route that bumps me into Old Steam. Everyday its the same old question "Would you recommend this game to other players". I just know better now. And I think Steam knows too. If he only would take what he askedc, he might've gotten more. Whats the price of a friendly "Yes, I would"?

 Never again Steam.  Never again.

Based on the reviews I've seen, it seems I have spent a higher than average time on this game, by far.
All I can say is that this game had huge potential on its early days. It had an impressive variety of gamemodes (scenario and hero being my favourites), with some p2w aspects,  but you could counter them somewhat with a couple of hours of grind.
It was a good game, ngl, but the p2w component grew exponentially with the years, with a constant decrease on the rewards obtainable via grinding, and a growth of the milestone requirements (something like playing for hours to achieve daily rewards for 27 days during a 30 day event). It was (or is) nuts, and led me to put in the game more time and money that I care to admit.
But the solution wasn't there either, you could complete an event like this, and spend your money on lootboxes until you got the very best equipment, only to have a relative advantage for a couple of months, until a new, better weapon came out. This resulted in the OG meta becoming completely worthless; not only because of the competitive disadvantage, but also because the developers countered this new weapon system by making zombies stronger, but only when an even better weapon came out, so you either had to buy the latest, most expesive lootbox, or be left behind with an ever increasing disadvantage. 
It hurts to see a game I played since almost the very beginning to become this shadow of what it once was, but today I must admit it's not worth playing anymore

Oh I dont even know where to start or where to begin with the review, the game absolutely aged like a milk, and unfortunately, Ive only just found out about the milk that on my fridge and im embarrassed I forgot about its existence

Well, the trash has to be taken somewhere away, shall we? 

The pros:

+ Content:
Yes, as much as most of the content is locked (Mostly new weapons and characters, even skins these days...) behind a certain wall that you either throw your money at which is by the way probably not worth it or overpriced, or if you don't have money you have to dance like a monkey on a slippery ball and its your daily job, a constant cycle of repeating the shame crap over and over til you get your reward which is not worth it because its overshadowed by better guns

Pro tip: You can extract the game files using a certain program so you can look at them without needing to throw crap on amount of money, they can not stop you! 

+ Game Modes:
Im not gonna lie, the amount of game modes this game has is quite impressive, nonetheless, zombie scenario is still one of my favorite game modes that the game offered to this day, im not so sure about the "build mode" minecraft knockoff, yknow, could always hand out the SDK like a normal developer which has much, MUCH more mapping potential 

Oh well my optimism about the game disappeared so ill start with the cons now... 

- Heavy P2W:
Its funny how much Pay to win-ny this game got, heck, its so pity they're actually luring new players by giving them the taste of overpowered weapons only to realize that they last like 2 weeks, what? you wanted to keep that cool looking shotgun drill? DUH PAY MONEY TO GET IT NOW OR GRIND 600 HOURS TO HOPEFULLY GET IT FROM YOUR PESKY 70 DECODERS

- Balance:
Its a really popularly obvious for any horribly made MMO to have a two big red no no's everyone should avoid: Adding P2W automatically ruins the balance of the game, it doesn't exist, it existed at one point but it got ruined to oblivion with weapons that make you invisible (On TDM, and that's a pistol too...), "Frick that particular zombie" weapons where its absolutely screws the zombie and he can do nothing about it, and any kind of "Premium Transcended Ultra" weapons that for some reason also have to increase your exp and points rewards by 30%...

- Account Reset:
Did you know that at one point, the item servers were moving from one server to another and they gave you 2-4 weeks to just join the game and youll keep your items? Apparently they did that and I lost my 60 LVL account (Hey kids, the maximum level was 72 back in the days!, Thanatos 9, Dual infinity finals and Barlog 11 was the Hero meta...) and what if you lost one and want to get something back from your lost account? Nuh uh! No refunds sign is on your right sir 

-Bots, Real players grind and AFK???? 
I recently played the game like 2-3 months ago, its in absolute lowest point, nexon uses bots to make the game look "alive", most of the players you encounter dont even act like players and are very silent, and have a very detectable names if you pay close attention, most of alive players sit 24/7 on grind cube maps where they just afk and kill zombies and the zombies can do nothing about it, clans artificially increase their clan stats by using bots so they can farm faster and beat other clans that also use bots, and its just an endless cycle again 

Its just an endless cycles of people grinding for their sweet double golden uzis and theyre just stuck in there either paying money for it or wasting their time trying to get them

Its just an endless cycle... 

absolute waste of time, im gonna update this review after im done with diarrhea, brb

I played this a few years ago back when it used to be Counter-Strike Nexon Zombies, and at the time it was actually a really fun game, albeit a little bit pay to win 
Recently decided I'd like to try get back in to the game, and my god was that a terrible decision. It's just absolute garbage now. It's a laggy mess, despite having supposedly 80-100 ping. It's EXTREMELY pay to win wherein people who throw money at this game are rewarded with weapons that will literally one-two shot you when you're a zombie with 20,000 health, meanwhile people who don't are lucky to have a weapon that deals close to 1,000 a shot, let alone over it. The players are not at all hesitant to abuse exploits that allow them to clip through floors, either just their knife or their entire character, and while that's not the fault of Nexon, it still puts a damper on the experience when you're in the middle of a vent and get hit by a melee attack 
This game is not worthy of your time in any way, shape or form

This game is like if Condition Zero married a Multiplayer Minecraft server (Hypixel) and had a kid. Now the game is sorta fun, its free to play, and you dont need a supercomputer to run it, But they tried to put the Counter Strike series a bit toooooo far. No one wanted Hide and Seek, I mean its sorta fun but no one asked for it. They used GoldSrc (in fact it is one of the last games to use it) which is OK in my opinion. The character models look like they are from CSCZ but there is a feature (i think) where you can buy avatars and A BUNCH of times they are clearly R Rated for a game that a bunch of teenagers play. Its clear they promote this in one of the pictures they have a R Rated avatar on a character. Generally this game is OK at most, bad community, seems like it was made in a rush, and is just dumb in general. So only play this if you want to add a new Counter Strike to your selection or want to play a new dumb gamemode. If I were you, I would have this with my copies of CS:GO, CS:S, and the GoldSrc Counter Strikes but I would not play it that often.

This game is an abject mess, but serious Valve fans should play at least once. I hate to give something so clearly ambitious a thumbs down because thee are some great ideas and even technical accomplishments, it's just not very fun most of the time. To give some context, this is a [i]Valve Sanctioned[/i] Counter-Strike spinoff that came out in [i]2014[/i] but uses GoldSRC, the [i]Half-Life 1 engine from twenty years ago[/i] as it's base. The fact that [i]an actual Valve approved product[/i] had [i]any[/i] lineage with actual Half-Life assets during "The Dark Ages" when they wouldn't even mention Half-Life is honestly kind of monumental and the descent into madness just gets crazier as soon as you open the game.

Right off the bat, the main menu is one of the worst I've ever seen. There are 2 or 3 layers of thigns covering other things and dozens upon dozens of menus and submenus. There's so much stuff just scrunched together and so many notifications going off vying for your attention that the only way to even begin to parse any of it is just to go very slowly over each screen at a time. The only good thing about it is that it's skinned almost exactly like Steam UI circa 2008, so that was a fun blast from the past.

The first mode the game suggested is called "Zombie Scenario" and it plays less like Counter-strike and more like a very bad version of Serious Sam. A linear co-op campaign mode is a great concept for Counter-Strike, but every enemy is a bullet sponge and runs way faster than you can. If an enemy gets close to you it's almost always a one hit kill and the respawn times are around a minute and a half. I spent more time waiting to respawn than actually playing the game. It is impressive that they managed to have dozens of enemies chasing you at once on the [i]Half-Life 1 Engine[/i] and I generally like games where you have to backpedal while managing a crowd but killing an enemy is nigh-impossible unless you manage to stay with your squad and you're all focused on the same one. Enemies can knock you very far away so even trying to concertedly focus on one bad guy isn't viable most of the time. Headshots do significantly more damage and pulling one off does stall an enemy a bit, but not by mcuh. The level finished off with a boss fight in a cordoned-off arena and the Boss seemed to take damage much faster than the regular enemies in the level that preceded it. This was  fun at first but I quickly realized he had a massive area attack that basically one-shot kills everyone in the room. I imagine these balance issues are probably to try and get you to buy the good weapons, but making your game deliberatly un-fun is an awful way to get an audience hooked on what's supposed to be your main mode, and it's a shame because it did have some good ideas. 

The main PvP mode updates the classic Counter-Strike Zombies mod, where team of humans fights a team of zombies and if a zombie kills a human, that human becomes a zombie. Compared to the original characters now have various cooldown abilities to spice things up. Making this better than the other mode is the fact that dying as a human just puts you back in the game as a zombie, so you keep playing either way. If you die as a zombie, you're out for the round, but that's how Counter-Strike works so that's fine. There's a version with the added caveat that only headshots kill a zombie for good, which gets you a bit more playtime since zombies don't die as much, but tilts the balance towards zombies and the regular mode already favored them. One server randomized your gun each time you spawned and that was a fun way to see the wackier weapons on offer. The third variant sees both humans and zombies unlocking "evolutions" but no one was playing it when I tried, though I imagine it's fairly similar. These modes are fine [i]fine[/i] but feel too chaotic compared to the original version and even clones in other games like [i]Tower Unite[/i]. There's so much going on that you can't stop and think about anything and it becomes an unengaging spamfest. There's also a constant stream of the announcer screaming "THE ZOMBIES WILL BE BACK, THE ZOMBIES HAVE RETURNED" which combined with the rest of the game is a headache inducing sensory overload. The other gripe I have with not just this mode but other games like it is that there are just too many rounds per game and I think the whole thing lasts too long. That's more of a genre critique than a [i]this game[/i] critique.

Next up is Scenario TX and and it was actually promising. It's a top-down shooter, which is an impressive and creative use of the GoldSRC engine. The first time I played this mode, I couldn't pick up any of the weapons or get any ammo, which was miserable and left an awful first impression. I tried again on another server and once the game worked properly I had fun for a few minutes. Unlike the other co-op mode, enemies here actually die in a reasonable amount of hits. You gradually level up which opens up further weapons and you have some cooldown abilities like flamethrowers and melee attacks. The enemies are extremely simple-minded and mainly stand in one place aside from some robots that shoot at you, so the combat isn't the most engaging, but it is fun to mow down several at once. The problem though, is that this mode doesn't seem to have an ending. In both my botched first playthrough and my more enjoyable second run, once you clear every enemy you need to, the game just seems to reset and I really hoped for more of a payoff since the new round doesn't seem to change anything. This is still the most traditionally enjoyable of the modes, but it feels unfinished and empty.

Lastly there's "Original" and "Hide and Seek". "Original" seems to be classic CS 1.6 type gameplay, but nobody was playing for me to check it out. I can't imagine it's better than actual 1.6 and the real game is $5 anyway. "Hide and Seek" is probably your standard prop hunt and I can't imagine it being too bad unless they really messed it up, but no one was playing and that's a game mode available in lots of other places

What impressed me most about this game is the create mode. They've somehow recreated [i]Minecraft[/i] Creative mode... in the [i]Half-Life 1 Engine[/i] and you can use this to create your own maps. There's a good selection of prefabs to build voxel-style level geometry from and it's a great idea for an in-game map editor and the fact that you can share these in-game is brilliant. I think you can do this on a server as well with other people editing with you and honestly it feels like the closest thing to a GoldSRC spin on GMod I've ever seen. If they made [i]that[/i] the emphasis, this game would honestly be awesome, and I can imagine a late night collaboration session with friends would be a great time.

Aesthetically, the game is [i]interesting[/i]. There are art assets, character models, and weapons that are literally more than two decades old, but all of the new characters and weapons are higher fidelity. Having the blocky 2001 era SAS guy next to a super-intricate Final-Fantasy style Anime Magical Girl running through gritty real-world environments is [i]something[/i]. It's not too far off what you'd see on a Garry's mod server and I do enjoy seeing new art done in kind of a Playstation 2-era style where everything is just a diffuse texture with no normal maps or specular. I actually enjoyed how off-kilter this aspect of the game is, but it's definitely not what you'd call consistant art direction.

At the end of the day Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio, is a fascinating, but unbalanced and sloppy mess. While there is a lot of variety, everything this game does has been done better elsewhere and the few mods I did enjoy still had big enough issues that I didn't love them. It's impressive how much gas they've gotten out of the GoldSrc engine and the in-game level editor is brilliant, but it just doesn't lend itself to anything great.

Very cool game with lots of features and neat accessories. Very similar to Counter-Strike: Online 1 and 2 or Perfect World CS:GO in the sense that absurd and funny non-conventional gamemodes are very popular (I'm not a defuse fan to be honest), and it is chock full of cool accessories, weapons, and skins that although they can be purchased with microtransactions, can also thankfully be earned by simply playing. I will continue to update this review as I play, as I've heard that the game used to be better and some users, who used to sing CSN's high praises are now complaining that their progress has been wiped or that the game has changed for the worse. If any such thing happened to me, I would be thoroughly disappointed. Understanding the frustration of former users, I will weigh the complaints made by formerly strong supporters of the game with my experience. I can understand their complaints, but I can't really know how great it was back in the day, so I can only judge the game as it progresses or regresses. So far it seems neat, but I have yet to play all the available gamemodes, so expect updates on this review.

The strangest game in the series, conceived by Valve & Nexon sometime in the late 2000's as a special version of Counter-Strike: Condition Zero (or maybe 1.6 but the models are very CZ styled) for Asian markets only to get clowned on by all of the CS clones that were already available in Asia.

Recommended for the die-hard CS fans ONLY as it's basically CS 1.6 with a f*ckton of mods applied and worse servers.

Also I just realised that CrossFire (aka the game that made Tencent into what it is today despite them not even developing it) has no Steam release... WHY!?

Played this back in 2014 - 2016, prior to that, played CSO since 2009. I guess I have a lot to say about this game.

Man, where should I start... How to describe this literal "junk" right now? It's freaking unreal to watch a masterpiece slowly being ruined by mentally challenged game company staff and develop team. This game WAS FUN, no joke, back in day when people didn't F-ING fly around like they got rocket propeller sticking right up their arse.

Seriously, when I came to CSNZ from CSO in 2014, I saw the lost and forgotten spirit of team work, where everyone was equally clueless about the game but enjoying themselves at the same time. Then Nexon said: nope, this server is gonna follow what the other servers are doing.

Don't even bother get this game if you are from the North American region, your head will explode after seeing what the game mechanics have become.

I used to play this game during my entire childhood in another country. There were no op weapons and the zombie mode was played as the way it was intended, which was very fun and pretty much my favorite game mode. Now however, because of how op so many guns are, the zombies are actually the hunted instead of the humans. This game is pretty much the world of the riches now.

With money, you can win pretty much most of the game modes easily.

Don't play any game modes designed for p2w players when you are a f2p. Like extreme difficulty Zombie Scenarios. You will not be having any fun. To have fun as a f2p, grind events so you can at least have a chance, and play game modes that does not heavily depend on how much money you have spent. If possible, play with friends.

This game will never be as good as it was in the past. I mean, what can they do? Take away all the p2w players' weapons?
It's a game you can play a little for fun, or simply have a good time with friends.

CONCLUSION:
Unless you do not mind to spend money on this game or willing to grind your butt off just for a little bit of power enough to self-defense in some of the game modes, I do not recommend this p2w game.

And to hell with graphics, people don't come here for it. There is such excellent dynamics that you forget about soapy textures and angular helmets right away. It was really interesting for me to play pve and kill raid bosses and go through scripted tasks. I am not in the least disappointed with pvp modes. And if you collect a small squad of commuted players, then the process of fighting carrion becomes even more entertaining. The game will not replace other mods about zombies, but it is guaranteed to bring pleasure.

I advise fans of team network shooters to try it, fans of zombie fashion also recommend paying attention. And don't look at the grafon for God's sake, it's not the main thing here.

Free to Play - yes, CSO and CSN:Z are free of charge, and you can play them just by registering (for CSO - on official websites, for CSN:Z - in Steam) and downloading the game on your computer. I play this game since obt at 2011 in indonesia version, don't mind the playhour here and sorry if my language is bad since it's not my main language to begin with, and also sloppy writing. (also i spent more than 1000$ back then, might be able to buy myself a motorbike). Skip to TL;DR if you dont want to see me ranting. 

It was a pretty fun game, especially back then when zombie 3 : the hero was the main selling point of this game. It was that time also when Hero is literally "Hero" of that mode until bullsh*t vvip weapon came out and somehow there's no counter to it (im looking at you Void Avenger). Now Hero has access to all weapon which is pretty good, but at the same time you need to stand still to buy stuff compare to when you only need to choose 1 out of 4 special weapon that the hero get using number at your keyboard without the worry of getting infected/die. It's not recommended to whale on this game just because every update they keep releasing more powercreep weapon. For example M4A1 darknights and AK47 Paladin which get powercreeped by every VIP weapon they release. Instead of simply buffing them, they make a half assed upgrade system which you need the same weapon in order to get them (Now they make it so you can use any permanent weapon (except the default one), but it depends on the rarity of the weapons, the higher the better (the fun part, their upgraded guns is not as strong as the recent VIP weapons). Feels sad for those people who spent lots of money to get those weapons from back then. Have i mention how do you get these weapons? It's from their gacha system called decoder. So no exact money spent at how you're going to get a single permanent vip weapon. This is why i decided to not support them anymore.

The only mode i enjoy now is the Zombie Z mode, just because people stuck with classic anti zombie gun early round. It became boring at higher rounds. Zombie scenario mode becoming much more p2w mode. They make the boss tankier and has more bullsh*t attack pattern (im one of those kids that somehow stuck with clearing "last clue" with mg3 and m249).

TL;DR If you're a rich masochistic kid and has nothing to spend your money on, this game is for you. The game keeps getting powercreep easily. It's not even enjoyable as F2P anymore

I gonna say I m bias cuz this game back in Hong Kong was legit my childhood, used to finish school, head to internet bar and play cs online for hours. This is my monkey brain counter strike, I leggit just play for zombie scenarios. 

In this game u won't find skills, u will find over powered weapons and anime girls spinning ballerina with dual hand guns like in Equilibrium, and u probably have to sell your kidney to roll 500 boxes for that one gun u want for 10 days, but then again what second rated service provider online game originated from asia doesnt do that with their shitty micro transcation?

So ya final verdict, I like this game, its a good down time for me from sweaty csgo and hearing a 12 year old kid yelling cyka blyat, but you gonna be smart in here, read all the negative review of this game first and make your own judgement, try it out for free regardless, check the game out, they have pretty good starter pack for like 1 month or so, but dont pay a cent in this game unless u are sure this is your cup of tea.

When I installed CSN:S I was excited! But when I got to the menu I felt like it was a malware. Billion things popped up on my screen, I somehow managed to get rid of them. My first round ever, the map was dust and guess what ive saw. Anime girls Half Life 2 looking characters and barely any CS character. I was dislocated so i started following my teammates. They were mostly idiots. After playing with random people I wanted to make a server. I picked desert and I wanted to edit it, I dont know if im an idiot but I think you can only edit in game. In the end of the day I felt like i was playing a Half Life minimalist mod, THAT MOD IS BETTER THAN THIS! ANIME AND CROPPED OUT CS CHARACTERS DONT GO TOGETHER. To be honest I personally dont like the game, its weird and seems like they threw bunch of stuff like they didnt know what they were doing. I simply dont reccomend the game, if you like its, then cool! Do what you like. And my final ratings are 3/10

After I have been played this game for about 100 Hours now
I think it is the time that i have to put a mini review for it
*let's take us back for about 7 years ago, this game was launch in my country Thailand
under supervision by PlayFPSThailand, this game it's self was super fun to play it is Counter Strike 1.6 with plenty of Game modes and the most popular game mode was Zombie The Hero in that time.
The game was pretty fun and balanced 
-No Pay2win content.
-Don't have any Overpower weapon.
-Zombie mode is something about "Work together and Survive together"
-The community was good, people just come here to having a great and fun time.
-You don't have to give a damn about those graphics you still get a good experience even it had a bad graphic.
I've spend plenty of my time playing this game almost everyday when I was the kids.
but sadly this game launch in my country for only 1 years and it's has to shutdown so I have to say goodbye for it
*Back to the present
I've seen the news that this game will unblock my country which means I can played it again
and I am so excited about it after I haven't play it for about 7 years long.
! BUT !
After I came back to play this game again I've started to notice that many things has been changed
-This game has turned into something close to "Anime FPS Game" (But that's OK i'm still fine with it)
-There is no more BALANCE in this game anymore.
-Piece of crap "Microtransactions"
-The game is completely turned into Pay2Win Game.
-Many of overpowered weapons which can turn you into the dust in Zombie mode.
-The Community seems to be very toxic right now.
So after 100 hours spending with this game and you guys asked I'm recommend it or not?
My answer is "NO"
But if you wants to find some nostalgia with this game I must say
"There is no nostalgia in this game anymore"

This game is really ridiculous in a good way

lots of game mode, focusing on the zombie mode yet still have a normal human vs human and even original cs 1.6 experience [original mode] 

Yeah the weapon is what make this game ridiculous full of overpowered weapon yet still the zombie is always the one who win in the most round

Gaining weapon is easy if you have a good luck, there is many event that will give you bunch of decoder or even permanent weapon

Even though you don't have a powerful weapon when playing zombie mode, newer zombie mode is giving you many chance to use the powerful weapon you don't own [Zombie-Z with the karma points, ZB evolution with the evo point, or timed event random weapon map on ZB mode] so it kinda p2w but the f2p player is still can play and even beat the p2w player

The mileage auction is a great event too, you can sell or buy permanent weapon or upgrade parts when the auction is open

Imho i really love this game, i had so much fun playing this game

The game used to be good, I played it somewhere in summer to fall (or autumn) in 2015, little bit in 2016 because I couldnt get into my steam because email problem. And I revisited it in 2019 just to see how it changed. This game went from pretty good to s**t imo.

1. Its pay2win I mean it always was (no suprise, its modern game and its free so they need to make some money somehow).

2. Weapons are unbalanced for example (if I remember correctly): Thanatos 9, chainsaw and maybe other weapons...I dont remember.

3. (somewhere in late 2015 maybe early 2016) Mileage decoders were f****d in one update so it made them more difficult to get them. Before some update there was pretty good way to get them, by taging missions as favorite (which changed one reward into mileage decorder) and once completed you could choose one of the reward and one of them was of course mileage decorder. After the one update *poof* its gone  no more easy mileage decorder you peasant either get points by playing the game (which could take some time) or...you know buy them with real money because xD why not ?

4. My account was deleted sometime ago even tho I had some weapons, cosmetic items and other stuff because again xD why not + the free dlc I had installed didnt work in 2019 because they removed it I dont know why but ok.

Overall I dont recommend this game because its just f****n meh I dont really like it anymore and yes its a late review.

This is honestly really sad. Before this monstrosity of a game. This used to be known as Counter Strike: Nexon Zombies. It was an amazing game that obviously consisted of surviving the onslaught of the undead in lots of different and fun mini games while still exploring the classic fun that was Counter Strike 1.6. 

After one night filled with nostalgia, I come back to this. The game has become this mix between minecraft and what was once the glory days of CS:NZ. Not to mention that the whole game in general has become a pay to win scheme. The developers I'm disappointed me and I'm sure a lot of other people with the unnecessary changes made to a game that was doing good on it's own. 

I do not recommend anyone to play this garbage pile of a game and please move on.

It's free original Counter-Strike with added zombie flair and other game modes not in the original. All of this with continuous updates and seasonal events to keep the game fresh. What's not to love?

They've added a female voice to the radio chatter (as well as female player-characters) that has grown on me so much I miss it when playing CS:GO.

No pay to win, and though the loot boxes are somewhat outrageous in price, they are optional as most everything can be steadily earned by simply playing the game. 

This game is basically had Valve continued to work/expand on the original CS, and I find myself gravitating to it over the newer games in the series.

As usual, Nexon validates my decision not to ever pay them a plugged nickel. I was a day one player and had fun in spite of it being a normally cheerless grind against the P2W because of the inventiveness of the modes, relative wealth of content, the crazy community, and the basic utility of the good old Half-Life engine. What they did with the account reset - giving people a mere month to basically choose to save their account and all items because they didn't have a big enough tape drive to migrate all the data - should not be legal anywhere. As an extra nice touch they've also reset my achiements when they could have left them alone.

The grind was obnoxious enough the first time. My extreme nostalgia for HL and CS MMO-ish stuff isn't strong enough to overcome my disgust at this failing company which borrows community assets (some sound effects were taken from well-known HL mods!) and then betrays our trust repeatedly.

5/4/2020
Nexon Studio is a rename of Nexon Zombies, a localization of Counter Strike Online which was a Asia-exclusive Online CS game, and by Localization, I mean literally porting the Systems and P2W aspects. The game is just Counter Strike CZ but with CSGO's Montization x50. Here's a review. By the way, this is not hate ; This is my honest thoughts about this.

Gameplay :
It's oldschool Counterstrike. Except crap. The game has so much P2W aspects to it. Of course you got default weapons and some skins you can buy which are more expensive then CSGO's and are NOT permanent and timed for a month or less, but the game is full of Season Passes and exclusive weapons which are Overpowered as hell and give you an advantage over the normal players because you paid $$$$ for the best weapons which can wipe teams in seconds. There is some interesting stuff though, like Zombies which Coop is a nice addon but it is still ruined by players literally stealing kills and cornering bosses with OP weapons and running faster then the flash on crack, giving you no point in doing anything. And all those characters you see on the screenshots and neat guns? Those are with Season Passes. - 4/10, just because it's Counterstrike.

Visuals : For Goldsource, it's still Goldsource. It's nostalgic, and it looks neat. The art is very misleading though, like when you unlock a Timed character, you expect characters to look like the art where they look sick as hell, then look like PS1 Hagrid in comparison. Although it's just Goldsource, and they tried pretty well to keep the engine up to standards. - 5/10, just because the game looks decent. 

Story : There is no freaking story. It's CS. I think Zombies has a story but I forgot, it's thrown in the background. - 2/10.

Verdict : Don't download this. It's just wanting your wallet. Of course it has all this cool stuff, but the game is filled with filler and Microtransactions. It's litterally a Chinese mobile game, except higher quality and tries, but the game feels lifeless and it is just a cheap localized FPS that gets money I had a horrible experience playing this back in the day because I was poor. Go play CS:GO instead, or hell CS:S or the actual CZ. You will have a lot more fun there and you won't have your cash poured down the drain. Of course with CSGO, but that stuff is not needed to play the game. - 3/10.

The quality of this game had been deteriorating for years until it reached this point where it's no longer playable and the GMs seem to have a monopoly over who gets to play anymore.
I've seen some fair players get banned while most of the abusers/exploiters happen to be in the GMs family.
Never seen a game that's full of so much unmotivated hate.

Unless you are an extreme try hard with lots of money to burn, good wifi or ethernet, or a good gaming rig, don't waste your time, it would be better spent on games like TF2 and other games out there. Not to mention this community has gone downhill big time since the closure of Nexons European office. A good chunk of what the community suggests, either is ignored or filtered CCP style to an entirely different version, whatever suggestions ARE heard and implemented, they are FAR and FEW.


The hours I spent on this, was hoping things would really turn around since Transcendent weapons were added, but I was wrong, then came epic weapons, the toxicity from the p2w's then began to truely shine/show, only thing that was worth coming back to was some season pass stuff, but lately, unless Csnz pulls a real miracle, no amount of f2p events can hope to save it, knowing the p2w system WILL drive away newcomers who can't afford it. 

Long story story: save yourself your time, sanity, and potential ingame harrassment from some of the nastier players and don't play this or uninstall via CCleaner

Decided to change this review once again, as i've played the game for few hours more and my experiences have given me knowledge.
Knowledge on why this game ended the way it did.

Firstly, let's start with it's release.
Nexon Zombies was supposed to be CSO fit for other markets than Asia.
How did that go? in my opinion, very well.
The game was popular and was basically renewed 1.6/Condition Zero and the most important thing: it was free.
Sadly that didn't last long, as new weapons were being introduced and well, you know the rest.
The game by 2016, was already being disliked and as time went on, it only got worse.
Around 2017/2018 there was some drama about Keylogger being used as anti-cheat software, aswell as game having in-code spyware.

I have absolutely zero idea if that really happened and existed within game files but the lone fact that players mentioned something as such really brings up some concerns; safety and trust concerns.

(The game still exists on steam so i guess it was one-time thing, or at least i hope so.)

Now, for some modernity: 

Between 2017 and 2018, as far as i remember, the game got reset.
The name was changed from "Nexon Zombies" to "Nexon: Studio" and new terms were added.
Pretty simple right? doesn't seem like bad thing until we realize the main issue with this:

A) Players we're given 1 Month to agree to new terms, otherwise their account got deleted/erased.

- In my opinion, this was one of main factors that have driven community away from the game.
People spent money on it and lost everything in a flick of a finger.

- Developers are not at fault but they should've ordered staff members to send messages (even automated) to each and every person on Steam that had big numbers (hours) in the game, as kind of reminder for the thing but there's no need for crying over the spilled milk right?

Well, like i've mentioned previously, it was one of main factors that pretty much worked like cold water on a cat for players.

Now, time for another topic.


~ The Optimalization ~

The game runs on engine that's 15+ years old and that could be ran on toaster.
While i personally find it charming and nostalgic, as it gives vibe similiar to those old days of 2010s when you would just start 1.6 at night and play ZM Servers with friends, the optimalization for this game is nearly non-existent.

What do i mean by that? The game is SUPER heavy for CPU.
GPU doesn't play factor in that due to the fact that this is pretty much potato-graphics rated.

The game is processing multiple things at once, so many things that it can even freeze for weaker CPUs.
You have the option that enables less detailed models and stuff in "Options" but even then, the game is heavy.
Stuff like particles/effects from weapons can lag the game, the ability of certain zombies aswell.

Apparently, there was another render for game but alas it was removed.
I have no idea why, honestly.
We're now stuck with one that runs far worse than the previous one and i'm afraid to even say it's name or i might freeze just like my game.

Jokes aside, this is another reason why majority of players we're driven away from the title.
The game got so heavy that they would either upgrade their PC or suffer tremendous lag.

I still wish that Nexon would really dedicate themselves to fix this issue.
It would surely reward them in player-count or at least, make current players dedicate themselves to the game, as it would be shown that developer really cares.

End of the topic.
Now for another one:

~ The Issue with outdated medals, weapons and whatnot ~

If you're still playing this game to this day, like i do, you will notice that over years the game did not get any rerun of certain events.
Even worse, majority of medals (basically titles for your nick) has became UNOBTAINABLE!

It's no issue right?
It's just some text in game that's about killing zombies or whatever.

Well, it is an issue.
It shows that the game wasn't really cleared from previous events that might never come back again and then, THIS shows that developer doesn't really care.
It also creates confusion in playerbase, as they (players) want to get certain medal and they can't as it cannot be obtained.
Creating false hope for a rerun of event basically.

- Now onto weapons, many weapons are powercrept.
This means that certain weapons in current rarity grade are better than others,

Example? AWP Elven Ranger and AWP White-Tiger

Both are Transcendence grade, both are sniper rifles.
Well, what's the issue then?
The certain mechanics.

White-Tiger has a "net" move that captures a zombie and makes it immobile for a short while, has secondary mode that basically makes Big Tiger summon attack the zombies, dealing massive damage.
(Hence the name, White-Tiger)

Elven Ranger is a Railgun-ability based Sniper Rifle.
It charges up the more you stay in the scope mode.
From 10% to 50% more damage.

Now, you see that those are both S-Rifles with different abilities and stats.
The thing is: one deals around 10-15k damage per ONE SHOT and other one 4-7k dmg, putting aside that the first one also has secondary AND ALSO has that "net".

I get the fact that they're different weapons with different uses, stats and playstyles (Hence in CSN:S you can just run around with sniper rifle without getting killed) but they should have similiar stats or rather, certain minuses for certain pluses.
No matter the stats, they're in that certain grade so they should have something in common.

Ending that topic, time for last one before the overall conclusion:

- Bugs

The game is a bugfest, i won't lie but it's mainly dedicated to maps.
Maps have some unpatched spots that can be reached with certain weapons, giving people advantage over normal players (probably another reason why game got cold-water treatment but oh well, let's leave that behind.)
These kinds of bugs are mostly present on ZM maps, those created by Valve/3rd-party creators and ported to CSN:S.
So theoritically they can be patched and edited but the question raises if their creators will be okay with that.
Apparently Nexon doesn't want to take that action in fear of potential lawsuit or whatever.

Asked this question on community' Discord and got same answer.

= CONCLUSION =

The game is specific, the playerbase is small and the company that created it has pretty bad opinion in gaming community.
It's like that one friend from childhood that has grown up and changed alot while you went to another city, but for worse.
The game is heavy, has hackers, has bad opinion and is widely disliked.

One thing is certain for sure: It's super addicting.
I personally hate this game but i also cannot live without playing it.
It's just pixels but it's also a part of me, a part that i cannot let go as a gamer.

Similiar to original Counter-Strike, Half-Life or Portal: It's childhood in some form.
It's hate-love relationship.

Overall, 6/10

This review is more a rant than a review so please don't get salty about this.

[3]This game turned into a p2w sh*tfest with a crappy "minecraft with guns" mode called studio mode.
You need to pay to get building guns to build faster and a "scanner" equally to middle click in minecraft for 7.00-- !?
[4] Very, very grindy. Most of the players play those "farming" maps where you barely get anything worth the time.

I used to play this game a while back, it was quite fun. I amassed a collection of weapons I earned but after returning to the game in 2020 it doesn't quite meet the standards of today's CS games. I played this game when it was called Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies, to show how long ago I played it. I don't enjoy it as much because it has evolved into a pay to win game that has PvE while trying to be a game in the Counter-Strike franchise. Bots were very good in old CS and made it feel like an actual public server with their chatter. Nowadays, it's just an alternative to 1.6/Condition Zero and is much more overshadowed after Global Offensive went free-to-play. I can't recommend this today.

Right lads, if you're thinking of playing this game let me give you seven words that will hopefully make you reconsider. "Please for the love of Christ don't" 

This game is a load of shit even when you have friends to play with. Allow me to introduce you to the decoder system. 

Every new day the game rewards you for putting up with it's bullshit by giving you a free decoder. Which can either give you a new gun for a limited amount of time, Or give you a player skin. Cause no one has ever done that before. How original! 

You can use the weapon for 25 days. Or you can level up with gears and blueprints to get to an astonishing 80 days! Thanks valve! Very cool! And for the player skins, it's a mess. Those you get to keep supposedly. I got a player skin of a woman that was wearing a translucent dress. I didn't want this but for some reason the skin automatically applied itself. So for the rest of the time playing this game, I was forced to run around in the dreary. awful, and downright disgusting game world as some asian woman whom to some with poor eyes looked completely nude. Thanks Valve! Not cool at all!

Now onto the game world.

The game looks like a 3rd person perspective of someone filming an action movie with a camera whose lens was smothered in vaseline. I think they should change the tag from "FPS" to "FFS" so it reads "For f*cks sake"

Onto zombies.

ALL THE ZOMBIES LOOK THE SAME WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE SPECIAL ZOMBIES THAT LOOK LIKE THE SPECIAL ZOMBIES FROM LEFT 4 DEAD BUT IF THEY HAD DOWN SYNDROME.

When playing this game, it's important to keep in mind that what you're putting in is time. Time you could've spent with your mother. Trust me I played 126 agonizing hours of this bullshite.
CANT STOP PLAYING !!

Terrible P2W and borken game, the actual cost of this game is $120+ euros. Once you paid and got the best weapon in game, you can dominate the whole battlefield. Getting 10+ kills with just simply clicking one single button, the weapons can even protect you 360 from all directions, so don't bother trying to get those P2W players in game from behind, as you will get killed instead. Game mechanics is so broken, reporting and vote kicking system is completely useless and I doubt the developers who designed those systems do actually have a brain. There's 'no option' to start a vote kick in game, the only way to kick a hacker is agreed by all players from the whole room, clicked the player name and the system will ask you whether you want to kick him about 10 times, in order to protect those p2w not easily get kicked. But.. what if there are afks? and maybe no one bother clicking the tab button and see who's being vote-kicked? so if you want to kick a player? nah, don't bother and that's why P2W players, hackers, botting, aimbot, skywalking, out of map bug, glich user.... and many more shitty things exist in this game. All legit reports are also being ignored by Nexon.

Nexon tried to cover this up by 'providing' players a customize mode in an attempt to rip off minecraft, but I can see players only using this mode for building maps for farming kills, good designs are being ignored by players most of the time.

So is it all bad? oh Nexon will give you plenty of weapons for free, yeah, finally some free stuffs! Then you will find out those weapons are completely useless in PVP after playing 1 min of a game. They literally will give you a lot to make you believe that it's not P2W, but unfortunately 95% of free weapons are useless in current meta and the remaining 5% is also outweighed by P2W weapons. For instance, a player with Heaven splitter + dual barret gunslinger+ hell hound and a dread nova can outplayed 31 zombies at the same time and P2W players will set zombie limit to normal zombie then you will confused about why you can't move at all and then got killed in less than 2 seconds for the whole round. 

Community are also toxic and selfish, after many years of developing zombie mode, Nexon still allows selfish players to block others and with the 'Anti kicking P2W players' system, you will find yourself 90% of the time being stuck then killed by zombies. And don't forget Nexon put bots in PVP rooms, those bots are also set to block any entrances intentionally. I guess the game's developers are pretty much gay or virus pandemic addicted, as they refuse to resolve 'blocking' issue so they can see around 16 people stuck in a narrow hallway then turn into zombies. Don't forget then the P2W players will 1 shot you in less than 1 second. 

Nexon also don't like updating old stuffs, many modes in this game was actually fun and have the potential to be the best part of the game. Some examples like, zombie giant, human scenario and zombie shelter, even hide and seek. However, since these modes are not likely to generate plenty of cash to Nexon so they gave up. There is almost no updates to all of the modes mentioned above except zombie shelter. (but they fked up the new map on zombie shelter too). The zombie giant was a great mode to play back to the days, as you can become zombie boss eliminating humans or as a human shooting them. However, even a zombie boss with 30k+ HP, the current meta P2W weapons can finish you in less than 3 seconds, so this mode became unplayable. Other than that, some old weapons need to be buffed eg, Janus, Balrog, Skull series but instead Nexon nerfed them all and force you to buy the P2W weapons if you want to stay in the game... 

As I have been playing this game for a while, the game was way better back to when it was first launched, no P2W, you can get useful weapons easily by just playing the game for a while. Zombie mode was not broken as well as many other modes. Sadly, now it's like a platform for P2W demonstrating how rich they are and this is no longer the counter strike loved by many players. But of course, people will still play this anyway because of the popular CS brand name and that's why the game will not die at all. 

I summarized the whole thing, if you like doing the following, this game is definitely for you!
1. Don't mind spending $120 Euros+ (this price is not 100% ensuring to get the best weapons in game, but pretty much enough for dominating zombie PVP and other PVP modes)
2. Being abused by P2W players- what I meant here is, you are not allowed to move and just let them kill you and you can't do anything about it even you have good skills
3. Exploiting bugs, gliches, flying in map mechanics (Don't worry, you won't get banned!)
4. Playing like a jerk, troll and selfish, causing other players to die/lose the game intentionally 
5. Build you own virtual world come with free gliches and bugs, but be advised that a masterpiece build map will not be noticed by 90% of players
6. Enjoy being 1 shotted 
7. Keep doing the same thing over and over again with achieving nothing (eg, playing a map 400 times to get a useless medal)

If you don't like any of those above, don't worry! You can still play this game! Don't forget they have a bot mode too! which is one of the few playable modes in this game along with zombie scenario. But you may be confused why you will download a outdated graphic game just want to play with bots (zombie scenario mode is actually killing bots too but they are just with more HP and zombie model)

What is Counter-Strike Nexon: Studio, formerly known as Zombies? It is a disgrace to the CS games series. 

I wish to waste as little time as possible writing about this anomaly, so I'm getting straight to the point. This is the original CS copy-paste, with different once fan-made game modes available to play, heavily modded with skins and stuff that make your monitor explode in tears when joining a game. It looks horrible because of that and it plays horrible because of that. Also, I did not manage to find one server where my ping was ok. 

From the moment you start the game you will instantly feel like starting a really, really, really old asian MMO. Do yourself a favor and don't even think about trying this... thing. Play the original, or any other CS, but not this. 

P.S. The achievements don't even work. It is the first time I see achievement with 0%. Not only that, but most of the achievements are that way. The first game I've seen like that, and after asking about it here and there I found out that the achievements are broken since forever. So yeah, thank you, CSN:S!

As many have stated, this game is very P2W. The "zombie" mode is just hold down m1 button to win (pay money to m1 faster), most other game mode is kinda abandoned by the game developer so even if you enjoy them, their state will likely be exactly the same forever.
 
They try to change it up with task each month for players to earn LOOTBOXES to get a CHANCE to win an item that let's you m1 faster in zombie mode but most of the task are trivial and it starts to show the cracks that this game hasn't aged well. Other than being a free CS 1.6, it doesn't have much of a merit on it's own. The closest you can come to a fair fight is playing on games that have classic weapon restriction, if not, prepare to get killed by a vast selection of unbalanced crap like an automatic AWP, a trip mine that is invisible, AWPs that can kill you with a leg shot and grenade launchers.

I can tell that the game developers are kind of trying to change up the game with new gamemodes and rewards for players to have incentive to play it but there is only so much you can do when you have to balance guns with unbalanced features for zombie mode but not for standard mode but zombie mode is mostly just really repetitive shoot till it dies stuff. The "skill" of the game is to learn how to walk backwards/forwards/sideways while holding m1 till everything dies...and then respawns again, PVP mode normally boils down to who has the most unbalanced gun in the game or that one guy who is incredibly good at the game that steamrolls the entire team cause there is no skill balancing in the game.

I really tried to like the game and I did for a short period of time. I liked playing zombie shelter but the bugs and glitches that the game developers doesn't bother fixing makes it frustrating. I also didn't feel fun after spending extensive time on the game mode only to get a mediocre reward that I could've gotten by playing a far more popular game mode that I didn't like .After playing for long, the game starts to feel like a chore, like trying to meet your quota at work but here you don't get money, you get a virtual shiny gun that kills stuff faster than other people or a shiny new virtual character model.

It's one of those games where you just start losing patience and sanity as you open the game every day to complete menial task so you can get something shiny that shoots slightly better than the other guy. That's how the game progression works and most of the time you feel like you're just standing in place. The gameplay is not fun and the rewards are crap which is what makes this game a slow descend from mediocrity to boring as hell.

All I have to say is I've loved this game ever since
I've started playing in the beginning of 2017.

The old mechanism and system were pretty much balanced 
and enjoyable for everyone in the game.
There were no lag, nor lot of effects on the weapons that made players laggy.

Just old haggy and classic looking.
Which that's what i loved about the weapons

Of course as every good game, has to make some profit out of it.
And became a lot p2w-ish since the end of 2017 i guess.

But that's not a problem because, they're trying to make it as balanced as possible still. (don't come at me with "the game is dead" is pretty much alive still.)

About the new leveling up system, every level up they give you free mileage and every 5 levels,
1000 mileage with some decoders.
Which makes it 10x better, Every 100 they grand i guess 10.000?... dunno tbh and a lot of decoders such as: top 50, 30 brand, and top 50 unlimited... i don't know why are you still complaining y'all.

Within the events they make, it's still worth playing and i encourage every old player to come back.
(Even after the migration)
It will be all worth, the rewards they give out from daily rewards is pretty useful for other modes as you're new.
(The even gave transcendent weapons in events)

The new systems are pretty odd and .... weird, i don't complain, but something inside me,
Misses the old things that were inside this game. Such as, hand models of zombies, humans hand models, jump increased as your evolution was increasing, dna for zombies which made you available to upgrade your zombie to better and stronger.. 
Crafting, oh goodness... 
where you had the possibility along with some blueprints to get some unique and advanced weapons... and therefore more.
 
And that even unique or advanced weapons we're good as almost the transcendence ones...
The menu was simple, the new one is better imo, you get to filter modes and rooms compatible for yourself.
I can say more but... yea. 

Thats all i had to say.

Give us back the real game....

And send this sh*t back where it comes from.
They destroyed the game with this studio mode and all these new buff weapons.... This was a great game 2-3 years ago, now..I have no words.
