1 November 2019 review below

TL:DR this game is clearly p2w but generous enough for new players

I also leave tips for new player below on my review

It's old CS game, but now has many unique weapon and has different class and character, also zombie mode
Their past name was Counter-Strike Nexon : Zombies because it was focus on Zombie mode and Zombie scenario (In game story), but was changed to bring more new player (According to CM on Discord and Discussion) and take interest on Studio mode. 

Studio mode is like map workshop, making map with cube (Minecraft style) and add decorations for your maps. Currently it support Original, Basic, Team Deathmatch (Also support Bot mode), Zombie Hero (Also support Bot mode), Zombie Z, Hide and Seek, and Play Mode (Free style, like making your fanfic or story). You can create and publish, make Mileage Point, from there. Sometimes the publisher has competition for Studio mode with reward such as Transcendence Weapon or Decoder. Maybe you can make your home in Studio mode for war zone or hiding place from zombie? You can have your way on Studio mode, just don't forget to test yourself and set to public

Overall, you need strong weapon, but they will giving part weapon each day of playing 10 minutes any mode, I suggest you take Thanatos 9, Brick Piece (like Uzi weapon), and Broad Divine, the rest, just take Bendita or Thunderbolt for premium enchantment, both need their own weapon to decomposed to take material.
Other way to gain weapons are Mileage Auction, which held on uncertain month, I suggest get one of from Transcendence weapon AK47 Paladin or M4A1 Dark Knight (Both around 5000 Mileage bid) to give you permanent EXP boost, so you can have more mileage later, you need to level up to gain 1000 Mileage. 

Don't forget to follow any event, sometimes they give decoder or free weapon. Usually they release super weapon until they make the counter weapon or more powerful weapon with unique mechanic, sometimes they giveaway certain old powerful weapon which never outdated, just outtrend

That's all from my review, I'm F2P currently and has strong weapon like M3 Black Dragon, Most +6 Weapon like Magnum Drill and Gae Bolg, I have all of them, it just 4 month account from closing CSO ID/MY/SG server

also my CSO ID/MY/SG account were much stronger than now currently, thank you

About enchantment, now using fodder weapon for enchantable weapon, not diassembly same weapon to gain its material, please ignore tutorial for enchantment weapon

[h1]This is an outdated review[/h1]
mby bit more older than pre-minecraft edition:

[b]>>History:[/b]
So I played f2p Nexon zombies for ~915h because it was really fun,the knockback mechanic was the saving grace for this shitfest,most classic weapons were generally useless cuz they didn't generate enough damage or knockback though could've still see usage as support weapons.

Personally used the M3 shotgun cuz it had devastating knockback,changing the game on some maps with elevation into something that most cs1.6 zombie maps lacked and that is mobility,there you just sat in a goddamn tunnel and either cheesed the whole round cuz OP human mod weapons/utilities like for example OP weapons AND goddamn shields/armor from infection.
While Nexon zombies was solely like a fortress that could be almost invaded from every side by either zombies grenade-jumping or using some versatile abilities to manage to get to the humans,the skill was utmost needed from everyone present in that fort doing their own job. Not to mention other fantastic game modes like "Hidden"(though it's too easy for a vet with a p2w weapon to shred the hidden within seconds defeating the point) and others.
The only gripe I had with this game was it's P2W status that I managed to circumvent not paying a dime through crafting sub-par weapons and taking part in some events that awarded me "good weapons" though still not enough to match p2w level which did put me off many a times from continuing to play,nonetheless I kept playing for the glorious mini-games.

The reason I'm not recommending this game is because I've ran into the issue of the Devs deleting accounts wholesale with only 13 days to opt-in to save my account because of migration from Nexon EU to Nexon KR that was aforementioned in apparently 2 months worth of notices about it,I hadn't read them or payed them any mind because I thought I'd be able to stop that process when it's taking place,and when the last 13 days struck... I just wasn't playing it,and neither do I see any sense in going back to it.

[b]>>Opinion:[/b]
Would I recommend this game for F2P?
Only if you like the minigames,they're cool though some still might have the p2w aspect,I don't imagine the p2w situation getting better from when I left(Or get used to the much more unsatisfying grind than from back then).

Would I recommend this game for players that are okay with spending money?
Sure,go on ahead,it's still a cool game for those people.

i am a zombie survival and fps lover having played a lot of them on the market. i can say this is far from a game i would recommend for the following reasons.

1. the graphics look outdated for even a game from 2014.
2. the game is sort of mill leading in terms of what they mean by hordes or zombies to which most people would think of Call Of Duty type of thing. this should be explained in the description.
3. way too many updates in one day to make it worth the time waiting to play it.
4. the screen size doesn't actually go as high as 2160p (not in terms of graphics quality but in just how clear the visuals look, so it looks stretched once it enlarges to that size in full screen.
5. the menu is way too small and all over the place to know where your going with too many popups. this confuses alot of people as it means they can't just start a game without spending so much time in the menu's
6. when playing the game it can make you unsure what or where your going in order to for eg. kill the zombies. and because there is not a great deal of depth of field in the sound you never really know how far you have to go and if it is above of below you.
i basically spent 10 minutes in the menu's and about 1 minute in an actual game and then uninstalled because of all these games. so for this i would not bother installing it but ill leave that choice down to you.

This game is cool and has a lot of potential, just give it a try and maybe spend some bucks on it and play with the right people then you will definitely like it.

The game has the original CS 1.6 modes and it has the same graphics but the design of most of the weapons is just epic.
The community of this game isn't the best, you'll definitely find toxic dudes but you'll also find good players.
Lots of cool events and a good amount of free stuff.
The game isn't balanced TBH especially in zombie modes.
Some achievements/medals requires spending money or  ridiculous amount of time.
The game has a serious amount of bugs that need to be fixed.
Despite all the disadvantages, the game somehow is still enjoyable that's why it can become one of the most popular games if the developers took good care of it.

A little update on the review, since someone really wants one.

To sum up this game, I'll tell you one thing. I played this when I was 12 and I somehow enjoyed it, reason being, I was a retarded kid. But from what I know and remember, this game should NOT be carrying the title of "Counter-Strike", as it is literally PAY TO WIN. You can purchase cases that not only can give you skins, but also WEAPONS (which can also be temporary lol).
The single fact that it's p2w already makes it get a thumbs down from me. But wait... Why did the game suddenly change from "Zombies" to "Studio"? Hah, SO THE DEVS CAN CHARGE MORE MONEY IN DIFFERENT WAYS! GENIUS!
The only reason why I played this game for the tiny amount of time I did was because it was free to play and had fun zombie games, but if you have a brain, you will get the VCP (valve complete pack) for dirt cheap, download CS:S, go on a zombiemode server and have WAY more fun than you'll have here.
Need I say more? This is EA level bullshittery on Steam and a complete disgrace to CS.

Ironically spent $100 ish back when CSO Indonesia still operates. Nexon also didn't open data transfer service during closure on purpose to get more profit from their P2W gambling business practice. 

ZS and ZM were decent as well back then, until Nexon release more powerful zombies (with smaller hitboxes and powerful buffs) for absolutely free to use while also almost not buffing weapons to against with to encourage players to roll gachas more to obtain even powerful weapons with lower jackpot RNG probabilities.

Meanwhile TDM, Original, and Basic Mode became trainwreck with existing 'experimental' weapon releases unless if you use classic weapon only restriction. Then again, only few would rather to play it w/ Classic Weapon / Non latest Weapon only restrictions.

Knowing Nexon's bad business practice by starting to close down non mobile F2P games in order to gain better profit, it's for the best you should not spend any dime on this crap game.

So, what are pros from all negatives thought I have expressed?
+ Free classic weapons to use
+ Actually F2P as long as you only touch TDM/DM/Original/Basic Mode with Classic Weapons only restriction, including some misc. modes such as Studio Mode, Zombie File, etc.
+ Freebies can be generous at some point
+ Lots of alternatives to obtain permanent weapons despite it will involve lots of times of grinding
+ Decent amount of dedicated servers available to play across the world
+ Older weapons are cheapskates to purchase now, especially Air Buster (still not gonna buy it but yeah there's that)
+ [spoiler]Playable hs_mosque map which allows you to turn a Mosque into shooting gallery for no reason (It's actually referenced from Sultan Ahmed Mosque located in Turkey. It's also unavailable for Indonesia and SG/MY server back then to prevent religious controversial issue.)[/spoiler]

Pros:
-for old players, it's a nostalgia
-eye candy characters
-nice presentation overall

Cons:
-pay2win
-there's no concept of balance in the new weapons, melees have very long range, gives me a ptsd of another broken p2w game that died recently(which i desperately tried to support even though the devs are just milking their younger players)
-they're giving away free permanent stuff, it's a sign that they are desperate and the game is dying
-the weapon knockback is too much, it needs to be reduced by 90%, the stopping power of the weapons are already too good, theres too many times where i was sent flying across the map, as if the game has its own mind lol what have u done with the goldsource engine nexon wtf
-no good maps designed for zombie mode

Additional note:
If they truly care about the players, they should look into the zombie mode in counter strike 1.6 that are constantly updated by communities, since they're the most balanced zombie mod ever.

And also to players that play this game, just play cs 1.6 modded servers, there's no point in trying to support a game that doesn't balance its items, it would make more sense if the game is only pve zombies, but this is pvp.

What the hell? This is basically that one Counter Strike mod I've played back in high school! I felt the nostalgia right away after hopping in a match from the tutorial window. But it feels very very different and I don't know if I like it or not. I've only spent like 20 minutes into the game and already I felt doubts.

I noticed that one of the gamemodes said "Players must transform into a random object and hide from the Seeker. It's a very different kind of fun from other modes!", so I assumed "Oh, so it's basically like Gmod Prop Hunt? Must be fun I'll try this one" I entered one match, and... what the fuck? IT'S JUST ANOTHER HUMAN VS ZOMBIE MATCH!

I'm done.
Nope nope nope...

COUNTER-STRIKE NEXON: ZOMBIES is one of the worst mods CS that I've seen. The objective of the game is to a) Survive as a human and kill all zombies b) Kill humans and turn them into zombies.

Gameplay-wise, it's like CS. If human, kill zombies. If zombie kill human. If a human gets killed by a zombie, the human turns into another zombie. It's like any other Garry's Mod. The game also seems greatly botted.

Conclusion, just skip this nonsense. There's a rumour that a whole lot of former players complaining that Nexon deleted their accounts while they were playing and made them lose their money.

After 1300+ hours in this game..... finally got a conclusion.

For F2P( Free To Play Users)
Positive: Deathmatch, Achievements, Original Modes, just require only skills(aim,game sense).
Negative: Zombie Mode mostly in Human side is P2W( Pay To Win), New,Good,Nice,Amazing,God,Overpowered Weapons = Real Money and many toxic players!
If you're here for fun it's ok, because this game is free. If you're here to have the "best weapons" NOT RECOMMEND.

For P2W ( Pay To Win Users)
Positive: Everything
Negative: CSNZ is smart every 6 months they add a better weapon = RIP WALLET

So in my conclusion I would say 5/10 on this game! RIP MY $$

2nd part fo the review:

I dont normally do this part because there is no need in most cases, but this game is such a fucking typical P2W i have to say something. I only played it for about 10 hours and the game is so fucking boring that a bus drive from New York to LA without stopping is more entertainging than this piece of shit. If you dont spend money on this game, you dont get shit. The worst guns in the game are given to you at the start and theyre not even permanent. You have to fucking pay to make them permanent. The lag on the servers is so bad i wanted to vomit. The Gameplay is so chaotic you would need lightning speed reflexes to do anything and dont die in about 3 seconds from the round starting. The game runs on Gold Source (Half Life engine), but it looks like a really bad PS2 game. 

Overall rating : Fallout76 / 10

Well, well, well, this is the WORST FPS of all time. I started playing it in 2016, it was a really cool game with lots of gamemodes and guns. Even though it was always P2W there was always a chance to win these players who bought cheat items from shop and anyway it was fun. I liked playing classic gamemodes and also zombie scenarios, it was so interesting. The game was averaging like 2-3k players which was a lot. But then I don't remember the year, probably 2018 everything changed.

The servers of the game moved to another country and you know what? You had 2 or 4 weeks to join into the game and accept the transfer or your account would be COMPLETELY ERASED without refund. I didn't even know about it, so I lost my 50lvl account with lots of premium permanent guns, skins, sprays and other stuff which I got from playing a lot and opening free cases (decoders), never donated to the game, but imagine those people who spent their money on it and in the end they got nothing.

All the cons are here:
-Account erase (happened once and will happen again, because devs ain't give a fvck about their game, that's why the game was so bad already at that time and they became bankrupts so they were obliged to move their servers to another company or office)
-The worst hit registration like you play on 5 tickrate server
-P2W (could be okay but not in this case)
-The worst performance, the game fullfilled of sh*t and runs poorly even on high-end PCs

DO NOT TRY TO PLAY THIS, don't spend your time on it, because anyway in the end of the day your account can be just erased :)

This game is an absolute nightmare, and I am not talking about its immersion.


Pros:

This game can be a lot of fun if, one, you have a big group of friends that play this game, two, those friends don't end up buying there way through this game, three, you have no other standards.

Cons:

The first thing I am going to address here is the fact that this game is a pay to win style game. After launching the game you will be given a taste of their decoder casino which 95% of the time will give you a limited time to use a random gun you don't have unlocked yet. 

Progression in this game is one of the most insulting excuse of a progression system I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. Every 5 or 10 levels you get a nice looking gift just to find out its 5 decoders and clinical depression when you find out you have wasted this much time on this game. There is also a blueprint and gear system which allows you to craft weapons rather than gamble for them however at its peak you can get one of these exclusive weapons for 80 days rather than 25.

Game play is not a redeeming factor either, with most of its player base playing private games you will most likely end up playing Dust II Deathmatch where the Counter Terrorist spawn is camped like it is Return of the Jedi on opening night. Usually in a good Counter Strike game when you encounter an enemy chances are just in much your favor as theirs depending on the situation, however in this game chances are you are going to be murdered by a weapon that looks like it was made in during an acid trip and coded by a 9 year old on scratch.com. Who needs tactics when you $200 to burn.


Overall I would recommend that you stay clear of this poor excuse of digital entertainment. Whatever you do, don't let the free to play aspect of this game entice you to play it because with out a doubt I would rather do a open heart surgery on myself while playing Roblox while listing to I play pokemon go every day at 100% volume.

Very dated engine, not very fun, very pay-to-win.

[UPDATE TO PREVIOUS COMMENT]
Just when I thought this game couldn't get any worst, Nexon does it, brilliantly enrolling an update making the game lagging more and FPS drop badly, not to forget how they ruined the Zombie Z mode which is unplayable anymore. In my own honest opinion, a 5 year old child can make a better game than developers at Nexon, haha!!!!!

This game used to be one of the best games on steam but after many updates, well, things went down hill.
FPS drops drastically especially when players use flashlights and there are no console commands to disable those graphics that cause FPS drops and lag:
- Servers are most of the time lagging and going down, DDOS attacks I assume.
- Epic Weapons special effects and graphics blind you.
- Only OpenGL is available for Video configuration and it crashes a lot!

On the other hand, the Studio mode is fun and it does not lag that much because you control most of the details that affect the performance of the map like lightning, textures, etc... where nexon is failing to do with maps that are decades old now, for instance the Italy and Assault maps.

When other players use flashlights , well, you are blinded from all the bright lights around you and most players do that on purpose to win a game.

I have been playing Valve's games like Half-life and CS since the 90s and I have never faced any issue even on computers that have no graphic cards and this is the only game where my processor is at 100% using 1 core only!! Again, another area where nexon fails again, they update the graphics and worsen the performance. If you run the game and open Windows Task Manager, then check out the CPU Usage under the performance tab, you will see that only 1 CPU is working at high rate while the rest is low instead of spreading the processing to all available CPUs.

Overall, I am not an expert, just observing and giving my own opinion. If you want to play a game that is free, go ahead and have some fun but word of advice, don't spend money, not worth it at all.

Don't download this game based on the advertising. It's incredibly deceptive. The advertising shows a lot of content that is in the game, but it doesn't tell you that this content must be purchased using real-world money. In particular, all the cool looking player models you can see in the promotional materials must be bought using real world cash. This includes literally every single female character model. I wouldn't go as far as to accuse Nexon of sexism, but I will say that they are perfectly happy to reach for your wallet if you want to play as a member of your own sex (if you are female). 

Furthermore, many beneficial items can be bought outright, which means that this game is in effect, pay-2-win. If you want to open your wallet as soon as you install the game, you can get good items without even playing. 

Now, I do understand how free-2-play games work. They need to make money somehow, and so they add microtransactions. However, some games do this well, other games do this poorly. This game is an example of the latter. When you decide to put *all* the cosmetic items behind a paywall, (including the entire female sex, as stated above), AND you allow people to pay for a measurable in-game advantage, you promote a game enviroment where the people with the most money, rather than the most skill, have better looking and better equipped characters.

Edit and tl;dr:
The game is free, for fans of the genre and CS in general I would say try it, but don't try to pry in too much, it's just not worth it. Literally pay-to-win mechanics in the form of loot boxes which are pretty expensive and constantly coming out with better weaponry. Just when you thought you caught up with the trend - you get left behind again and there are items that cannot be obtained by any means necessary unless you pay. It does have it's charm - mashing zombies with cool overpowered weapons, feeling strong, and collecting rare items - but for the most part only for a certain period of time and NOT forever. The game has players but the attention is pretty one-sided, centered towards certain game modes. It has a leveling system and the game releases events which reward even free-to-play players but not enough. Overall - don't.

Score - 4.5/10

Counter-strike Nexon: Zombies is a free to play game, and you don't have to pay anything and still be able to play it with accessing almost all of its features, however there is a pay to win factor - decoders. They are like chests/loot boxes, whatever you want to call them and they give you the new weapons and classes most of the time. If you are veteran on the original Counter-strike and know one or two things, then you should be fine even in the zombie modes, but keep in mind there are lot of people who pay a lot, and receive all the good stuff a lot faster and secure. Also there are some weapons that you can't get unless you pay - premium weapons. On the other side the developers give a lot of free stuff as well- weapons, decoders, classes, costumes, currency on occasionally often events in which you just have to play ( most of the time ) . So I can say fair enough. The balance in the game is fair enough as well, if you keep in mind all the overpowered weapons, which can be surpassed. It offers a great variety of gameplay choices, but to be honest, recently the most popular and played ones are zombie hero, original ( pretty much old CS with no extra rules, or op weapons ) and here and there zombie escape, or deathmatches. The overall population is pretty decent, even nowadays and the community is pretty good as well, as long as you find the right family ( kind of like a guild or team ) or room ( server ), but ofc there are those cases where people in the age of 10-12 years old appear or just someone who is really pissed off the game, or his life and lets out everything, but to be honest, those kind of players are everywhere so...yeah. In conclusion I want to say that I recommend the game and I personally really enjoy and love it, and while I rage sometimes too, over being oneshoted, I cool off pretty fast. The amount of skill you have is rewarding pretty often, and even being f2p can offer you some good weapons and items, which are to your taste, as long as you are patient, and have a little bit of luck. Just to add I am a f2p, except 20$ that i put into the game, which were really paid off with good luck, and everything else is f2playing for like a 4-5 months and I have some of the best weapons in game, a whole new class, and some really cool accessories as well, playing at events or just receiving rewards out of the blue. If you have read everything and reached this point then I thank you very much dear lady or gentleman! :)

After 400 hours of playing including more hours on another account, I have decided to write a fully detailed review of this game. I will be going over the pros and cons of Counter Strike: Nexon Zombies. This may be a long review so bear with me on this.
I'm going to start with the pros of this game to keep this review on sort of a positive note.

    Pros: One of the pros of this game is that it is absolutely free. This makes it the only game in the Counter Strike series that is actually free. But while it also being free it is the only counter strike game as far as I know with DLC. Another pro I have for this game as it sort of combines the layouts of multiple CS games prior to this. 

     With the core gun look coming from Condition Zero, along with the gun looks. There are a lot more looks that are borrowed from previous installments and added to this game. Adding on to the pros this game has a multitude of modes. This game is absolutely full of modes and things to play as. Which for other cs games having it only pushed to a few modes (If you don't include community maps and modes etc.) This leaves room for a lot of time to be put into this game without the ability of getting bored on paper. While this is a good thing on paper it does have some flaws which I will go over during the cons. 
    Finally the last pro would be that it has more guns than in any other cs game. Nexon went all out on this game when it came to guns. It has almost infinitely more guns and to get them all would take a great amount of time. However this is also a major con, but I will keep things positive here. The guns all have different ideas and looks to them and different purposes of said guns. Even have a lazer shooting pistol apparently made by aliens. This is something you will never find in any other CS game. 

     Now with all of these positives you might be thinking, "Hey this game seems excellent, what can really be that bad about it?". Sadly there are a lot of cons holding this game back from being amazing. I will go over them now.

Cons: So time to start for the first con and this is probably one of the biggest. The first con for this game would be gun balancing. I brought up in the Pros that there were a lot of guns. However there is little balancing to any of the guns. With little spray pattern to any of them. A lot of the guns either being absolutely overpowered to the point of being able to shoot through solid walls with only small damage debuffs. With other guns being to the point of being so bad they are basically unusable. The hit registration on this game is also extremely broken and nasty. Me having an uncountable of times when shots should have registered or should have hit.
     If Nexon would decide to actually stop making more guns and try to balance all the guns to where they arent absolutely op and terrible. It would definitely improve the experience of this game. Now for the next Con this con would be the absolutely terrible system of doing things. If you are wondering what I'm referring to I'm talking about the kicking, matchmaking, and other basic elements in the game. 
    The kicking system looks like a pretty cut and clean system but what hides underneath of it is a terrible and flawed algorithm. it requires an extensive amount of votes to kick anyone and just like csgo if literally 3 people vote no on a team of around 15 the vote will cancel and the kick will fail. Now there is a matchmaking system to where you can queue for a game. However everytime I try to go in it the time it tremendously long and to be honest would just be better if it were removed and just continued the manual searching. 
    This con was personally devastating to multiple people which was the server migration. The migration in general was just messy, and terribly flawed. If you were inactive in the time of the migration all of your items every single one of them would be gone. Nexon should have allowed support tickets for any loss of items but sadly that was not the case. Another con for the game would be that new players would be forced to play against higher levels. This will often lead to a high lack of fun for newer players having their extremely underpowered base guns going against guns that can literally shoot through walls. 

   There are more pros and cons to this game however I will end this review on my ending note. My ending note on this game is that it has the ability to be an excellent game. It probably has the most potential of any cs game to become one of the greats. This game just really needs to be polished and edited to where guns are more balanced and everything is fixed. I am expecting great things for the ranked mode once it comes out I will edit my review once it goes live. 
Thank you for reading this review, and I hope you have a good day.

A wonderfully retro adapted fps, perfect for grind-core players.
I have not met a better input for achievement and collection.
You have access to collectables labeled decoders that have a small chance to give permanent weapons, perfect for gamblers.
I do admit I miss the weapons crafting system with durables and what not, but what can you do?
The actually huge variety of gamemodes leaves the game endless with discovery.
Once all is done, you have all the guns you want, level, and boredom depleted, you will have even more to look forward to at the benefit of the structuralized updating schedule, NOT TO MENTION THE AMAZING DAILY DISTRIBUTION FEATURES.
To sum up, great fps, would love to see more.

But anyway, I gave it a thought and a second try, since it is my lovely, deary CS1.6. And i have to say It felt good. I had fun even in the zombie modes where as i remember was a p2w situation. I got a lot of stuff for the time i played and a chance to compete with the 'rich' bois. 
I love the Zombie Z mode because i can randomly get weapons that i don't have. I love the mutations but im not sure if it's better to get them randomly, i think it would be cool if i can choose and combine my mutations (maybe different varieties on different levels or something like that).
The new Prop hunt like mode is quite fun. Needs some more work on it in my opinion, but its a fresh breeze for now.

But yeah... add them.. even as a skin for $.

Just going to say from the start, that the actual GAME itself isn't that bad, and if you have friends to play with its a good time.  The graphics are old but that doesn't take away from it and gives it uniqueness.  If you play with randoms in PvE you wont have the best time, but PvP and you'll still have enjoyment on your own.  

Now that my opinion on the game itself is here, lets adress why I STRONGLY reccomend you NOT to download this game, or at the very least to NOT support the developers. 

A few months ago this game underwent a server migration which you can read more about here ---> https://steamcommunity.com/games/273110/announcements/detail/1655510866879925331
In this migration, if you didn't notice the notification for it so you could opt into the migration, everything you had would be 'PERMANENTLY DELETED'.  This meaning, if you spent any money wether it be $0.29 or $100 worth of guns, characters, accessories, etc. would be wiped as well.  Had this company even CARED about their player base, they could at least issue the value of in-game items to what you spent over the years of you playing the game to anyone who sent in a support ticket with proof of how much they had spent in game.  I myself sent in a ticket with this issue and provided the information of how much I had spent along with my steam purchase history to prove that it was to CSNZ, I was greeted with a copy/paste response saying how it was MY fault and that they can't do anything about it.  From the poor decision of this company, MANY players lost hundreds even THOUSANDS of hours worth of grinding for, levels, equipment, guns, and characters.  This decision had absolutely ZERO thought and NO respect for the players, put your time into a game where the developers would at least allow you to keep the things you've accumulated over time.

Do Not Get Sucked in! 
DO NOT!
**EXTREMELY PAY TO WIN**

  I am warning you now, this game is hyper pay to win and generally not a good experience. There is more than enough free FPS zombie and coop PvP games on steam to supplement this one. 

  The game is primarily monetized by a system called "decoders" these said "decoders" are essentially just loot boxes with god awful chances of you getting anything you want. The kicker is rather than most games only giving you a cosmetic item, these loot boxes give you weapons and items that directly affect your weapon stats. With the top weapons being extremely over powered locked behind a large CHANCE BASED PAYWALL. 

  In conclusion this game used to be respectable and a great time with friends with a small "fun" loot box experience which devolved into a entirely pay to win monetization model. Also keep in mind that if you drop money on this game (like I did) there is no way to get your money back or any return on investment like there is with CSGO, as this game has no steam inventory or marketplace. Like i said above just don't waste your time or money on this game, take it from someone who has spent $$$ and time in this P2W shitshow.

If you ask me, I absolutely don't care about p2w. It's the skill that requires victory, which I have. I've played CSO before, which is basically the same thing. The reason I don't care about p2w in this game is because paying doesn't give you much other than slightly better guns and gay a$$ skins. Also I can pretty much wreck majority of the p2winners as this game requires SKILL before MONEY. You can't expect a newcomer with all the skins and weapons permanently unlocked to play like a professinoal, can you?

Other than that, it's a perfect game. I just love the rich variety of in-game features you can try out. It also has an outstanding harmony of the old-school Counter Strike with the slightly newer game modes. Absolutely would recommend. Great game.

Such a good Free To Play, I was very impressed! Honestly, if you can't be bothered to pay for CS:GO or CS:S, then this is definitely worth a look at!

Although most of the West side of the gaming community feels as if this game is horrible, I personally feel as if Nexon Zombies was created for those who like Asian Online Gaming. May sound ridiculous, but I personally feel as if it is true.

Somethings to note
-Rewarded weapons can be permanent, but most won't last forever. These weapons last for a set amount of days.
-Some weapons are overpowered, but know that you can still headshot the user.
-Similar to Crossfire, grinding is needed to get good items sometimes
-Not all the time is there a game mode with desired amount of players, but Original, Basic, and Team Deatmatch have good amount of players.
-The inventory system isn't as ambitious as Crossfire (thank god)

That is just some of the things about Online games in general. So if you want to play, know that this is infact a Asian online game.

But otherwise, this game is great, and I recommend if you like games like this.

This game is basically a downgraded version of Condition Zero. It uses the same models for player characters, some weapons (Scout, Krieg, AK and others), with some having improved textures, as well as the intelligent Hostage AI from CZ, with the facial animations included. However, the Hostages themselves have been dumbed down, as they never attempt to escape on their own as they did in CZ. Instead, they just stay in place (like 1.6) and move around like CZ when following a CT. They don't return to their spawnpoint either when threatened by a T.

In terms of weaponry the game doesn't have the Tactical Shield, which is known to be in both CZ and 1.6, probably removed so they can sell it or something. The weapon favourites from CSS make an appearance in CSNZ as well, except they're 5 shared for both teams, rather than 4 for each team (which totalled in 8). The buy menu Packages from are completely absent. There are new weapons added such as different melee weapons and pistols, but these were NOT balanced correctly.

The AK-12, for instance, is literally an AK-47 with a huge magazine and the same recoil pattern, except 3 times smaller. And the price in the buy menu? Stays the same. It also felt like the damage output was greater, but I can't confirm that. Other weapons, such as the Hammer, are outright useless. Shooting the P90 in CSNZ feels like shooting a bloody pea shooter. It's weak, inaccurate, and the most expensive SMG.

Then comes in the character models. The females are always 10 times more expensive than males, and it makes sense why that is the case. Not only are the hitboxes smaller, but the skins all look the same in-game, so you can't confirm what is an enemy and what is a friendly unless you look at the radar, which takes much more time than just looking and shooting. This makes the game impossible to play.

Bot matches are included, and while you can play on them, the bots are braindead and easy to kill in droves. Not only that but the friendlies NEVER SHUT UP. It's the most annoying thing ever. Oh and the game allows people to keep spamming you invitations to their server rooms which is just annoying as all hell.

The tutorials don't teach you nearly enough for you to be able to play the game. It's just movement and basic stuff, no practice other than the Bot matches you can do outside of the tutorial.

Zombie mode is the worst part of the game. Don't even bother.

So why do I recommend this game, even after defecating on it thoroughly? Because, overall, as a free alternative to proper Counter-Strike games, it serves it's purpose. If you have CS:CZ, it's a downgrade. If you have CS 1.6, you're not missing out on much. Just stick to the main series games and forget this game even exists.

EDIT: The game maxes out your mouse sensitivity whenever you open it, and doesn't revert it back to where it was. It also crashes from time to time. In my 3.7 hours, it crashed 5 times.

Hello,
I've been playing this game for years now and from all those years I learned how to play this game well.. but.. From all the things developers add to this game that is bad is the Overpowering weapons which makes this game unfun to play and P2W basically. I know there needs to be an income for workers on the game.. but there doesn't need to be an unfair play style involved which makes people leave your games. The weapons which were mostly unfair to players when they were added to the game are - Rune Blade and basically aug guardian. As well as being able to upgrade other OP weapons to +6 is putting things too far. I know the point of adding extra things to the game. But that doesn't always mean it will make the game better. All the cool as they say updates developers made are for PAID users only that can afford getting the best things. To other players it makes the game unfun and unfair. My K/D is over 66% my W/L is over 60% but when playing against bad players with OP weapons who don't deserve to get better against hard working players is simply stupid and annoying. For all the years of playing this game it was going downhill since the PAID only to enjoy the game was added to this game. If the developers won't change things soon.. every1 who isn't a paid user is best to just leave the game in my opinion. This is not any normal counter strike. This is a more wackier version of the series. It is free so don't put your hopes up to high. But the question is "Is it worth it". No i'm not from buzzfeed (I wish). But the answer for that really depends on the user. If you want a more serious game try the rest of the series. However if you like some random game modes in one shooter game that's free, and want to play with friends well this is for you (maybe). It's a lot better with friends, alone can be fine but won't be as much of a thrill. I've played this with friends and can be quiet enjoyable. You and your friends can be in a chat on discord, or steam it's self and talk to each other strategy to defeat the enemy team. Or to screw around in certain servers that are kind of sandbox like. I would recommend it, but it really depends on your likes and dislikes. P.S This game can run quiet well even in a low quality pc, or laptop.

So, im a big CS:GO fan, and when i found out about this game (2 years go), i had already fallen in love, this would be the game i'd watch the most on YT, and although i dont have a good amount of time played on STEAM, i have a good amount of time played on the original Nexon Engine :'b 40+ Hours to be more specific (Took too much space and i deleted it)

moving on, time to look at the Pros and Cons

Pros:

Its a good way for people to go back in time to when games were alot better (Less P2W than most games now) So thats a 1 Pro

This game runs perfectly on nearly any PC You may have, whether it be a Weak One or a Extremely OP PC, it wont matter, it runs perfectly, 2 Pros

>3> In general, its pretty Creative (While staying P2W in some ways) To add different kinds of weapons, thats a Pro and a Con (3 Pros, 1 Con)

We also gotta keep in mind Companies like Nexon still need Funding, as with ALL COMPANIES for nearly anything, If they dont get the funding, they cant work on good games like this, and no other company could if they didnt get any funding, which would mean, Bad Games, Bad Servers, etc

So the Pros outway the Cons in my opinion, keep in mind this is from my prespective, you may have an entirely different one once you play this game, or if you've played it, this is just my view

I recommend this game to nearly Anyone and/or Everyone i know because of how good it is!

although, RIP your wallet if your a sweaty nerd who cant just work with the normal guns (2 Cons)

guns are also ptw because you get decoders from every 5 levels and sometimes daily logins which usualy give temp guns. im almost level 30(29) and all i have perm is two guns which are both complete trash...the k3 light machine gun which deals no dmg and has the accuracy and recoil of a gun made entirely of paper..honestly your better off using a shotgun fully auto to spray across map..you are more likily to hit. i also have possibly the worst pistol in the game the m950 auto pistol sporting 50 bullet clip. the bullets from this gun and its accuracy/recoil make the k3 look good. litterally at pointblank its almost impossible to headshot a still target who has your gun in their mouth and even if you do head shot it would take atleast 4-5 headshots to kill since the gun does absolutle pathetic damage...iv had bb guns as a child that would hurt more. i guess if you dont drop 7$ on a decoder you wont really have any chance to get a perm gun and honestly i would not trust the decoder it would probably give some garbage melee or temp pistol/gun the best bet is spending alot of money on each perm gun they add to the shop or wait till a decent one gets put in. all in all i love this game because it lets me play custom games on old cs 1.6 maps sadly they forgot the best map...miami the bank heist hostage map. they should also add the shield into the noral gun roster. **extra info** if you are new to this game but like cs1.6 or source and am wondering if you get all the guns from the originals then the answer is almost. the guns dont seem to hav the same patterns and feel different but they do give you all of the orginal guns and equipment of the cs games(no csgo stuff that i know of) except for the shield which is not in the game. i do not recomend this game to people looking to have a fair game in pvp and unless you pay tons of money i doubt you will have any fun playing with players who do. if you enjoy playing solo against ai in gamemodes like original,tdm,vip escort and some others then this game is great for you since its basically like other cs games and you can also use any speical guns you unlock in the normal mode with bots which does add to the game if you want to feel really overpowered while the bots use base guns.

After 2K+ hours in this game..... finally got a conclusion.

For F2P( Free To Play Users)
Positive: Deathmatch, Achievements, Original Modes, just require only skills(aim,game sense).
Negative: Zombie Mode mostly in Human side is P2W( Pay To Win), New,Good,Nice,Amazing,God,Overpowered Weapons = Real Money and many toxic players! 
If you're here for fun it's ok, because this game is free. If you're here to have the "best weapons" NOT RECOMMEND. 

For P2W ( Pay To Win Users)
Positive: Everything 
Negative: CSNZ is smart every 6 months they add a better weapon = RIP WALLET

So in my conclusion I would say 5/10 on this game! RIP MY $$

This game has [i]some[/i] potential, but it is all taken away by what seems to be both greediness and laziness.

The pay is a major pay to win. Everything thing seems to either be unfair or just plain unplayable. The game lacks a good UI (every menu is poorly made) and pays no attention to the wants of the player. But if you pay money, however, suddenly there are many advantages to the game. The DLCs for this game are very overpriced, and you must be insane to spend money on them at all. Overall, this game is poorly made, and very sided towards paying to win. I would not recommend this game or any of its DLCs to another player.

I spent $3k+ total ever since the game came out (2014), had all the guns and I regret it. I highly recommend all of you guys and whales to stop spending on this garbage unbalanced game. I think the only things great in this game now is zombie scenario, fun mode, all-star, playroom, studio (unreleased for CSNZ) and the new zombie bot mode (unreleased for CSNZ). The rest is PvP cancer p2w. The interface of the game sucks now because Nexon EU is forced to follow Nexon Korea's update table and they didn't realize this is a international community of players not one region. The result of this update decreased the player count and rip NA players.

TL;DR I was a whale. Now is the time to get out of Nexon's endless cycle of OP Lunar New Year, Trancendence buff, +6 premium enhance weapons, and premium zombie skins/characters. Stop feeding to Donxon. Also, studio mode is probably this game's last chance of survival.

~Sincerely from a 2010 Counter-Strike Online Player

I think the best way to think of this game, is CS 1.6 but with a lot of mods.

At the time of making this I've spent 50 hours on the game, I think its honestly worth a try if you're a fan of 1.6. The guns are creative, the maps look amazing and really do show what you can still do with the gold source engine, and there still updating it! While the microtransactions seem scummy at first, there really no different to what valve has impleremented and even with that nexon are much nicer with giving out items then valve, being on at european peak time has given me free decodoers (the equiv of keys and case's in this game) and from what I've seen my best guns have come from the free decoders I get. Another thing I noted, at first it seems like the game is dying but the playerbase has really always been this size, they've fixed it so you won't get so many empty servers now.

THis review is for the newest patch which came out today, 10/11/2017. The patch changed it to where you can no longer (at least I have not found a way) go to whichever region you want, either europe, NA or russia for instance, this is an inconvenience to me because when I am available to play NA is dead, so I used to go on the Europe servers. On top of that there is seemingly no games open for zombie hero or anything of the sort (I'm not sure if i'm in a NA lobby or if they are all grouped together), probably because nobody else is happy about this update or it could just be bad timing. The matching system is slow and often can't find a match. The old UI worked just fine we didn't need you guys to go screwing with crap. Also we can no longer make Zombie games (not zombie hero, but zombie) in friendly fire. Also when I started playing again (after about a year break) they had a lot of new guns which interested me, however it was absolutely PAY to play. Used to you had a chance at getting good weapons by using crafting recipes (not sure when they removed that) which was good because it gave the game something more to it, you could try to get blueprints and durables to get good weapons and not have to pay; however, now it is completely pay to play.

In my opinion CSNZ is tanking (and has been recently), don't spend all your money guys they're just trying to milk this out for as long as possible instead of trying to figure out what the PLAYERS want.
 So until they fix this new piece of crap UI, I'm out. It's a shame too because the Python Desperado looked interesting.

But wait theres a plus, we can now test out weapons, good job Nexon, you did one thing right.

P.S. Going to be selling my account, message me if interested.

A lot of P2W aspects unless you stick with Original/Basic mode. NA server is barely ever populated, and when it is most people have 100-400 ping. Euro server is almost always populated, you have better chance of getting a game with everyone at a decent ping.

Game is going to be dead soon, regularly peaks at around 2k while 1.6 peaks at 15k+. Play the real thing for the full, unregulated CS experience. This game is just a money sink for Nexon.

With that said, it can still be a decent CS experience if you can look past the many flaws it has.

Edit: They changed the servers and added one universal channel. You can use a matchmaing feature, but most people use the custom games tab for the old room list. I'm not sure if it's still connecting to Nexon servers or P2P.

Edit 2: The new matchmaking still uses Nexon servers, but uses the host's closest Nexon server.

I spent over 250+ hours so i can say i can give a fair review,so let's start.

Pros:
It's free version of 1.6
Bonus mods
Less cheaters
Skill Based

Cons:
Some weapons are way too overpowered,and are only obtainable with real money
Crafting system is shitty,will probably take ages to craft permanent item
They removed decoder system,which you were able to get premium items

Would i recommend this game?
Yeah,game is fine overall,it's free version of 1.6 with bonus maps,weapons,mods etc.Don't hate on it because it's free version of 1.6,it's fun with friend.Pick it up if you don't have CS:GO.

Edit: CS:GO is free, game turned into minecraft creative mode? Used to be better back in the day, but it's fun to hop into nostalgia, at least soccer is fun.

Edit 2: Decoders are back, you might have gotten hands on some old powerful weapons but they are nothing compared to new ones, if you're playing casually and going for standard weapons you're safe otherwise you're going to be destroyed by people with new OP weapons. Playerbase is low unfortunately so i'd stick with cs:go.

[h1] About Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies [/h1]
CSN:Z is not a bad game, in fact some time ago i think it was great in its own way. The weapons were actually somewhat balanced and it was more about skill than how lucky you got with your crafting or decoders. But now, things have changed. So many new weapons were introduced, and a lot of of them are just BETTER than the older ones, for example THANATOS, Magnum Drill ect., these weapons are just overpowered. Now in Zombie Scenario it will take you 30+ minutes to kill a boss with more older weapons, but with the new ones it will take you a max of 10 minutes. I wish Nexon thought about the balance of their game more, and fixed all of this, because right now, i'm not at the top of the scoreboard in Zombie Hero because i just get rekt by all these M4A1 Dark Knights, AK-47 Paladins, Magnum Drill which kill me with one mag, even though i have 10k+ health. Before i used to be in Zombie PVP HQ once, which is basically the highest league of zombie pvp players. Try the game if you want, it still has some gamemodes which aren't broken because of the new weapons. A lot of people claim its pay2win, i would have definetly disagreed before, but now it's kinda getting to that point.

[h1] The Gameplay [/h1]
Also I learned a lesson in this game, the gun power doesn't solve anything, what solves is skill. Even if the player has the most powerful weapons which will give him more damage, lower recoil and no spray control whatsoever, the skill solves everything. Things I learned from CS 1.6, they gave me an edge. It is also trully sad to see player only camp or spray'n'pray. I'll be genuine right now and say some of them wouldn't even last a map in cs 1.6. Like seriously, I had my crafted weapons which made it much more easier, but I didn't feel any satisfaction for just humiliating them. You can use even classic guns from 1.6, and you still have a chance against them. Yes, I know, these weapons are for zombie modes and etc, so why are they in original/classic modes?

I lover counter strike and this game but could you make it run on lower cpu like hife life 2

Played the game for quite a few years its well...not a bad game but also not a really good one. All they kinda did was take counter strike and throw in zombies...so a mod of a mod.

Some upsides is it is quite fun to play as a zombie and the more you play as one the stronger your skills get with one. Dose have quite a few game modes and even has all of the original for free.

Some....or menny downsides is that it is heavy and I mean HEAVY pay to win. Like I pointed out before the zombie part is free to play but to do well or anything as a human you need good guns. The other large drawback is they always keep pumping out more new better guns each week so you kinda have to keep spending to get more guns and up to date guns. The other downside about it is its not like you buy the gun no you buy a decoder and use it to have a CHANCE to get a good gun and even so there is also another chance it can not be permanent. To get a weapon to be permanent you have to go 1000 days...I feel it should maybe be less then that like 500. 

Other major downside is that the players you play with are quite well...toxic so doing scenario for the first time or doing Zombie escape at all tends have players that give you a hard time or easily solo it without knowing what way to go. On Zombie escape you get the high level players knowing all the bugs and tips on the map to get ahead and then use flash bomb to make the new players have an even harder time.

So with my experience I only stayed with Zombie hero mode. But even with that there was still some bugs hackers trash talkers and finally pay to win players able to dominate and solo an entire hord of Zombies. Seen quite a few people using big bug exploits to get out of the map all the time but the report never really works and the vote kick is broken and never works.

Some last points to go over is sound and graphics and well yah it is old and not that great it is alright....for a game from about 20 years from now but to have it now is quite weak and stale. So seeing how this game was released only a few years ago I feel they should have done something far more better.

What finally made me decide to stop playing is that I got a better computer, better games, and finally when I felt like going back to play this for nostalgia reasons they slapped me with an auto click/macro ban. So no warning just one day I got on and was banned. I sent a request ticket to see what happened  with my account and it took 3 months for them to finally figure out what it was. So yah if you are going to also think about sending a support ticket for something it will take a long time. I do have to thank that they got to the bottom of what happened but sadly I guess that is it so if I had to rate this game I would do 2 to 3 stars out of 10 with all that has happened to me. I look at the ban as more of something to have me move on and just remember the good old times because with the way this game is going I don't think it is going to get good any time soon.

TL;DR This game is shit 


Maybe 5 years ago, I would recommend this game to everyone. Nowadays, I'd say you stay away from this trash. The game itself is insanely Pay to Win. Money was always a part of this game, but it's gotten much much worse, to the point that anyone with a better weapon than you will make you want to quit instantly. The prices are ridiculous, free to play players aren't very welcome by nexon and what you get isn't going to be good for a long time. They keep updating the game with new overpowered weapons every so often, which makes the previous one obsolete (for which you could have paid an insane amount of money for). 

While this game is free to play, it feels like you're playing a demo at this point. This isn't helped by any of the bugs and exploits people use to cheat the system. Most notably, currency exploits that allow you to get discounts on shop items (Cheaper currency = cheaper items). While this is against steam rules, 90% of p2w players abuse this bug. 

One might say that the game is like CS 1.6 but with a lot of mods, which is true, but only about 10% of them are being played regularly. 80% of the weapons are obsolete, rendering them useless for the past 4 or so years, and in all the present gamemodes only a few of them are being played regularly. 

Speaking of which, there are about 3 main gamemodes people play. Zombie hero, a PVP based mode in which you have a team of zombies whose goal is to infect the humans to win, and the humans must survive to win. This is the meat of CSNS, and if you don't like it, then might as well leave. It's somewhat frustrating to play as the zombies, because the humans camp and shoot at you, making you unable to move, or run around shooting at you, and you can't catch up to them. Almost as if when you've been infected, you lost and you get punished for it. As the humans, you don't even stand a chance if you don't have P2W weapons (and you won't unless you pay a crap ton) so once again you miss out. 

There is also Zombie scenario, which is kind of shit. The zombie AI sucks and the zombies reach you from very far. The lore is google translated and frankly no one gives a shit. Go play L4D2 or cod zombies if you're looking for a zombie bot game.

Finally there's original. The classic CT vs T gamemode where you PVP human vs human. It's alright, as long as the host sets a restriction on "classic" weapons, which will provide an almost identical experience to what you might see in CS 1.6. If you're looking for a free version of CS1.6, this is it, except there aren't many players. So just go get 1.6

So the gamemodes suck, the game is p2w, and it sounds like there's nothing to do right? Yes.

If you're still not convinced, here's a rapid fire of some problems you might encounter!
- constant DDOS attacks (Nexon doesn't care)
- Confusing menu, and game mechanics
- Google translated text
- non-existent Support
- corrupt Game moderators
- censorship on forums and unjustified bans
- non-justified game bans 
- Loud anime voices and bad sound
- BUGS
- Bad in-game quests for pointless rewards
- Overall not a CS experience

Well, as much as I would like to bash on the game because of the overpriced micro-transactions, I really can't. People say this game has gotten more and more p2w, but that couldn't be farther from the truth. Back when decoders where initially released, the rates for the best items (unique grades being the best at the time, with transcendence being highest right now) from mileage decoders where insanely low, next to impossible to get even. Now, the game not only gives you free transcendence, rare, event and unique decoders for free, but the items they offer are MUCH better, transcendence and event decoders having the 2nd best melee in the game, dual sword phantom slayer, but ALSO the rates are astonishingly better for even transcendence grade items. Plus, people make a huge deal out of the p2w thing, saying stuff like "ohhhhh you can't play this game if you don't spend money" and "only whales should play this game because f2p can't even fight back!!!!!" completely false. I even started a new account to test my theory out, and I was correct. You are able to get some VERY good weapons from all the free decoders you get from events, that allow you to compete with a majority of the player base. The reason why people make a big deal out of the whole p2w thing is (I believe) that there are a few weapons, epic grade (highest grade and most powerful), which are unobtainable for f2p players. Only way for a f2p to get these weapons are from logging in 25 days in a row, in which case you get a epic grade weapon for 5 DAYS ONLY, and the free VVIP pass that lasts for 1 day (but gives every epic tier weapon). Of course, the only way to get the epic grade weapons permanently, is to open epic decoders, which are sold on the shop when an event that includes a epic grade weapon is in place. Many people see this as a terrible thing (having the most powerful weapons exclusive for people who spend money) but trust me when I say it's not as bad as it sounds. If every (or most) people in a lobby had these weapons, the zombie side would never EVER be able to win a round. Even now it's very difficult if the human side has a few players with epic grades, imagine if like 15 people had all epic grades in 1 lobby, doesn't sound fun to die every 10 seconds now does it?. 

TLDR; The game is in the best state it has been since launch. And the whole "p2w" thing has been reduced IMMENSELY, with the only weapons not being obtainable by f2ps being some powerful weapons that would make the game completely unbalanced if everyone had them.
People over-exaggerate the state of "p2w" in this game, you could basically call this game f2p now. If you look at other examples of games that are completely p2w like Zula etc. , it's not even CLOSE to being as bad.
It is a free p2w Counter-Strike: Condition zero.

This game will only be fun when you put money in it, guess you got what you pay for lol.

Seriously though, for people who bashed this game I can understand their furstration about balance, pay2win and 3 polygon graphics. But in truth, what do you expect from a free2play game from 10 years ago anyway. I play this purely for nostalgic reason and I do admit I think this game is fun because of fuck tons of weird weapons and game modes (including campaign for both human stories and zombie stories). And yes, the only downside is if you want to do well in the game you gotta pay since it's REALLY hard to grind.

Other than that, I do enjoy the game both 10 years before and today, I guess it's only fair that to admit that quality of modern games are improving, which is why people won't enjoy an old game like this anymore XD

To conclude I'd recommend this game to anyone if they missed quake and half life 1 graphics, and experience how a classic shooter game can be modified to have so much stuffs to do.

It's a Counter Strike game with a very large content of models for players/guns/maps etc.
In this game we have big selection of classes human and zombie, guns from the best Gunsmiths (Henry, Gunsmith) Every detail of weapons is finished. Skull, Thanatos, Janus, Vulcanus, Dark Knight/Paladin Series. We have also classic/zombie/zombie scenario/fun/football/deathmatch/original/all star/hide n seek modes of game, and much more. We have also events when we can get things for free (decoders, classes, guns etc.)
You can level your character and got better things. 
But one defect in this game is too P2W. Game forces us to buying decoders etc. things. But considering that the game is free, so it must earn somehow.

Summarizing this game is new Counter Strike 1.6, with better models and new thing need to test for you!

This game is pretty decent if you want to kill some time. Lots of modes (Mostly zombie oriented) and the classic maps you loved in CS. As for the thumbs down, hear me out. What you have is a CS spin off with a zombie twist. You have MMORPG-like features, like crafting and enhancement, that set this game apart from most of the lobby-based shooters our there. To be honest, I would give a thumbs up because it's fun most of the time but here's why it's a no-go:

- When I said MMORPG-like features, it even included the heavy grind you'd expect from one. Unless you're our friendly neighborhood Wallet Warrior, you'll be spending mad hours here.
- Unless the room restricts its use, the weapons not vanilla to CS are HIGHY UNBALANCED. For example, in Zombie Hero (Which is basically PvP infection (Think Halo's infection)), there's this sword that literally one shots the alpha zombie which has well over 1000hp (I'm not even exaggerating)
- Because of the above point, it's really hard to get new players into the game without giving them a buck or two to spend for themselves. Or you could just hope that they're VERY interested.
- Bloody love this in MMO shooters, EQUIPMENT TIMERS!!! You can "Unbox" weapons using these things called Decoders (Most of the time you have to buy them unless they say otherwise) and they didnt even guarentee a perma weapon until recently and I dont think those decoders are here to stay.  Of course you can "craft" perma weapons but you need a blueprint (Which is a "categorized" system, each blueprint containing their own set of weapons you can pray to RNGesus for) and a DURABLE (This.... thing from hell has different types; 1-10 days, 11-20 ... 72-Perm, and YOU GUESSED IT! Has a VERY low chance of you achieving perm weapon craft. Forget the chance of success to actually make the weapon, there's even a percent chance you even touch perm duration.)

TL;DR Be ready for a hard grind and better start setting up your altar to RNGesus again.

I didn't enjoy this game one bit, and it's really pay to win.

To be 100%, the game with all of it's microtransaction monetization bullshit is a bit annoying. To even get a good zombies weapon, you need to go out of your way to get decoders, but the weapons don't even last forever, making you have to get an time extender (which can also be bought). Besides the transactions, the game is an excellent spin-off that doesn't divert too far from the source material, seeing as the original modes are back along with a few more fun modes. It's good to see that Counter-Strike is finally embracing the user-created material, like zombies, jump, etc. like they should've a long time ago. Overall, i think this game should be played with a fat wallet and addictive playing patterns. Still fun for the broke gamer, too.

So..conter strike studio, what to say, it's been some years....if you enter for the 1st time you probably will keep ond dying left and right, actually scratch the probably......the truth his you either get crazy lucky and win a very powerfull weapon and i don't mean that "30 days" or "3 days" nah...it's either permanent or it's useless, next you need a powerfull class...thats right you have diffrent classes in this game not just your usual CT or T you even got tiers:

Grey: Easy, 
Green: A bit harder to get,
Blue: Congrats !, 
Red: Lucky but not 100% there just yet,
Gold: Ye....i want one....(also some gold's have unique voicelines) 

Also weapons have the same tier except one above being purple, those weapons literally making the user immortal in the right hand so ye....P2W much ? 

Moving on from that, zombies only need to scratch you to kill you or as i like to call it: Congrats you will now die alot of times until either you win the round somehow...or simply the time ends....but thats just scratching the surface, this game also has TDM and Deathmatch and alot other cool but sadly obsolete gamemodes, like soccer....ye....soccer....it also has hide and seek, zombie evolution etc.....

Anyways i could go on and on to describe the game but i allready said too much, so let me make one thing clear: you got money to spend, then this game will make you a god, that his if your lucky enough, then again your got a ton of money so luck his allready on your side no ?, or if your like me, you need to waste a ton of time, effort, and pacience to even get some low end trash loot and classes, but on those days where they decide to throw you a bone and give you a gold weapon that actually kills.....that his when they hook you....the feeling of superiority as you mow down a band of 10 zombie all at once, that his true bliss, to you not the other 10 players sick of dying over and over again.....


And now to really end it ( i mean it this time) its cs 1.6 but free.......i mean...ye just pop a TDM match in classic mode and boom....oldschool cs 1.6 with some upgraded graphics here and there.

So yeah. I had played it before (CS:O to be clear) it seems that not much of a difference has been made. In terms of gameplay, it's not perfect: usually you get very choppy / laggy gameplay experience because of the poor optimisation especially when playing zombies mod (scenario, etc.). I know that it's not new considering its old engine. However, they could have done better. Besides that, when launching the game, you don't get the fullscreen mode when being in the main menu. So if you have a high resolution on the small screen it's better to get the magnifier to be able to read a thing. Despite my criticism, I found it fun to play because there are a lot of different gamemodes that you and your friends can rock on. If you like playing zombies game, it's worth a try. 

Personally, I tried it because of the scenario mod, which hasn't changed. And if you don't really care that much about the skins / player models, you may find it interesting. However, be careful not to spend a lot of money. It's just not worth it. Better buy any other cs game than spend it here. 

Have fun.

I had an older review in this one's place, but I noticed it was outdated in a lot of ways. That being said, I decided to re-write it in order to give some tips on how to counteract the P2W nature the game sadly embraced.

The way I earned a number of weapons (and how I put up with the game for this long) requires you to put in minimal effort every day for a longer period of time. If you don't feel like doing that, feel free to skip this.

The easiest thing you can do to earn things is simply playing 10 minutes every day, be it with friends, random people online or just bots. This allows you to claim the daily rewards - which are often more useful than you might suspect. From what I noticed, they are almost always either season pass coins or parts weapons boxes. 

If the daily reward is the weapons box, after getting them and opening them from the inventory, you get the choice of around 8 permanent weapons. You can either choose any that you like, or turn them into profits. See, any permanent weapon can be dissassembled in the craft menu, which gives you 500 Mileage and 100 extension coupons for every weapon dissassembled. If you get 1000 extension coupons, you can turn any trial weapon into a permanent one and get another 500 Mileage out of that (assuming the weapon supports extending). 

In the case of coins - just collect them every day and claim the weapons from the free season pass. These weapons tend to be more valuable than normal weapons because of their rarity. This is important, and also where the "little effort daily for a longer period" catch comes into play. 

I am, of course, reffering to the mileage auction (in short, a player auction with the primary currency being mileage). This event appears multiple times a year and is a great way to earn mileage or get weapons that interest you. To cut the story, take any permanent weapons you dislike and either dissassemble them or put them up for sale. If the price is right, you can easily gain a lot of mileage. Using the earned money, buy whatever you like. Repeat for as long as you have patience for the game. Profit.

Along with this method, play with friends so you don't have to be frustrated with people abusing OP weapons, and the game will suddenly turn really fun. It's a flawed game, of course, but if you play it correctly, it becomes a lot more interesting and a lot less annoying to have to work with. That being said, it justifies my positive rating.

Thank you for reading, hope it helps someone.

As someone who plays this *casually*, It's good.  It's a free game, and it's fully playable (and win-able by teamdeathmatch standards) without spending any money. I've only ever paid for aesthetics (wanted a lady character), never weapons etc etc- so I wouldn't class it as pay to win as some people are saying. But then again, I only use this for the occasional teamdeathmatch games, so what do I know?
My only complaint is that people tend not to use a variety of maps when playing- which is more the fault of the players than the actual game, since there's a good number of pretty cool maps (and yet the constant stream of dust 2 continues).
Don't get me wrong, Dust 2 is a classic- but it would be nice if people mixed it up a bit more.
If you're looking for friendly players? Meh, maybe not here.

[i]Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies[/i] is a fifteen year-old shooter packed with some new modes and, of course, a bunch of zombies.

[h1]The game.[/h1]
[i]Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies[/i] is a shooting game developed by Nexon based on the classic [i]Counter Strike Condition Zero[/i]. The game offers competitive PvP and PvE modes and content from the original CS along with new game modes, maps, weapons and zombies hordes.

[h1]Gameplay.[/h1]
Yes, it's a Counter-Strike game, but it's probably your worst game. Repetitive models, every zombie is the same except for the though one that slaps you and the though one that slaps you and has this kind of stinger that shoots lasers, boxes with 30K health that require a full team shooting them for 15 minutes and empty; bland levels. The graphics of a game released in 2014 look like the graphics of the beginning of the millennium (maybe they wanted to emulate the 1.6 old-school graphics, but they failed). Zombies aren't for CS.

The game has exaggerated modes and an unbalanced power-ups system. To end in great, it's a very pay-to-win game. Good work Nexon, but you will not get my money.

[quote][h1]Positive points. (+)[/h1][list]
[*]Multiplayer.
[*]"Free".
[/list][/quote]

[quote][h1]Negative points. (-)[/h1][list]
[*]Concept.
[*]Ridiculous modes.
[*]Lack of permanent crafted weapons.
[*]Obtaining new weapons can be tedious (crafting).
[*]Pay-to-win.
[/list][/quote]

Literally the worst game on Steam.

In 25 minutes; this is what happened.

First 7: ACTUALLY INSTALLING THIS GAME.

Other 18: 
Well, first I went through a tutorial. It was awful. Game looks like absolute shit because CS:S is too hard to license.

I wondered; "WHY THE FUCK IS THIS GAME WINDOWED???" But that's apparently normal (?)
Got all of my free shit, it was shit. Just your average skinless ugly ass gun with a retarded description as if you would ever use the shitting thing, which will be in your inventory for 30 days. Then, because I read some of the reviews, I decoded my "Grade 1 Ticket" or whatever. I got some random revolver. **By the way, for some reason every single damn gun in this game that isn't bare tits stock has a name revolving around skull, or dragon, or killer, or something autistic.** That's the only description I can give for the gun, it was some strange pale peach color with highlights. The combination of graphics and that that was the only thing special about it compared to it's 48 different reskins, I couldn't tell you. 

Joined a server (Map is Dust 2) This went as badly as you could expect. The game only actually plays up to 1400x1050 resolution, even though my monitor is 1920x1080 native, so of course it was stretched garbage. Pressing "B" (Hotkey for opening buy menu if you are that much of a shitter) opens up what I assume would've been the old 1.6 menu, except they changed all of the boxes or filters or whatnot that show what family of gun is there. So I went through Primary, bought a FAMAS, then a P228, then I got spawnkilled. Did I mention I joined midgame? Because I had no clue. The scoreboard box is at the top of the screen, right in the centre. If you're wondering why I could'nt see it, it's because I would have to say it's as big as my fucking thumb. As in my thumbprint. So yeah, out of 1400x1050 resolution it took up about 80x30 pixels of the screen, that literally is not a joke at all. 
I respawn, and buy the same exact thing again, because I literally was the only one in the spawn, and since there is no buy timer or warmup right at the beginning of the round (to prevent me from being left behind and spawncamped so fucking hard that I uninstall before an hour of gameplay) I just ran out and hope for the best, with me only being able to buy an AUG for 3350$ (No price tags that I could see). I did what all good russian players do, and I RUSHED B. Nobody there of course, and so I turn into the tunnel and go into lower-mid tunnel. What do I know? I didn't buy ammo! So when I emptied half of my magazine to no effect at the feet of some retard on xbox, I'm left with 14 rounds in my only magazine and my shitty pistol. Shitty looking, shitty sounding, and really fucking useless. I started complaining that it didn't make any sense why I have to buy magazines as well as my shitty un-priced but still way-overcharged gear. "Level 1", some P2P retard says, and I gave up after that. 

In conclusion, this is what I found. 
-All of the players with female models were smashing me simply because their guns literally do triple mine's damage. This is proven when I was double-flashed by the same person as I was in A plant site, while the guy was coming into site from catwalk. He came around the box that isn't there in any good CS game, and in 3 shots hits me for 102. No matter the fact that he was using an AK47, that is ridiculous. In CS:GO, it takes a solid 7-8 shots at that sort of range to kill. 
-The only kill I got was when I rushed the hell out of a P2Per with a female model with my AUG, smacked her right in the face and still took me like 6 shots.
-DLC to win.
