TL;CRC
Not worth it. A wasted potential already trying to continue on its last leg with less than a peak amount of players from the olden days when it had Zombies on it. Rampant microtransactions make greedy practices, weapon paint contests are now a footnote of the past (missed opportunity to score big money because of a bait-driven controversy), whole nine yards. But it had some good modes that everyone had fun playing on. It once had incentive to earn some good items, but it's nothing more than a hard grind to get some good weapons out of them, all locked behind paywalls and season passes (which it's been incorporated a long time ago).

It is better to waste your hard earned money on other games than this failed contraption of a GoldSource hotchpotch, because it'll be forgotten in dust and echoes once the last player that departs turns it into a ghost town. It's a long gone opportunity that is already falling apart fast. Not to mention that being unable to run on my new and current PC specs after changing my old ones is the final bottom of the barrel. You had your run, bud. Now it's time to rest and never be heard from again. Never forgetting the fun I had with the friends made along the way, and the laughs I made from those videos. I will never recommend it to any future single soul, so deliver yourself and your wallet from being tempted to waste it on the junk and bid it good riddance.

I made a ticket with Nexon support, and after 2 days they finally responded to me to tell me:
 "We have several proof of you using macros / auto-clickers. For this reason your account will remain permanently banned."

I'm not sure how they could have one proof, not to mention several proof of me using macros/ auto-clickers, when I have never used them, but now they are refusing to refund all the money I spent in their in-game shop.

So basically I like playing this game, until they decided to falsely accuse me of breaking their rules, and then decide to steal my money.

This game is like other nexon games. In other words, there are overpriced microtransactions to rent (Not buy, just rent for a limited time) items in game. Also, it's laggy, it's buggy, and the "zombies mode" is a joke. It plays like counter-strike except with the addition of this mode. How zombies mode works is that everyone is on the same team, and spawn in this map which is baisically a small square. No props, no buildings to enter, just a small square with walls on the sides. Then, zombies spawn at the edge of this square and do the best they can to try and kill you. Their are a few different zombie types, none of which are memorable. They also have terrible AI, as you can sometimes stand right in front of them and they will not do anything, as well as terrible pathfinding and other things. This game is a waste of your time and money.

[h1][b]Cyzz's Review of Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies![/b][/h1]

I have played this game for years, I played CSOnline Singapura before it closed, and a lot of things changed.
When I first saw CSN:Z on steam store, I knew that I had to play it.
I have played this game for two years and I never wrote a full review of it, so here it is!
First I'll tell the pros and the cons for the game, and then i'll talk about each one.
~~~~~~~
[b]Pros[/b]:
- The game has a lot of gamemodes, guns and playable characters.
- A nice quantity of playable zombies for zombie modes.
- Updates every two weeks

[b]Cons[/b]:
- You have to pay to get the top guns and characters.
- You have to pay to unlock certain events.
- Most of the updates are useless.
- The community is horrible.
- A lot of bugs.
- Old graphics.
~~~~~~~
[i][b]Pros (Extended)[/b][/i]:
"The game has a lot of gamemodes, guns and playable characters":
Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies has 21 permanent gamemodes, hundreds of guns and a lot of playable characters.

"A nice quantity of playable zombies for zombie modes":
On Zombie PvP modes you can play with 13 (including special zombies) different zombies, each one has his own special ability and stats.

"Updates every two weeks":
Before we had updates every week, but now only every two weeks, it isn't that bad, even if it could be better.


[i][b]Cons (Extended)[/b][/i]:
"You have to pay to get the top guns and characters":
The characters with the best stats for zombie scenario are all paid characters, before you could get them for free from mileage decoders, but they aren't there anymore.
With "the top guns" I mean lunar new year's guns (Magnum Drill, Guilhotine, Gae Bolg...) and Buff weapons (M4A1 Dark Knight, AK-47 Paladin, Blade Runebreaker), guns you can get from top50 decoders, that you can only get if you pay a lot, or if you get them on bingo's final prize, that takes months to complete.

"You have to pay to unlock certain events":
With this I am referring to the Teddy Nightmare event, where you could get a lot of good items and decoders, but you could only create a room with this mode if you bought a DLC.

"Most of the updates are useless":
The title says everything, but, as a example, 3 weeks ago we had a update that took three weeks to be released, and it was one of the worst ever.

"The community is horrible":
I dont have to say anything else.
The community is full of toxic people, bug abusers, kids, etc.
In every room you will find players saying things like "noob, f*ck your mother, f*ck you, hacker, reported, banned, etc.", most of them are turks that don't speak english but know how to say sh*t.
I am not judging all the turks, but most of them are total cancer in this game, and for some reason they have a server only for their country, but they still play on europe servers. No one understands them and they don't understand us[spoiler](players that speak english)[/spoiler]

"A lot of bugs":
The maps are bugged as hell: You can leave the map, you can walk through the walls.
The hitboxes are horrible: Sometimes you are poiting to a zombie's head and he takes no damage, such as normal zombies (specially when crouching), deimos and ganymede (their head's hitbox is on their chest for some reason). As a venom sting, sometimes her skill doesn't infect people right in front of you, specially if they are crouching.

"Old graphics":
This isn't a big problem, because the game is old and can't just upgrade the graphics.
-------------
After all, CSN:Z is a great game, but Nexon is a bad company, that should work better on the game.
Well, this was my review, please share your opinion on the comments!
I'll be changing the review often, with the incoming updates. I may even change the "do you reccomend this game?" for the same reasons as I said before.
- Cyzz

If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients
- To Make the Dough
375 grams (3 cups) plain flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/4 cup (50 ml / 3¬Ω tablespoons) olive oil
1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) water
Extra flour for dusting 


- To Make Cheese Filling
15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn‚Äôt suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a ‚Äúhomemade‚Äù touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

Its better to just buy cs Go or cs source becouse its a sh*t game looks like sh*t plays like sh*t physics are sh*t.

Remember the power of the AWP?? No. You know why?? BECAUSE THERE IS A FRICKEN REVOLVER SNIPER WITH %100 ACCURACY THAT WILL REKT THE SHITE OUTTA YOU!! 
If you are a competitive trying to show off your skills with the classic weapons don't even bother with it. Sometimes if you are lucky you will join a TDM where all people respect the old CS and use only classic weapons........that is untill they start losing and switch to the OP Nexon weapons that have %100 accuracy with a pinch of insta death. Pretty much if some one has the powerful weapons in the game they will destroy your a.nus and hand it to you. I won't even begin to talk about the power of the melee weapons. Let's just say you might aswell just be afk while being slaughtered by a one hit hammer or sword that throws lightning bolts. Maps are one sided as the T p.uss.ies will force the CT's into their spawn like a mouse in a cage and constatly kill you till the game ends. This is due to the maps of CS 1.6 being based on the CT's camping to protect the bomb sites and for the T's to stratecically(<does not exist in this game) find a way to plant the bomb. Again the Nexon weapons play a big role in this unbalance as you never know what the other team could be packing. This is mostly going over TDM which I talk about because most weapons from decoders are meant for TDM or DM. 

Zombies?? Oh yes thats what this game is about right? No. Again Nexon weapons are over powered and if some pr.i.ck joins the game with them, its all over. I'm looking at you DRILL GUNNERS!! As a zombie you have a chance of winning,if and only if your team decides to work together. This is only the case on some maps though which are mostly maps from CS 1.6. The maps made for mutation mode are built for campers and zombies might aswell give up as people hide in vents or simply use their power weapons. Senario modes are pretty much what you hear from other comments. Rambo shooting never stops till the game is over,so play some music,mute the game and go insane as you shoot a never ending wave of zombies,boxes with more life than i ever will have and a boss that would take you years to kill(If you play on Hard 1 and up). There are some fun modes which are worth the time,but not many people play them which makes you wonder why they even exist. 

Now let's rap this up by talking about decoders and unlocking weapons. The game, simply put lures you into thinking getting weapons is easy and there's no worry about them expiring. At first you get decoders from logging in on certain days. The guns are nice and kill with ease. You also can craft guns which in the beginning the game makes it seem like crafting has no failure rate at all. Then you start to rank up.....this is where it takes a U-turn on you. You still get decoders,but you start getting the worse weapons that look good,but don't compare with the other Nexon guns or even the original weapons. No problem because you can still CRAFT WEapons... oh it failed to craft? Never happened before. Maybe i'll try again. Another failure? Shoot, well I have plenty of gears,but not enough blueprints. I'm a lucky person...I'll try my luck..and they're all gone.. The game forces you to buy decoders as they are a sure way to get weapons everytime,but not the ones you want. Getting decoders,gears and blueprints in game is almost impossible to get. Let's say you do spend money on decoders. You will get weapons,but they will expire. I would also like to add that buying a decoder doesn't garantee you will get a good weapon. Maybe you get lucky and get a permanent powerful Nexon weapon. You will realize how pointless it is to play as you kill countless souls and make people rage till they die trying to kill you. You will begin to feel like you are good at the game,but just hope that gun doesn't have an expiration date cause when it expires you will have NOTHING!!

Alright, if you are here reading reviews, im sure you are at least slightly interested in what this game has to offer:

PROS
-It's a free cs 1.6
-Huge variety of weapons

CONS

6 years after its release, Nexon's free-to-play MMO Counter-Strike spin-off has finally been released in the West as Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies. And aside from its pay-to-win aspects, which are pretty problematic for players who can't spend a lot of money in-game... it's actually a lot of fun. There's a great offering of maps and game modes, a lot of stuff to do and a lot of gear to collect. Gameplay-wise, it feels close to 1.6, which is a nice surprise.

It's an interesting spin on the Counter-Strike formula, very different from what Valve has done (and not necessarily in a bad way), and which can offer a surprising amount of entertainment. I do recommend it - it is free-to-play and has a populated and active playerbase. Give it a try!

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a great game. I have played Counter Strike Online Taiwan for 9 years and when I moved to NA server a month ago I felt the transition was perfectly fine. The community in Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is great. A lot better than Counter Strike Online Taiwan. Players are nice to each other. This game was basically my childhood. Now let's get into the details of the game.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
The game is like a game within a game. There are lots of lot modes you can play. Zombie, Zombie Scenario, Human Scenario, Classic, and much more.
Good Community.
They bring CS 1.6 back to life with different modes while still having the original available to CSN:Z players.
They come with updates weekly which keeps the game fun and  alive.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
People with money have an advantage over players who don't spend money.
I have heard that people have been banned for no legit reason without proof that they cheat.
The game only have a family list but there is no friends list
Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies is slower when it comes to keeping up with new updates. It takes from 6 months to a year to be updated with Korea's and Taiwan's current CSO updates.
Zombie Hero is basically a Pay to WIn game. Whoever has the top guns in Zombie Hero (Magnum Drill, Warhammer, Dark Knight) usually gets the most kills and the highest score. (just look at my profile:P)

Overall this game is fun. It was part of my childhood. It has different modes and it brings CS1.6 to life. I would recommend this game to people who love Counter Strike 1.6 but want to explore with other modes or to people who love killing zombies in general.

[u]Consider Joining the Family WounDead on CSN:Z[/u]
[u]WounDead is currently recruiting CSN:Z pros:)[/u]

Bringing back old crafting(blueprints and durables) to a degree would be a huge step back in the right direction. It was what motivated me to play. Now with irregular auctions being the best means to new guns I feel the climb to something decent got a little steep. A couple hours a day more days than not will well practiced methods on an engine I'm extremely familiar with and I could only manage a modest upgrade. If you love CS and play lots you can get good stuff for free. If you split your time between games it'll be an uphill battle. 

I got some good stuff while it was practical so I don't need to worry so much. People in PvE modes will often drop some decent stuff if you don't have it yourself so that you can use it for the map your on. Superior to old CS 1.6. Not all modes updated evenly. The entire time I've played there haven't been any new maps for Zombie Shelter mode which is regrettably my favorite. Calling it an MMOFPS is misleading It's a map at a time game like most FPS games.

There are better times to start playing and if you know someone that plays even weekly they could let you know when to start so you can get some improved weapons of your own quicker. Like most games of course it is better to play with people you know or with the same goal in mind.

It's not a bad game. There might be some pay to be better elements, but no pay to win. It's basically the original counterstrike with some Asia injected into it and with a F2P model. Fun game. Reccomend.

Do you remember that time in CS 1.6 when you went up on your favourite zombie server and played all day long killing zombies and kicking ass? Yes? Then this game is made for you!

This game is 100% 1.6 ([i]I mean it runs on the hl engine[/i]) concentrating mainly on zombie situations, stocked up with an arsenal of game modes and weapons. You can play the classic hostage and bomb defusal gamemodes as well if you want to feel nostalgic.

It's fun, try it. ;)
Great game gives me good memories of cs s and 1.6.
great

Great Game with lots of different ways you can play;
Defeat seemingly endless waves of zombies in 'Zombie Scenario' with never before seen content, featuring pursuit style, and survival/arena style, story based gamemodes.
Survive the hordes of the night and scavenge for materials to upgrade your defences in the hard 1-4(co-op) or 4-8(team vs team) gameplay styles of 'Zombie Shelter'.
Be the Hero with exclusive weapons or be the Zombie with exclusive skills in 'Zombie Hero' and 'Zombie Mutant'; survive against former friends as they are turned into zombies, or become a zombie and infect your friends...
Or if you want to follow the original story behind the Zombie Scenario play as Soi in the 'Zombie Files' and discover the real reasons why/what happened.

Or you can play the normal gamemodes with New or Altered maps;
(Team) GunDeathmatch with never before seen weapons.
Deathmatch or (AI) Deathmatch
Team Deathmatch or (AI) Team Deathmatch
or you can choose to play the original style modes of bomb planting, VIP assasination, or "rescue the hostage" gamemode styles.
And you can also play Basic a game mode in which you have unlimited cash and every terrorist has a default bomb to plant, but like original, after you die you have to wait till the next round before you can rejoin... 'Basic' is an easier version of original in my opinion....

OR
You can play Human vs Human or rather human vs (bot) human in this Zombie scenario styled game mode which instead of facing off against zombies, you face off against human (bots, not actual online players) and their fiendish schemes

another gamemode available to play is 'FUN' literally called "FUN", this gamemode has a variety of random minigames that you can play, for example hide'n'seek is adapted to the game so that one player becomes invisible and has to try and take down the other players using only a melee weapon, this sound OP and it kinda' is except for the negative buff that the "hidden" player recieves: on the odd occasion when the hidden has dealt damage or has been damaged it will become visible for a short time...
Now an additional mode has been added to "Fun" I won't spoil it for you so I'll keep it a secret...
Oh and how could I forget, the newly added studio mode, this mode let's you edit and create you own maps using simple building blocks and elaborately shaped decoration blocks. 
Truly this is a game of wonders, however it is not a pay to win. The best player (imm korean) in the game has never spent a penny on the game. And yet look at him one of the highest ranking players in zombie HQ And the highest ranked player in the game.

'Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies' is in many ways harder and easier than your normal 'C.S:G.O.' or 'C.S Warzone' but I for one know firsthand that it is a great game and is one that I would dedicate myself to unconditionally...

Okay let me get this clear why you should download this game and their difference to CS 1.6....
-Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is just a Steam port of Counter-Strike Online. Basically, a Westernized version of CSO. 
-Both run on GoldSrc but the latter is updated over time with new game modes, maps, characters, weapons and skins.
-Yes, it's localized in several languages including Turk, Russian, Spanish, etc.

Now to answer OP's question. * If you were to take a look at the reviews first, you'll see the amount of hate posted by people. The main keyword behind this is "Nexon" which has gained notoriety for cramming P2W elements in their games. However! I advise you not to simply judge it just by the pictures and the reviews (obviously). Now off to the differences:

[h1] [b] CS1.6	[/b] 
-Valve
-Play with community-made contents (skins, maps)
-Your custom skins don't work on sv_pure 1 servers
-Still lots of people playing it over CSN:Z
-Valve Anti Cheat (system ban)
Unless you play on custom servers, you just stick with the default no-nonsense weaponry and characters

[b] CSN:Z	[/b]
-Nexon SARL (permission from Valve)
-Play with Nexon-made contents (occassionally player-made)
-Your purchased/ crafted items work on servers as long as you don't get banned
-Lesser player count than CS1.6 but it's because of it not receiving good response thanks to its name
-Nexon HackShield + Game Security (no system bans, but Nexon bans based on community-submitted reports)
-Although room hosts can opt for CS1.6 contents, gameplays mostly revolved around custom weapons, skins and maps
	[/h1]

Now both are double-edge swords. While people still love the originality of CS1.6, CSNZ provides a different style of gameplay in addition to CS1.6 contents. It offers new maps, gameplay, skins and weapons that players could explore and enjoy.
CSN:Z no doubt has its own cash shop that allows players to make (optional) purchases but Nexon has altered the formula to be more generous for Western players. For instance, giving players 10 free decoders (think of CSGO's weapon cases + keys) daily for more than a month. In total, you have over 300 of them without the need to fork out a cent.

I initially downloaded this game to play because of the achievements. I saw that there were around 100 achievements all with the playerbase that had less than 1% of which that didn't achieve them. I thought to myself, oh man I can outgrind all these guys and just play it out. Boy was I wrong, there's a reason >1% have them.

First you're thrust into a clusterf**k of a menu with buttons everywhere with absolutely no explaination on where to go or what to do. Finally you find the find server button and start browsing more menus that you don't understand the game modes or how they differ from the last. You finally get into a game, and you're jumping into the deep end of the pool, where everyone else knows what to do and seems to have outgrinded the hell out of all these items or maybe even P2W items that seem really unfair. You get killed, and become a zombie where you get some abilities or something but have to choose which type you want to become but the game gives you no explaination on what your abilities do or how you differ from the possible other 12 zombie choices. Sometimes you get the chance to become a VIP or assistant VIP and it comes with the benefit of unique weapons, which the game of course doesn't explain what does what or how much damage or anything.

TL;DR: A total mess of a game that took the elements of CS 1.6/CS:Source/CS:GO's zombie mode games and trashed it with this half baked NEXON clusterf**k garbage. Good luck navigating menus, browsing reddits, and reading wikis on who does what and how and what you should aim for and what you should grind towards or what you should purchase.

I have played this game since 2015, I bought boxes and even dlc type skins that are no longer currently available and I regret it, the first time they deleted some accounts due to policy changes in which I was active and there were no problems, I even received a reward, obviously there were people affected by this first purge, I left this game for a while since I was with other games and my personal life, about 2 years later I come back to realize that a second purge happened, for some change of licenses and that as in the first. I lost all my progress and left the game since it was not worth losing everything again, apart from the fact that it is a p2w game that is unbalanced, I have seen that they have added new construction updates but the truth is that it is not worth it. discover other games because if you leave this one for a certain time you won't see your things when you come back, I don't know if it's a trick to spend your money again with this method.

It's okay I guess

So just to clear it. It's Pay to Win, In every single mode, or you just log on each day until you have 1 week and have a chance for a good weapon since you get 2 decoders.

Original/Deathmatch:
It's great if you want to play with friends, has many ways to play it, you don't like playing the zombie aspect of the game? well no worries since you can always play Deathmatch or Original which is just a 1.6 version. But the biggest problem is that you can use the OP weapons from the zombie gamemodes (they're alot), but I'm going to say they are actually few playing using op weapons on Original or Deathmatch mode. There alot of guns to choose from you can either 1. craft them 2. unlock them by using Decoders or 3. by using the points that you get from Decoders to play Bingo and get weapons that way. 

Zombie Escape/Zombie Suvival/Zombie Scenario:
it's really fun to play each mode with friends or just alone, but in Zombie survival you're mostly going to encounter "Pay to Win" players you notice them by either, Really OP af guns, an Paid character and is level 30+. it's still fun to play Zombie Scenario since it's one of the core elements or the game, it just feels right to shoot and slaughter trough massive groups of Zombies and can be challanging or easy good for beginners and Hardcore pro gamers who feel the need of a challenge, There many Difficulties to choose from and the higher you go the more XP you get. 

I would says this games does it right, but I think they should add a option to maybe disable OP or weapons that are made for Zombies mode from Original/Deathmatch lobbies. It's fun if you're bored or just want to have fun with friends and is a great counterpart of Counterstrike 1.6 since this game is for free and has alot of modes to choose from.

I hope it helped you decide if you want to play this game or not, and remember don't judge a book by it's cover, Never hurts to try right? :D

For quite some time now, I've been holding off from revising my review for CSN:Z, however I don't wish to deceive people with my old review. This game has evolved into an utter catastrophe. Just by looking at my old review, you can identify most of the strong attributes of this game. Nexon Europe for the most part, was doing OK with keeping this trend a reality in the game. That was the case, until Nexon Korea came into the picture to crash the party. Nexon Korea fails to cater toward the European/American market. Everything now is essentially something that you have to pay for. The events which make it possible to earn "free" stuff are there, more so to instill belief in players that Nexon is attempting to appease player that don't spend money; which is innately not the case. In actuality, you'll run "buffed people" as well as "buff weapons," which give the human player the most ludicrous abilities and advantages. In turn, abilities are well beyond the limit to their zombie counterparts as well as the free to play players, in contrast. It is arduous to find the precise purpose for this game when taking into account what it has become. Perhaps, back then during the period of time when I posted my positive review, I would have said that it is without a doubt, that this was indeed a respectable game. Currently however, considering that you can buy Counter Strike Complete or GMOD, to subsequently uncover that there is a myriad of things that you can do without paying 1/100 of dollar more, Counter Strike Nexon Zombies, is nearly minute.       












(*Intial Review)

(Counter Strike Nexon Zombies is the perfect alternative if you don't want to pay money for CS:S or CS:GO. There is a plethora of anomalous and typical content. The advent of zombies adds to the already superb base game. Download it's not going to hurt!


Here is a story of how I met some of the friendliest pro players ever. (This is the only game that I have met such nice players so easily

I decided one day that I would play zombie shelther to kill some time. My team was cool and pretty understanding of what you have to do to survive. To my surprise we finished the level in 10 days when it will usally take 20. Our base was a fortress with traps and turrets on every corner that needed protection. They were great players and we all wanted to friend each other when the match was over to play more however, there is no friends list :(. This is my one gimmick, the fact that you can't friend anyone is unacceptable in my book. Considering that your account in CSNZ is not linked to your Steam account there is no way to friend the person through Steam.  

So please Nexon pretty please add the friends list, the game would be near perfect once it is implemented :D)*

To be honest, this is kind of truth.

There is a very advanced system of dropping weapons, which differ in use.
You can earn them from Daily Gifts, but real pearls are from Decoders.
Decoders are given to player in several ways, but most common is:
- Daily gift for 5 days logon in a row
- After one hour of gameplay per day.
The reason it is pay to play, is that those decoders are also available for real money,
starting from half of a dollar per one. Players that paid for much of them, will get way more better weapons than other players, what causes(especially on deathmaches or original games) destruction of free users.

My verdict is 6,5/10 -> Positive:
+Great reproduce of original CS
+Good additions and fixes
+Weapons skins
+Additional weapons
-Paid players get more advantage
-Skins are only available for payment
-No ability of blocking non-original weapons when making room
the competitive scene is deep.

I have invested a 180 hours into this and this ended being my most played game on my profile... But as it got updated it beacame stupidly boring. Yeah the graphics are not great but from what i researched this was suposed to be an expanded version of CS : CZ with just more zombie content.

Now the reasons it's kinda good i guess?

Its not like the usual game copies which would normaly give you 1 and only gun to use and you would get new guns with micro tranzastions... But this gives you all of the basic CS CZ weapons on level 1. That's ok.
Fun gamemodes. There are a lot of fun and interesting game modes like Rocket battle and the hidden. And i can say that they dont require any p2w weapons to play them.

Now the reasons it's bad.

Firstly a lot of micro tranzactions... The normal weapons are quite balanced betwent them but when we enter the crafted and payed weapons it just gets silly how underpowered the basic weapons are... Lets take the ARX-160 for an example its a full auto zoo-mable assault rifle which can 1 tap headshot from long rage. Someone would say its the same as the AUG and the SSG53 but nope! The ARX-160 is way more acurate has a little bit of a damage boost and its firerate will melt anybody in 2-3 seconds.
Decoders : I can say that they have been a good here and there but the drop rate is just silly... Why? Well lets take my friend who was level 2 for an example... We were playing together on christmas when there was a 10Decoders per day or something like that. He got 5 premium weapons out of that from which were the Tempest and the rest were gold weapons... Me who opened atleast a 1000 decoders and payed for 10-30 of them got no golds or premiums... i understand its pure luck but seriously?
Finaly spawn camping and other cheaky things thet win you the game easily... Spawn camping is really comon on Dust 2 with a lot of LMG and AS-50 on the terrorist side. And there are some zombie hero spots which just seem kinda of unfair beacuse of the way you get to them.

Would i recommend this game?
Yes and No.

This game just seems too much p2w and i dont like those types of games where who pays for the features in the game gets an unfair advantage.
And the availablity of those weapons is pretty low. One thing that might help is returning daily mission decoders back for full time. That might get the game up again.

So in the end i wouldnt reccomend this game if you dont like p2w game's and if you dont like crappy graphichs ( i personaly like playing old games sometimes but this got me like attached to it till i hit 80hours then i returned to Diablo 3)

[h1] Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies Review	[/h1]


Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a Free to Play MMOFPS offering competitive PvP and PvE action including content from the original Counter-Strike and all new game modes, maps, weapons, and hordes of Zombies!



[u] [b] + Pros	[/b][/u]

[list]

    [*]A lot of gamemodes to choose from.
    [*]Many servers to play in, There are always people playing. 
    [*]You can play the classic Counter-Strike.

[/list]



[u] [b] - Cons	[/b][/u]

[list]

    [*]The game is poorly optimized.
    [*]The game is PAY TO WIN. simple as that.
    [*]Sending a ticket will result in no answer at all.
    [*]Alot of hackers get into the game without getting banned.
    [*]The ports are really bad and are impossible to play.
    [*]The stun. Everytime you get hit, you get stunned.
    [*]VIP system, P2W events, P2W weapons, P2W skins, Again, P2W.

[/list]

[*]Free 1.6
[*]Easy to master against unskilled players
[*]Many fun gamemodes to waste your time in trying to explore
[*]Solid community still standing though on it's last few hits till it's gone

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[*]P2W Items in game
[*]Crafting is like the lottery no matter how good the grade is
[*]No one has a mic
[*]If they do have a mic, foreign or little kid telling you he did your mom (See Xbox Live)
[*]Steeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep learning curve for non-clone gametypes
[*]Servers are run on the new age boxes of potatoes
[*]Always someone in the game who makes the other team win, no matter which side you're on (usualy with P2W items)

[h1]Overall recommendation[/h1]

[b]NOT WORTH IT UNLESS YOU HAVE DISPOSABLE MONEY/TRANSLATOR[/b]

I liked this game for awhile, a loot based game (my favorite), and there was a variety of gamemodes to try out, and plenty of people to meet. I knew that Counter Strike: Global Offensive was kind of based around buying everything if you actually wanted to go pro, and I was somewhat good at this game, so I wanted to do that. Then I realized, that it would cost a LOT of money if you wanted to do good. The chances of actually getting good weapons was so low, and in order to upgrade weapons, you had to get lucky to get the upgrade you wanted, and you had to use upgrade parts that you BUY, not can earn normally. I also don't mind the time based system, but the blueprints are AWFULLY hard to get, considering to get S grade ones was quite hard, and it really wasn't worth it to waste a 72-Permanent thing on something that isn't garunteed. Also, I found that it was kind of hard for me to focus on the zombie part of the game, when most of the items that I was recieving was coming from the multiplayer (team deathmatch) part of the game.

This game is the most philisophical and thought provoking game of our age. It's deep allegorical nature will leave you pondering your own life. It is a perfect reflection of our mundane day to day lives as ordinary humans. 

You see the levels in this game are meant to symbolize life in the way that they are long, arduous, confusing, and pretty much look the same the whole way through. 

The zombies, a horrible plague of undending monsters spewing out from all directions and all angles, they represent out insecurities constantly follwing us and attacking us sometimes trapping us and preventing progression. 

The guns you use to mow down the endless waves of zombies represent hope and self-confidence as they are the tools you use to destroy your insecurities gaining the ability to push through life, 

The other players in the game all mindlessly running around as well trying to their own thing and figure out what's going, they represent society. As you stumble your way through broken and confused harassed by your insecurities you see other people stumbling through as well. You look at them and think "What are they doing? Are they stupid? Maybe they have the right idea, what am I doing? Am I stupid? Should I do what they're doing? What's going on?" 

The goal of the game is to try and figure out how to progress through the level while killing as many zombies as possible. While the goal of life is to try and figure out how to progress and achieve your dreams while fighting off your doubts and insecurities. The game shows that with some hope, some help, and a little bit of stumbling around that anything is possible.

/Positives: 
Counter Strike 1.6 modes included.
Custom player models.
Somewhat enjoyable PvE horde/objective mode.
Good controls.
TDM.
A few new game modes/maps.
/Negatives:
Poor graphics.
Lag issues.
Microtransactions.
Bland enemy design.
Poor level design.
Crummy player base.

All in all, it's got flaws. The new modes are interesting and entertaining in small bursts, but even if you don't like them, it's basically a free Steam-based install of 1.6. Can't really go wrong there. So don't expect a masterpiece, but don't pass it up without at least trying it.

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a free to play MMO shooter game from Korea that is ported officially from old Counter Strike game, then they added a zombie mode, free to play model and crafting. CONS: The UI was rather cluttered and the graphics retro, gameplay will be laggy, the code buggy.

Try it, maybe if you like pvp shooter games.

After playing this game for some time, I realized how bad this game actually is.

-There are loads of overpowered weapons that can only be obtained through so called "decoders", the worst offender being a very annoying laser pistol which every noob seems to use in DM.
-Speaking of decoders, they used to drop after every mission you do in the game, giving any player a chance to get cool stuff, now you have to do some random crap in order to even get one.
-Zombie PvP is generally unfair; team balance is non-existent and there are some powerups which can kill a big ass zombie with thousands of health in TWO HITS.
-Cheaters.
-There is a mode called Gun Deathmatch, which is basically CSGO's Arms Race, but with awful weapons. How am I expected to kill someone with a goddamn tiny slingshot?!?
-"Are you tired of playing as the same old CS 1.6 terrorists? Now you can play as a female! What's that? You don't have 7 dollars to pay? Well screw you!"
-The in-game reporting tool seems to be completely useless.
-Oh, a survey opens in Internet Explorer after I exit the game? No thanks.
-Did I mention cheaters?

I have been playing Counter Strike: Condition Zero since 2004 (a few months after release) using the GoldSrc Engine. 

I really like the game and what they did to revamp a condizion zero - like game. Still keeping the good graphics from what it was when Cs originally Started in 2000, but making it a bit better with the gun system and different styles and looks of different guns. 

I also myself, am a zombie slaying addict and adore the zombie modes they have in store as well as different normal modes.

Yes i agree it is a bit of a Pay To Win, but you can still outskill people with the standard guns.

Anyway, Here are my Pros and Cons.

Pros:

- Great feel and gameplay , just like old Cs
-Good weapon system, and daily login rewards (same guns but you get them for free for a day - few days)
-Good zombie and normal modes with different maps to play on!
-Different, and cool weapons you get from crafting or decoders!

Cons:

-Alot of people do pay on this game (from having alot of nicer weapons, i have spent a little money on this game to make this an honest review.) But fortunatley you dont really need nicer guns for pvp (like classic or deathmatch, team deathmatch etc.) Thats just based on skill, really.

-Not as many english speakers anymore on the N. American servers like when the game released in 2014. But still fun to shoot and kill or rack up zombies and farm.

Well, that wraps up my review. Overall i very highly recommend this game.

This game is not Counter-Strike. I mean, it has the basis of Counter-Strike, you can even play classic Counter-Strike game modes on classic maps and only-classic weapons, but is is no more than 5% of this game.

Many people say this game is pay2win. Yes, it is. And it would be bad for a competitive game - but it is not. This game is pure fun: monumental amount of game modes, from deathmatches and zombies to survival and even horror modes, ridiculous weapons with deep crafting and upgrading systems, and recently - studio mode, where you can create your own maps! How cool is that?

As a Counter-Strike, I would not recommend playing this game. Why would you when CS:GO is free-to-play? However, as a fun FPS for you and your friends, it is an amazing game that still gets updated.

Those writing bad reviews don't know how the game works. True it takes some getting used to. This is not a pay to win game. In fact the way the store is set up it is more a pay to lose your money. You only get more chances to randomly get a weapon. It will not simply give you a weapn you want.

Second the weapons are well balanced, though there are some weapons that really suck. If some one uses a laser gun, it is still well balanced just a bit cooler that the rest. An mk47 will still work well against a laser.

The game has a great reward system. It takes a while to get many of the rewards. Its a play to win game. The more you play the greater the rewards. I have played the game for over 700hrs and support this game. I would gladly reccomend this game to my friends, and have done so.

you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients
- To Make the Dough
375 grams (3 cups) plain flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/4 cup (50 ml / 3¬Ω tablespoons) olive oil
1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) water
Extra flour for dusting 


- To Make Cheese Filling
15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn‚Äôt suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a ‚Äúhomemade‚Äù touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

Im just going to cover the zombie pvp modes because thats what I mainly play.

Zombie pvp modes were fine up until about 4-5 months ago until they decided to add Dna perks and allow you to upgrade to lvl 3. You're probably wondering what zombie Dna perks are. Well, basically you can use up to 9 of the 20 available most of which just increase your HP and armor, but one in particular really ruins zombie pvp modes that being on-hit-boost. This perk basically resets zombie abilities at a low chance. Not a very low chance if you ask me because i've used zombies with healing abilities and had it reset 6-7 times in a row healing thousands of hp in seconds and then infecting everyone.

Now besides Nexon making zombies even more powerful most rooms are just FULL of people using light zombies and sting fingers. Basically they're really mobile skinny bitches that have broken hitboxes that most people love to use with bhop macros such as autohotkey making them almost impossible to hit.

One final thing I want to cover with zombie pvp modes is what I like to call "Lag abusers" these are people that usually live in brazil or russia with dialup internet having 200+ ping and they teleport lag around the map infecting players from 2-4x the normal distance. Sometimes they even ignore knockback and stun from weapons.

With all of that said the only other thing I want to mention is the decoders. Now while I don't think this game is pay to win anymore due to zombies being extremely overpowered now if you actually want weapon variety be prepared to pay hundreds or thousands of dollars. The chances for some cool weapons such as the warhammer, reaper, etc are low like a 1 / 600 chance and with decoders being $5 a piece you can see how stupid that is. At least in CSO which is the eastern version of this game they pay $0.80 - $1.50 for a premium type decoder.

Time to review the pros and cons of this game:
PROS:
-Free Counter Strike Game
-Free Game
-Free
-Game
-Only takes up 1GB RAM
-Only takes up 3 GB Hard Drive
CONS:
-Pay to Win
-You apparently craft weapons now... What the hell is this Minecraft? Are these Counter Terrorists so cheap they have to take wood and stone to make somewhat of a gun?
-The game has the same graphics as the first Counter Strike (2000) yet this is the most recent Counter Strike Game!!! This was made in 2014! I mean yeah it's free and all but have you seen No More Room in Hell? Its free but damn does it have some great graphics
-It would take you weeks to figure out the menu
-While you see enemies and teammates with laser guns, you are stuck with this crappy pistol (Pay to Win)
-Why does the game take up 3GB when it is basically the first Counter Strike but somehow crappier? 
-i'm telling you, you gotta craft weapons, and you don't get to pick your weapon. Either you get a gun, or you fail, and that is the number one way to get a damn new gun in the game (of course besides paying)
-Zombies might as well be skinless humans
-Pay money to become a woman
-Guns look like a card board cut out

OVERALL:
Might as well save up for Counter Strike Global Offensive (Trust me)
If you somehow find a way to like the game, it gets boring too quickly
You'll waste your time and space on this game, save the time of downloading it unless you want to practice for the original Counter Strike.

I sit down waiting for him to peak his fragile head around the corner

I wait..... Wondering how im going to frag him
[b]AHA![/b]
I pull out my awp, ready for him
[b]BLAM[/b]
He ducks, right as i hit him, then i feel a tapping on my shouler
[b]Huh?[/b]
Its a tall man, blocky, and out of shape
He is drawn in nothing but green lines and a cube
Then i realize, its his hitbox
[b]POW[/b]
He hits me in the head, moments before i can breathe
He stares at me, bringing out a glock
He mutters a word
[h1]Help....Me........[/h1]
He mutters in a fragile accent, seconds before my life was ended on that faithful day

[h1] WHAT??? [/h1]
Suddenly, im in a battlefeild of green boxes, smashing each other


Then i realise.




Im in hitbox heaven.



(Fix your goddam hitboxes)

In-depth explanation:
CSN:Z is a standalone game based of CS 1.6'S Zombie Mode, graphics wise and game play wise.

However, this game (as mentioned above) is a microtransaction game which means to actually kill the zombies single handedly, you've either got to "rent" or "buy" the guns, which involves opening up your wallet to the Korean Gaben.

Also after playing this game my computer refused to start up completely, (NOTE: it was fine BEFORE CSN:Z was installed) after figuring out that this game was presumably the problem, I was forced to factory reset my computer to get rid of all the shit that this game left behind.
0/10 never playing this cash grab game again.

If you like CS games i'm sure you'll feel at home. However, I've never been a fan of them. Its my opinion that they are all awkward to play with weird mechanics and just overall gameplay. I grew up playing games such as original Duke Nukem, Unreal Tournament games etc. Those to me were so much enjoyable and had a better feel to them. CS games just feel so tight, movement is weird and just doesn't flow or feel natural. 

Either way I wanted to give this a go, thinking free game why not...can't be too bad... Well it's horrible... Graphics could easily be upgraded and improved on, pixels...pixels everywhere, just looks bad. Gameplay, same CS feel I get, nothing flows right, very uncomfortable to play, movement and mechanics all strange. Little tutorial help, unless you've never played a first person shooter, tutorial is almost no help. Explains nothing about crafting, items. Clicking through all these daily rewards which there is no info about. What are these items? Why do they matter? How do I use them? Says I unlocked all these guns and got them, but not access to them? Can't equip or use. 

In 22 minutes of gameplay i'm already extremely overwhelmed with so many features and options with no tutorial. I have no interest in playing and spending hours going outside of the game to figure out what half of it is, how it works etc. Doesn't take a smart person to realize the game is centered around pay-to-win. Or at least, pay to have fun or get anything good. If this was a game like World Of Warcraft, that makes sense to have purchase options for mounts, its an MMO, you buy that to show it off and have something unique. In a first person shooter, I come to shoot things and have fun, not have to worry about crafting systems, pay-to-win setup or anything like that. 

Overall, very clunky, doesn't look or feel good and way too much fluff and pay to win. After exiting, had to shutdown computer because the game was still running even though in task manager, no game was running. I simply cannot fathom how there is any enjoyment or fun in any type of game like this and this is why I cannot recommend it. I'm sure many will disagree, obviously this type of game-style is not for me...it's free and I guess you can always try and decide for yourself.

CSN:Z is not a bad game, in fact some time ago i think it was great in its own way. The weapons were actually somewhat balanced and it was more about skill than how lucky you got with your crafting or decoders. But now, things have changed. So many new weapons were introduced, and a lot of of them are just BETTER than the older ones, for example THANATOS - 7 and THANATOS - 9, these weapons are just overpowered, with THANATOS - 9 you can almost kill zombie BOSSES with one attack in Zombie giant, which can take 5 hits from almost any other melee and not lose half of their health, same thing with THANATOS - 7, but a little bit less ridicilous. The game was fun, but its going downhill with these new updates. Now in Zombie Scenario it will take you 40+ minutes to kill a boss with more older weapons, but with the new ones it will take you a max of 15 minutes. I wish Nexon thought about the balance of their game more, and fixed all of this, because right now, i'm always at the bottom of the scoreboard in Zombie Hero because i just get rect by all these M4A1 Dark Knights, AK-47 Paladins which kill me with one mag, even though i have 30k+ health. Before i used to be in Zombie PVP HQ once, which is basically the highest league of zombie pvp players. Try the game if you want, it still has some gamemodes which aren't broken because of the new weapons.  A lot of people claim its p2w, i would have definetly disagreed before, but now it's kinda getting to that point.
There is a lot of overpowered weapons and hacks that players use which shows how poorly engineered this game is

Counter Strike Online, also known as Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies also know known as Counter Strike Nexon: Studio is a game that has a lot of personailty that was running well back in 2014, clearly being special to anyone who may like CS:S. This game was a long time ago a very fun and promising game, there was this crazy soccer mode, and all these zombies, and everything. The only thing alive in the game mostly now is the zombie mode. Makes since, being the game is that right? Well, as you can see now the game is called studio. This created a very creative space for that game that was along the lines of something like Gmod or a minecraft creative like experience. I think its a very cool and genious idea and its clear its its biggest edition. I just feel looking at this game now on the store makes people even less likely to play it from the outside perspective. Heres the biggest problem though:

 The core game as of now. Idk how long this has been going on, but this game now lives off of some of the most OP pay to win content. If you play this game, you'll get maybe something decent weekly, that only lasts usually like a day, it will force you to pay for something to truly enjoy it. Not just that, of course this is where opening cases comes in. Which the most OP weapons out there are rare, so even a commitment will probably be a loss. The game itself is unbalanced. There is such a large concept behind Human guns, that zombies dont even stand a chance anymore. In a game even where S tier weapons exist, you still had to aim them and use them well. Now guns come out playing the game for you, sticking zombies in the air like a black hole, and AIMING FOR YOU. Basically, auto aim guns. I think its sad...

I see this game as something special, and it was something special when I played it for a short few hours years ago. However, now its a game thats swarmed by overwhelming pay to win for the small dedicated community to eat up. This game seriously should have been something much bigger, and its a shame that it seems like if anything its digging itself deeper into the ground over time. Even some dedicated fans who have thousands of hours have left in recent years since the STUDIO change. Some in a single week, lost all of their stuff because of an absurd game change. An update to studio where if someone didn't log in for that week lost everything basically.

This event cut in half and already small player base, and today, the game sits with seemingly a 400 consistent player count. Which, its beyond me how those 400 even stick with it, but power to them. They probably have good items for long to come. Especially guns that play the game for them.

To add insult to injury, the mode that helps zombies most, is the evolution mode, where there are many different types of zombies. I believe there's like 12+ with different abilities that really helps fight against the absurd weapon imbalance but still doesn't come close. The point Im getting to, is that the only servers that are ever running are the basic mode, so basically, once your a zombie the game has died for you that round. I see even the community some will just idle as a zombie because yeah, its obviously not fun against these op weapons that pin you to a wall or stick you in the air until you die.

CS Nexon Zombies, or what is now CS Nexon studio was a game that was promising now killing itself over time.The game is still surprisingly active, and in two days of this review I believe a new ABSURD weapon is coming out. So... yay? Thats the most suprising thing though, the consistency of the developer. I really hope they take a big turn in what they are doing because I think this game could make a comeback if they play their cards right maybe.

For now, I suppose its best just to bring out powerful weapons, insane, broken, weapons for the small community they have left that will buy them... A shame...

This game has probably been my most played game and I regret every single second of it. Constantly being unrewarded for coming back time and time again, this game and it's asshat developers do not give a fuck about any of it's players. The only this cumdumpster of a game wants is to swallow your money from the shitty pay to win decoders and weapon sets, which include most weapons that can actually kill some zombies. 

Now although I can't say I didn't have my fair share of good weapons, I still didn't get anything THAT good, which is why I know the game will never actually reward me with something useful, unless I'm talking about cancer, which is still not useful.

On to the actual zombies mode, one specific zombie that is the bane of this game's existence is the heavily over-used "light zombie" (Emphasis on light since it can jump 50ft high and turn invisible at any time, oh and that's before it's upgraded.) I can say I have killed a lot of light zombies but it really does take the biscuit when every single other player is using this fucking zombie and you're always the survivor. This zombie is a really big turning point in my decision to delete this game since it has consumed over 300+ hours of my life, it is hard to hit, hard to see, can jump and even has a power-up for higher jumps? It was nerfed but that made jackshit difference. It's just a clusterfuck of overpowered abilities and even worse movement, this zombie should be limited to at least 2 max in one room.

Besides the bullshit zombies and the under-whelming weapons you receive for your time put into the game, it wasn't that bad of a game. It has other modes which are fun to play, I reccommend gun deathmatch, but that's about it. Otherwise this game is useless, unless you want free counter-strike.

Overall this game has given me hemmorhoids and aids. Also the sight to not waste my time playing games that barely reward you for loyalty. I did previously unistall the game but decided to give it another chance and that worked as well as a trip to uranus, it was full of shit.

I have played more than 200hrs and have never found the need to buy anything and people do tend to share. (If someone is willing to share with you it might be a good idea to befriend them)  I feel like I can say that this Is a REAL F2P. It is a complete game at download. 

There is however a few "Cons" I thought the real down side with some of the community, acting rude and just all around not very kind to the new players. Almost as if some of the higher ranked players think they just just started out at Lv100.  The term "NOOB" is way over used. NewB has been around longer than most of the players have been alive. But still its used as if is was like a little kid just learn a new Cool word that all the Popular Kids are saying. I mean come on guys give'um a brake the game really isn't that grate. There is other games out there. At around 300+hrs of game play now and still just as Rude as ever. 

Make as Many Friends as you can, as you move up through the ranks, and or bring some friends with you into the game if you can. I don't see why anyone who likes FPS's, Counter Strike & or ZOMBIES wouldn't have a good time playing this game. 

(In a nut shell it reminds me of Hunter Thompson's analogy of Circus Circus and an alternate outcome to World War II. Though If they didn't win this game would be Left 4 Dead.) 

Thanks for reading.

-It used to have missions that rewarded you with decoders and you had a fair chance at winning a permanent weapon but they removed them because apparently there were people who abused it. Now you will have to waste 3 hours of your precious time in this terrible excuse of a game so you can get 3 decoders.

- you can play bingo for nice rewards. But now that you can barely get any points from the decoders it'll take you months to actually get something. Did they really think this through? I don't think so...or maybe they just didn't care.

But we know that the reason is most likely so people would buy the decoders from the store. If they really valued their players they would do that but what do you expect from a game made to grab cash.

Alright, Its about time i give this game a review in depth. Do know before you begin reading this review that this is a very HONEST review. Even though some aspects of this game aren't the most ideal and great i do still enjoy this game till today. Please feel free to edit me if any way if i misunderstood some aspects of this game, I am always open to new ideas. Sorry for the essay guys xD!

Positive:
- Large variety of guns to select from.
- Alot of different modes and maps to choose and play from.
- Family and groups to hang out with.
- Old counter strike maps to play on.
- Have both PvP And PvE.
- A nice story line.
- A nice community who are willing to help out.
- Most of the computers can run this game smoothly.
- Alot of very active and helpful mods in this game.
- Constant updates (There is updates every 2 weeks)

Negative:
- Requires a lot of grinding.
- Alot of campers in this game.
- Very loud and unbalanced sound.
- Very unbalanced weapons.
- Really bad graphics.
- Game layout may be difficult for new players to navigate.
- Many of the weapons and items you get in the game are durable.
- There isn't alot of english players in this game.
- Events are quite repetitive in this game
- There are bugs in some of the maps and modes.

Now lets get to the hot topic of this game.

Is this game a free to play game?

Before i answer this question i just want you guys to know that this game is heavily based on luck and the following answer is based on players who are just normal players with normal luck going into the game.

This game is a free to play game if you don't mind having a bunch of durable weapons and items. Being killed by other players with better weapons. Being killed by zombies in the zombie hero mode or zombie scenario. However you can still enjoy the different modes and maps without paying a single penny! This is what you will experience if you are willing to invest in at around 15 hours into this game.

This however can be changed but it requires a large amount of grinding and a few hundred hours invested into the game. Now lemme explain the systems in this game and how it works.

This game like i said before offers a lot of durable weapons and items. However if you do want permeant weapons and don't want to pay a single penny it is still very possible. This method will require you to invest at least a few hundred hours if you are a player who has a average luck like i do. Now the ways you can earn permeant weapons are through events (Do know that many events don't offer permeant weapons), crafting, extension coupons, mileage decoders and by bingo boards. Now lemme go through briefly each of these systems.

Events:
Events in this game sometimes offer decoders and supreme decoders (Most are really few to nothing) and gives out weapons at times depending on the month. Some of the weapons given like the christmas weapons have a duration. Other events like the spell the weapon name event gives permeant weapons however doesn't have much of a difference compared to the default weapons (This is changed due to some new updates like the serpeant blade or the fire axe... The weapons depends on the event so if you manage to play on a good event then there are good weapons out there for you to get) Also i just want to add that Nexon is being more and more generous with the events on counter strike nexon zombies. The most recent event lets players get 10 decoders everyday for playing one and a half hour + the 3 you can get everyday and 3 you can get every week. This event will last for more than a month so you can end up with more than 400+ decoders. Nexon has also been giving out free premium decoders to the users lately which is why Nexon's events are getting better and they are being more generous.

The crafting system:
This system is mostly used when you complete daily missions, grind zombie kills and decomposing your weapons (Most popular one) Now to actually have a chance of even getting a permeant weapon you need to sythensize and combine your durables to 72 days - permeant. Do know that this process can fail and result you with nothing left. Now if you were lucky enough to go through that you also have to do the same with the blueprints. After all that is done you still aren't offered a 100% chance at getting a permeant craft you still have the chance to fail. From my hours and i may just have been a really unlucky guy after a few hundred hours into the game i have only crafted one permeant weapon. This is just one way to earn a permeant weapon. However you can also stack up your duration of the weapon so for example if you have dual infinity for 100 days if you open another decoder with dual infinity 100 days it will stack on top of each other untill it becomes permeant which is 999 days.

Extension coupons:
Now to earn extension coupons you can either get this from decoders or by disasembling weapons. When you disasemble weapons and if you are doing this right with a large amount of weapons you have the chance of earning a few extension coupons. When you open decoders you have the chance to win around 20 extension coupons ++ and the max you can earn i believe is around 500. With that you need to save up to 999 extension coupons with that you can then make one permeant weapon.

Mileage decoders:
Mileage decoders are like buying lottery or opening lottery the chances of earning permeant weapons can be scarce at times and won't get you much. If you are lucky you can get some permeant weapon at your first opening. However if you are unlucky you can open a hundred decoders and not get a single permeant weapon.

Bingo board:
In the bingo board you can pick up some really good permeant weapons. However to be able to use the bingo board you will need to open decoders which will grant you 30 to around 50 mileage points. Now you are only able to earn 3 mileage decoders a day which requires you to play a total of 3 hours. With these mileage points you can choose to reset your board to get good permeant weapons which requires 50 mileage points and changing the grand prize for 350. Now as you advance in the bingo board your opening special numbers will increase and so will opening random numbers making you need to grind and farm more for permeant weapons. In general if you are a free to play player it will require a large amount of game time and investment.

Weapon upgrade event:
When the weapon upgrade event comes around you can upgrade non permeant weapons into permeant weapons but with a even stronger form then its previous. This event usually brings 4 weapons that can be upgraded into the game. All you have to do is just open a few mileage decoders or craft the weapon which is quite easy if you save up alot of mileage decoders or blue prints and is another way to earn powerful and permeant weapons.

If you can endure everything i have just mentioned above, install and play away it is indeed a free to play game if done right. I just want to say that i do enjoy this game and i really like it and would recommend it to my friend. However i just wanted to do a honest in depth review of the game. I still love this game though! It is still part of my favorites! Anyway thanks for reading! I also just wanted to add that this game is getting much better and Nexon is being way more generous in the events they have recently.

Pros
-as long as you expect garbage you won't be dissapointed.
-most of the people who play this, only play it because they cant afford cs:go. If you play cs:go, you can wipe the floor with most people.
-new guns.

Cons
-You can only change the screen sise when in a game, and not in any menus.
-It's kinda pay to win, but it's mainly pay to have a girl playermodel
-I can understand the crap graphics, but I can't understand how it still lags.
-if you play go you will be confused in some of the maps.
-hard to get a regular five on five game.
-with the amount of guns, it's hard to buy indiviual items quickly at round start.
-the way the ui is configured makes everything realy confusing
-way too many things to do for a game you will not realy enjoy
-you will hate it but find yourself still playing
-even sprays are purchaseable
-no explanation of a game mode in the game lobby
-if you play go then you will have a hard time throwing nades
-some of the maps feel extreamly sided towards one team (for example one map has a ct open spawn, and a t cloded spawn that the ct can trap the t in easily)
-little explanation of how to do things: preselecting zombie class, prebuying weapons, ect.

Is this game fun? Kinda. Is it bad? Of course. Should you play it? Probably not, but it's free so I can't really complain.

It was a dark stormy night in Warszaw, you could hear the rain fall as it thundered in a distance. Harry was just 11 years old, he enjoyed playing video games, yes video games, especially on his computer. Harry was just done earning every single achievement on The Binding of Issac, he was happy, very happy. He had earned every achievement in the game. But then Harry scrolled through his 300+ game library and realized... there was no game left to play. Harry had played every single game in his library, earnd every single achievement and unlocked every single unlock. Harry was sad. Very sad. His parents weren't home, he couldn't ask them for money to purchase new games. He became desperate and in his desperation he turned his last hopes to the free-to-play category on Steam. He already had 700+ hours on Team Fortress 2, collected every single hat, every single achievement, no... he couldn't play that game. The other games didn't interest him as much. He scrolled and scrolled, forever, until... he came across Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies. He was already a Global Elite on Global Offensive, and he had played the previous Counter Strikes. This seemed perfect to him. Like a sign from god that said, download me, he heard in a distance as the voice faded. He decided to download it. He launched the game, full of excitement and curiosity, he was then greeted by ads, microtransactions and daily rewards. Harry realized what he had gotten himself into... it was a p2w game. But he refused to step down, he had nothing else to play. He joined a Team Deathmatch lobby, he spawned in with a AWP and a D-Eagle as his secondary and a smoke grenade. He took a couple of steps forward, BUT THEN OUT OF NOWHERE a flying player flies over Harry and spots him, the game crashes. His computer turns itself off... Harry sits there clueless, what happened, he asked himself. But then, Harry started to hear something, a voice perhaps. His computer started to whisper to him, whispering random Counter Strike callouts, go Mid, go Mid, go B, Shop, go A, stop wait a minute, bomb planted, on A, it kept whispering. Then Harry's screen turns on, random code starts to show up, like this was some Matrix movie. He could start to hear something that sounded like Zombies outside his house. Yes, it was Zombies, but wait... it was Zombies from the game he just had played. Yes, they looked just as pixelated and grusome as the Zombies from the game he just had played. Random bottles of Vodka started to float in his room, car alarms could be heard outside, the computer kept whispering callouts, Zombies breaching his front door and breaking his windows, flashing lights in his room, his phone stared to play Anime intros, random absurd stuff started happening. But before Harry could do anything, a black hole opened behind Harry and sucked him and his setup into it. Harry was then never heard from again, he probably suffocated in space. 

The moral of Harry's story : Don't download Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies, or you'll end up like Harry.

[h1]-=-=-=-=- HUGE WALL OF TEXT IMCOMMING! -=-=-=-=-[/h1]

Ok, where should we start?

        [b]Gameplay:[/b] 7/10 [u]OK[/u]

   Gameplay experiences here varies greatly, really depends what kind of player you are. In Teamdeath Match, Expect the most often used map is Dust 2, and Spawncampers. This is one of the reasons why new players deter from the game, thinking it is "Pay 2 Win." In Zombie pvp modes, Expect the mode on Hero mode and mainly on maps with camping/glitch spots. Other pvp modes are often not played at all, like soccar/hidden. The Best modes (in my opinion) by far are the PvE "Scenarios." Zombie scenarioes is the most played mode in the game, with ofc, zombies while completeing the map's specific objactives, like survivial, boss fights, and more.

         [b]Enjoyability:[b] 8/10 [u]Good[/u]

        There are many ways to enjoy the game, like exterimating the scenario bosses, hordes of zombies, and even getting premiums from the the soficicated "Decoders." But there ARE somethings that really takes away from it, like Blockers (Zombie PvE most common), Getting spawncamp by the opposing team, having bad decoder luck(getting all crap), etc.

        [b]Quality:[/b] 5/10 [u]ehhh.......[/u]

         The Graphics are very outdated to start off, since CS:NZ is basicly a westernised port of CSO. Weapons very geartly with unique abilites and "Anti-Zombie" weapons. There are still a TON of explots/glitches within the game for getting out of map, etc.

         [h1]Overall Score: 6.5/10[/h1]
