Updated on 18/12/2019
Really rarely does anyone come across a game that is as parasitic, rage-inducing and depressing than Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies (now changed to Studio)

Back in 2014 when I first started this game I was 11 and was just looking around for a free CS to play as I had much childhood memories from cs 1.6 and there it was...stating on the top of the list "Counter-strike Nexon: Zombie," the game itself felt pretty average to me but it was the only thing I really could play. Some of the game-modes were really fun, my favorites were Zombie Escape, TDM and of course Zombie Hero, the community also gave birth to some of the greatest friendships in a virtual world and having them play with you days on end... it was addicting to say the least...and so, soon enough this game became a beautiful hobby that you could enable you to meet so many charming, interesting and wonderful people alongside fun game-modes that tested your ability to work together and had unique luck factors through loot-boxes (called 'Decoders' or Crafting System) that was a key factor to what made this game so appealing to my younger self, seeing all those people using those weapons and getting so much respect and recognition from using them in Zombie Modes, that's what pushed me to continue this game but this is where the biggest mistake in my childhood took place.

Over the years, I spend thousands of dollars on this game and thousands of hours farming and training myself to become better than what I was capable of (keep in mind I was only 12-15 years old at best) through it I adopted a ton of my favourite weapons, my most vivid memories are obtaining the AK-47 Paladin, M4A1 Dark Knight and Reaper, I remembering jumping up and down like a little lunatic and messaging all my friends shamelssly and it was satisfying to see the friends you made while also eventually surpassing them giving yourself the attention you so desperately wanted. But in time, due to the repetitive nature coupled with extreme lack of good content caused a major decline in the gameplay and the population...one by one more and more of my friends left the game leaving me all alone, which by itself sounds natural as it's exactly what happens to most games, they're popular, they're loved then they're forgotten. But what makes this feeling so surreal when playing this game in particular is that I and most other players never played it for the sport, it was always for bragging rights and having fun, and suddenly I fell into such a deep depression, because I had no idea how a game that once gave rise to so many hours of entertainment suddenly became so...empty, and that feeling got more concentrated with each passing day and t hat's when this game became so painful to log into, as even the greatest game-moderators such as BlindFire left the result...horrible patches that nobody cared much less played for and instead replaced with horrid power weapons that far surpassed its predecessors which prompted indeed more money saving. Everyday I was logging in trying to innovate in this imaginary world and neglecting reality and everyday the successes in this game felt more and more empty, until one day...everything was lost.

This game became increasingly unbearable as I had transitioned through over 4 families and seeing each one fall apart and break was just a foreshadow on what this game would become, and as I had to play on different servers because of the decrease in population I shifted from 130 ping straight into the 310 zone, as the North American servers became abandoned, then it occurred to me just how broken my life had become due to my unhealthy obsession, I was beginning to stop going to both friend and family events, my grades had dropped quite significantly and my other more positive hobbies such as music had become more distant, even worse is the appalling attitude that I had adopted from this game, I was essentially not even allowed to die without feeling infuriated and it's something I didn't want to feel, I've always wanted to just have fun, but the competition in this game is unlike any I've ever experienced and now "casual-play" is non-existent. My realization  and story may all seem like a copy-pasta or desperate attempt to attract sympathy from random people who come across it but (no offense) I honestly would not expect a random person and most likely....you..I don‚Äôt expect you to understand this level of insanity, this feeling of disgust and this amount of depression. 

Now that this game is already as its final stand, everything I worked for, everything I played for, everyone I shared the memories with, will have gone down the drain as people look at this game and wonder "why on earth do people play this trash?" And I don't blame them for thinking this as I indeed would ask the same thing in their shoes, but my biggest wish is to have never started this game, if I could go back in time I would have just skipped this game entirely, the influence this game has on its players is best described as "parasitic" 

This is a game that completely screwed up this particular section of my life and now only leaves me with depression and a bitter taste in my mouth as I can never get my money back, I can‚Äôt get my time back, I can‚Äôt get my wasted opportunities back...and ironically I can never get those golden moments back...but most importantly I cannot un-recommend this game enough to anyone because it's not just because this game is horrible. It's because it has the ability to affect you on a deeper level.
Take this review from a person who has spent more than 5 years wasted on trying to become something worthless and never try this game.

There's a lot of things you need to get straight before you play this game. First being, the controls can be a little shoddy. More often than not, you'll find yourself having to click out of sniper scopes, or focus and unfocus because it doesn't undo that mechanic after you fire, and hit your target. I'm not sure why, but it sticks, and if there's a way to shut it off, I have yet  to find it. I wouldn't suggest playing with bots. Finding a lobby with anyone is better than using the bots. Connections can be a bit wonky as well. 
 
   Once you get past that, their selection of weapons is pretty good for people who are just starting, and if you know how to use them, they're helpful in the field. I'm still not sure if you can even customize the character you play as aesthetically, but since it's a Nexon game, you'll probably have to pay for it. 
 
   The maps. And game modes. There's a lot to choose from, but some of them are painfully similar to others, and they just make very small editations to a few of them to make them 'entirely different' play styles. But they're kind of the same. Though, team deathmatches are pretty fun. The zombies are kind of original. I've not seen anything like them, in any other kind of game. 

 This is my first game review, so I can't say it's a fantastic one in means of detail.. so I'll condense it.

  Pros: 
    
      - Good beginning weapon selection
      - Frequent log in rewards 
      - Original infected ideas.
      - Generously large maps.
      - Nicely implimented music, and ambiance (map varying)
      - Nice weapon SET selections.
      - Server/room specifications are fair and thorough

  Cons: 
     
      - OP bots *but usually, any and all bots are kind of OP.
      - Occassionally glitchy mechanics
      - Not very customizable.
      - Server search/find could be easier to navigate.
      

      6/10  Maybe 7 because it's FTP

Have you ever wanted to live in galaxy capable of fulfilling your greatest desires? Do your greatest desires include phrases tha can be summed up with the words: "Rotisserie Chicken Humanoids"? If so this game will provide you pleasures beyond the mortal coil. In this pulse pounding adventure you take the reins of Grandpa Whistlefist on his endless journey to discover what makes chesterfield cigarettes so remarkably bad. Along his way he befriends many colorful characters but when it comes right down to it we don't give a gosh diddly darn about them. What we really want to know is how Grandpa Whistlefist is going to figure out the mysteries and if he'll win the hand of his refridgerator love. Spoiler alert, during the second part of this game there is an abrupt shift to the perspective of a professional stock underwriter named Feliz. Honestly during my time playing as Feliz I felt more emotions than I knew that a human could feel. His struggles to understand which stocks needed to be underwritten, in addition to the pain of wondering what tomorrow's sandwich special would be, brougnt me to my knees oftentimes. Sometimes though it takes a strong man to admit that life's struggles are both bitter and sweet, and the realization of fault is often as invaluable as the joy of success. Will your hands shake as you hold the sceptor of absolute glory. having crushed the foe beneath your boot and strode beneath the sunrays of reprieve? Not sure where I was going with that last bit, seemed nice though. Anway this game is really quite bad. I wouldn't play it.

Because my computers too shitty to run Counter Strike: Global Offensive, this will have to do, Its Counter Strike: Nexon Zombies for PC. CS:NZ is a fun but old FPS it feels like the original Counter Strike, but with kind of better graphics. Like i said its alot like the original CS with most of the same gamemodes, the only difference is... well.... zombies, in my opinion this is the worst edtion to the game. Heres why: Being a zombie sucks, when your a zombie its very hard to kill enemy players, the rounds last like 2 minutes, its very lazily scripted, the zombie types suck, etc. If you couldve guessed stay away from zombies, i would stick to regular mode. If you cant afford Counter Strike or your computer cant run CS:GO just get this, its pretty much the original CS with a new title slapped on it and a new gamemode, it should have just been a free DLC. Overall its a pretty good game, i would give it a 6 out of 10.

Well what to say.....

I loaded this up with the hopes of having a little nostalgia trip....

I was expecting a CS with zombies....

Instead I got Paris Hilton trying to solve a quadratic equation  with a double ended dildo.

The loadscreen was unusual, it starts of in the right hand corner and then it would appear to be some "freeium" (*latin for not really) screen.

Eventually when I got into the game it would be too fast, i.e. not enough time on weapon choices and I spend 30 seconds as a human.

Now I'm a zombie, woopie doo....

Not much I can do other then to charge wildly at incoming fire whilst frailing my hands.... at least I have plenty of health.

To be honest this is a game for one of those South Korean Starcraft fans.  No tatics, repetive gameplay and some annoying voice constantly droning on... its about as exciting as the Labour Party's Ed stone of promices.

My advice.... well I'd say premature hair loss is more exciting.

I played this game for less than an hour, and I would recommend it to the people who:
-Want to have weapon/character skins in a CS game but can't afford/don't want to pay for CS:GO
-Simply want to play CS 1.6 in a classic gamemode like bomb defusal, hostage rescue etc. but, again, can't afford/don't want to pay for CS 1.6/GO
-Want to play a zombie game and don't care about it's weird menus/visuals/soundtrack

And I wouldn't recommend it to the people who:
-Care about graphics (I know that this game is based on CS 1.6 and that it uses the outdated GoldSrc game engine)
-Want to have a great zombie fighting experience (in my opinion it needs some work)

  PROS
-Has a classic gamemode which allows you to basically play CS 1.6 but for free.
-The zombie models and textures are pretty well made.
-It's FREE.
-It's not a P2W game.

 CONS
-Zombie modes are pretty bad: To win as a human you only need to get the whole team to sit in a corner and fire at the zombies, as getting shot as a zombie slows you down a little too much.
-The game engine is outdated: The developers should have made the game based on CS:S as its game engine is newer and better.
-As I mentioned, the game menus are pretty messed up.

I would rate it 5/10, needs a lot of improvements.

Hello, If you‚Äôve read my serious reviews in the past, you know that I have a general format with it, but now I am updating it and will be updating my other serious reviews to use the new format. This new format will have different categories weighed differently depending on what type of game it is

Gameplay: 5/10*5 25pts/50pts
CSNS is very much a love it or you‚Äôll hate it kinda game. There are some pretty interesting modes with their one lore for each of them. For most of the Zombie Modes, you have a point, shoot, kill the zombie kind of thing, for some of them it is largely escaping from the zombie, and there‚Äôs even one where you have to defend a base against a horde of them.

Story: 5/10*2 ‚Äì 10pts/20pts
The story is kinda hard to make out, but involves the research of Dr. Rex going wrong. Not really going to say much more since I don‚Äôt want to spoil it

Graphics: 3/10*1 3pts/10pts
Looks like a game from the 90s, but with a console command you can slightly increase texture quality. It is hardly surprising, though since most of the textures of are taken from CS 1.6 and CS:CZ

Mechanics and Controls: 7.5/10*4 30/40pts
The game ads a huge variety of new weapons on top of the regular ones found in Counter-Strike, including ones that do not fit into any category

Value: 2/10*3 6/30pts
The game was always p2w, however depending on the timeframe that you look at, by how much so differs. From the games release to Late 2015, It was relatively mild, and with a moderate amount of grinding you could find yourself doing pretty good. From Late 2015 to Early 2017, the pay-to-win part of the game revealed it‚Äôs self in more detail. In early 2017, the first version of the decoder system we know as it is right now was dropped and for a brief period of time, it reverted to it‚Äôs first Release ‚Äì Late 2015 status, however, would be followed up by the most pay to win era of it‚Äôs history. During the majority of 2017, CSNS would be extremely pay to win. Sometime in 2018, Nexon started offering better weapons to new players and would consistently do that, and such it is less p2w today. While that seems fine, the amount of money some people have burned on this game, leave for a couple of years, only for a new player to have better weapons can seem infuriating. 

Overall: 4.9/10 74/150pts
This was a game I played for so long, that I feel like I‚Äôve seen everything. Yet I‚Äôve also been inactive on it for so long that I‚Äôve seen nothing. Nexon is a p2w, money hungry company, and this game is the embodiment of f2p p2w games. Many people have sunk thousands of hours, spent tens of thousands, or even hundreds of thousands of dollars on this game and has a habit for pissing off long time players (for example, removing the zombie evolution system, which I spent countless hours farming) so please, Don‚Äôt get this game. If you do, make it a casual game you play every once and a while. Your bank account, and your sanity will thank you.

I just LOVE these exclusive things of this game that make this game fun: many, many game modes (especially for a shooter game), —Åool and overly exaggerated weapons in every sense, zombies, a lot of blood when you shoot zombies, that makes the game for me. Have you heard some of the Announcer voice lines? When I hear them, it's like I'm back in the days of Unreal Tournament, where there was just an amazing voice-over announcer for every kill of an opponent! I love this game, but also hate it to death because of the things I said earlier, so if you want to play this - play, but I don't recommend this game.

Right, so, Ill be blunt, off the bat. This game doesnt have a great community. It has heavily dated graphics, and at times has a frame rate of 1fps on even a high end system. However, for a free game, it plays pretty damn well. When the game isnt lagging, I have minimal issues with preformace. It also adds a lot to the original CS game that it trys so hard to be. So, in the event of TLDR, heres the breakdown

Pros: Free
         Doesnt play terribly
        Easy to find a game at any given time
         Though progressing (aqquiring items) takes a while, it is never unfair
         Not too pay to win

Cons: Will drop frames drastically and randomly
          The community is fairly terrible, and in the case of the NA servers, speaks mostly spanish
          It takes a good long while for any items you aqquire to end up as permanent.
           Some weapons are rather broken, as some buy only weapons are incredibly strong.


If you want something for free, then snag it up, since it isnt half bad.

this game sucks dick

Honest to God, I tried the game and I didn't like it that much. You might as well pay a small, nominal fee for CS1.6, CS:S, or CS:GO and play Zombie mode in those games.

Furthermore, there are a lot of other great games out there (F2P or not) that offer Zombie Mode that isn't frustrating as fuck. You see, Ivan, classic Zombie Mode is a 1 hit kill scenario. Once you get slashed, you're infected and turned into a zombie until the next round starts. There are barely any good camping spots in this game.

Most games with Zombie mode have horrible camping spots, resulting in 10:1 win ration for zombies.

And this is Nexon we're talking about. God knows what kind of OP weapons they dish out that cost real money. I used to play a game called "Crossfire" by Smilegate and God, that game is ruined because they recently carried $100 weapons with "godly powers." It's no different from aimbotting lol.

A game like CS:Z is made for poor, 2nd or 3rd world countries that can't afford good computers like most of us do here in the West. Thus, this is the reason why such a shitty game exists.

[b]Final verdict:[/b] Avoid this game and try other games like Warface for example.

how can you turn the cs 1.6 engine into a horrid, clunky, and over the top generic free to play fps game? well counter-strike nexon: zombies is your answer. its like a game you'd find in a bootleg martket stall in hong kong.

You  know, this game could have been good if it wasnt for Nexon desperately trying to fix things that werent even broken to begin with, and of course adding even more unbalancing to the game, introducing even more pay to win weapons, adding a useless matchmaking system nobody asked for and conveniently hid the server browser among others but oh boy, this was just the tip of the iceberg...


Last month there was a migration to Nexon Korea and all players were asked to basically accept the transfer and all that , which I also did (supposedly i did), otherwise our account and progress/items would get removed due to the transfer.. 

Now low and behold, when i tried to get back to the game, turns out that even though I did what the announcement asked me to do: i lost every progress I made during those 98 or so played hours, including all of my perms and rank. Yay...

Im just glad i havent wasted too much real life money on the flaming trainwreck that this game has become, if anything it was a wake up call to jump the ship. I really dont want to sound like a hater but Nexon, yet, again, succesfully proved as to why they are among the most disliked/hated f2p games publishers by not even bothering to fix things people constantly beg them to and instead continue to do f-all.

If you like the game in its current state: good for you, but this was pretty much the point when I got fed up.

After a long time, I instaled this game again, and I found the new weapons are broken af.

There are dual pistols that have the firepower of a rifle, have infinite ammo, and can pierce through wood and walls. 

A sniper that is basically an insanely fast grenade launcher you don't even need to aim to kill someone.

A sword that can insta-kill you in one second and has an insane wide range. 

The upgraded guillotine now will headshot in one hit regardless of how strong is your zombie.

At this point I don't know why nexon hasn't sold a hacker pack with auto-aim and inmunity.

This game is horrible.

Looks very rushed (not visual wise)--because I know this game isn't about visuals, but coding-wise.
It's glicthy and buggy. 
It's not polished, it seems like they've quickly created this game to gain money from their micro-transactions, and to take advantage of the changing market: love for killing zombies. 

Now, for instance:
If you're the zombie, and you're getting shot at, you can't move. At all. Let alone being teamed on 2+ people, and you're pratically a frozen icicle. 
Jumping onto objects, you get weird glicthes, that I don't know how to explain.

If it's a FPS game I expect to aim down my sights to improve my aim; you can't do that.

When you turn one way and want to go to the other way, so you turn a full 180, not letting go of your keys, you slide a couple of feet back before you go in the direction you want.

I can't do a complete full-screen on my 22" monitor; it won't let me. There's two giant black-borders around my screen  when I launch the game. 

This game, for a FPS and Free to Play in mind is the WORST First Person Shooter title I played.

This game is a masterpiece, a perfect mix of emotions, drama and intense action.

It made me feel sad, it made me cry, it made me smile, and most importantly, I lost my mind.

This game is like a worn out dying child, but you can't build up the courage to put it out of it's misery.

When you first start the game after a lengthy loading screen, you get a barebones character creator.
After you've created your monstrosity you get plopped into the world, with no context, nothing. Then you're free to explore! Explore the 15¬≤ block of nothing.

After laughing intensely at it's awfulness, you're ready to go meet other people. The first 2 people I met was "Springs" and "‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•er".

You haven't seen ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• until you've played Genesis Online, if you even call this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, it's fecal matter that's exploded out of a hippos ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• while it was muckspreading. Playing this game is like wiping your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• with your toothbrush, then using it to brush your teeth for the rest of your life. Oh, and the micro-transactions? Awful, it would be more fun to throw your money off a bridge or give it to someone in need, than to spend $30 for a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing house.

My final rating for this "game", is a "Ride To Hell: Retribution" out of 10.

Hmmmm...Let's see...

Gamemodes and maps:
They are OK but could be better. Almost every game I played was on de_dust2

Characters:
Half of the players are using the female characters which is Ok with me, but it distracts players around them. Oh, and you have to buy them for $6.99 each.

Weapons:
Too OP and don't fit in with the rest of the theme. Oh, how many times have I been unfairly killed by these weapons. Example: I join a game. I am last standing player on my team. I see an enemy. I have an AK-47, enemy has this weird gun. It looks like a Nerf blaster. All my bullets miss, he shoots a laser. Instantly dead.

DLC:
Yes, there is DLC for this game. I know, shocking! And they cost around 15.00 - 20.00$ And throw some microtransactions in there aswell, why not?

Pros:
- Money Wasting Simulator 2420
- Exit button si the best button in the entire game!
- Random noobs inviting me to some stupid parties
- Best OP weapons 2069

Cons:
- Careless money grab
- Laggy and boring gameplay

Of course this game has its ups and downs but it's still really worth it to play and here are some reasons why:
1. Don't have CS and want to play it? Get this it's free!
2. Zombie fans will love this because theres a PVE mode where your to do a set task while surviving zombies ( Even though sometimes the spawn points can be really cheap )
3. Like to do a build and survive type of game? There's a mode in here for that and it's really good ( I mainly played it >.> )
4. If you want to waste about 30 minutes to an hour then this is a game you can do that because it's so intense in the PvE that you want to stay and play, it's just fun in general to be honest

If you want to get this I really do suggest it as it can be a really good game if you have fun and look past the minor details that it has that may be bad

Although on the surface Counter - Strike Nexon: Zombies seems like another Korean/Asian Free to Play Shooter, with its many microtransactions, and misc. items that improve the appearance of your character. This game was a hidden gem in a pile of shit. The core gameplay of its "origional" modes play similar to that of the beloved game Counter - Strike 1.6. Although this is a great feature of the game, what really struck me as this game being a hidden game in the once great free to play world, was the actual promoted zombie survival/senario mode. Its thriller nonsense and endless waves of zombies kept me and my friend captivated and motivated with the game mode. While being a great game mode it still has a lot of point deductions on my behalf. Just as an example of these said point deductions from the game, it seems like the "EASY" game mode isn't really easy. I quote, "It feels like playing round 95 in black ops zombies...", but nevertheless this hardness of the gamemode actually enticed me to play the game more with my friend. It is a wonderful gaming experience if you have a couple of friends to play with. Also, its great if you got VAC banned in CSGO, im not pointing any fingers....

This is pretty much a mush-up of CS 1.6 and CS:CZ merged together with CS:GO-Market then added on-top of the unholy mixture. It perverts the damn scene by using Counter-Strike in its name when it is NOT a true CS game and never will be.

Avoid at all damn costs. F2P is great if there weren't so many better choices with the one time pay for CS 1.6, CS:S and CS:GO. Nexon is running on ancient gear, the game feels like its more of a money machine than an actual competitive, cooperative, fun game and if you really need Zombies, there are still great servers in CS:S, CS:GO continues to grow some more and honestly, if it wasn't for the CS part, this game would be another DayZ flop.

The Mixed Reviews are very warranted, keep reading your queue. I tried it and ran after seeing the shitty DRM Launcher they force you to use. Also, notice the lack of VAC? I could hack the launcher and give myself the ol spinbotting. And I hate cheating. That's how piss-poor this game is.

Newbies: Do not let this game be your introduction to Counter-Strike. Download CS:GO instead. http://blog.counter-strike.net/ Yes, CS:GO has Micro-transactions and a market like Nexon but you get no stat bonuses, its all purely cosmetic and the true point of it is to make yourself more individual than generic. You can pick what you want and if you no longer want it, you can sell it. Compared to the $24.99 dragon set in the listed DLC, you can sell $24 worth of shit in CS:GO and get over half of it back if you're careful.

Good luck!

Do you want an unrefined trash cash grab that is based on who has the largest wallet? Then here you go! You've found it!

This very poorly designed mod of the source engine is the classic example of people stealing something that is amazing and turning it into a sad attempt to grab cash and make this game an unplayable joke. 

The loading is slow, fails half the time and throws a bunch of useless junk into your face that as a new player you have no idea what to take of it. You get daily encentives to log on every day, but the items you get are lousy and just be bought with several real dollars, so who cares? Why wait 7 days to get a random skin or gun you can just spend 2 dollars to get. 

The regular mode is just an slightly altered version of the original counter strike, with the bots mod the only viable versus mode due to the rampant pay to win culture. The zombies defense can be fun if played with friends, but gets very busy and difficult hard, and to top this is the rediculous hit box zombies have, making it nearly impossible to even play anytihng but turret spam defense. The guns are garbage, late game the zones to buy ammo are nearly impossible to access due to poor zombie coding and the overall fact that this game is just ugly in colour.

It didn't take me very long to kick this game out of my libary, after just 10 minutes of looking at the main menu and jumping into a zombie game, me and my two friends instantly laughed at how bad this game is.

Don't try it, and expect only headaches from this pathetic money grab.

The other option is crafting, but from what i can tell it takes even longer to get the items to do that.  When you start the game for the first time you get a bunch of stuff to start off doing it, enough to make 3 or 4 guns but soon as your out it seems really hard to get anymore.  The first day i had all of the daily missions unlocked, but i didn't realize you had to go claim each one that should have been way more clear....so i lost all of that, but now it seems really hard to unlock the missions like today i only managed to get 3 unlocked.

But its worst pay to win because as a human it takes forever.............to kill a zombie, then when u turn zombie you can't kill any of the humans that are in the vents because they all have high end gear and headshot you,  All the zombie skills feel like they do nothing at all which is lame. If you enjoy killing Zombies, this game gives you that but not much more, you do have Original mode, which is what I played most.

So if you want more in depth reviews about the Zombie side of the game you should scroll down to see reviews of people who played zombie mode more than I did.

I'm just gonna focus on the Original.

So, you will mostly just play 1 map, Dust2. You will experience how many people are actually good with the ARX *cough cough*.

There is not much more to be said, except that if you do enjoy Counter Strike 1.6 with some extra spice then I recommend playing this, it's fun and I didn't encounter much cheaters. There is quite a large player base as I saw, but a lot of Turkish or so people, and A LOT of russians (as all CS games).

Don't let my hours fool you, I'm a veteran of Counter Strike games, I always enjoyed it, even the lows of this one are blown away by the love for this still to this day awesome game.

I would rate it a solid 8/10.

This game is a fun game to play when bored. It has everything from 1.6 back but with zombies. Bhopping is just as great as before too. There are a lot of gamemodes to choose from. Zombie hero- Humans vs Zombies, both teams being playable. Zombie Scenario's- Fight a zombie boss with a ton of you're friends. There are also a lot of other gamemodes to play. Then there is the games little level up system. You get exp from killing zombies,doing missions,killing zombie bosses,infecting humans on the zombie hero gamemode,and lots of other ways. There is a inventory like thingy where you can customize you're character. You can get other weapons also that are better than the ones you have. Theres a lot more shit to cover but i need to 420 dank no scope some zombies on Nexon. This game is just a flashback to 1.6 but still a ton of fun.

Dear Players,

XIGNCODE3 is an well known anti-cheat tool that is currently being used by more than 2000 games.
It is very similar in its functionality to the ones used by Valve (VAC) or Blizzard (Warden) to protect their community from cheaters.

Client-side anti-cheat tools are considered to be much safer than server-side ones and they all have to scan information on your PC to protect the game from cheaters.
These programs are hashing scanned strings and comparing them to those of known malicious programs. No actual information about your system is ever sent or saved.

Please note that anti-cheat tools are a necessity in multiplayer games to protect you, our community, and please be assured that your privacy is important to us too. 

Regards,
[NX]Dualism

- According to this Nexon Developer Dualism, " No actual information about your system is ever sent or saved." So what is the point of having Xigncode3 on our computers that are " hashing scanned strings and comparing them to those of known malicious programs"? All information online is being sent, received, saved, and transcribed. If you have the balls to claim that "No actual information about your system is ever sent or saved" then you shouldn't be a developer at all because you have ZERO  knowledge of how data works online.   

If Xigncod3 does not send or store information, how is it that another Nexon Developer is able to tell a user (on the forums) [**it is or will be deleted by Nexon when you read this review**]  that they were visting a malicious website regarding hacks, cheats, etc (I don't know what the user was on). This is a great copy of Counter-Strike: Source, or Counter Strike, as it has most of the same characters in a totally different game, made by a totally different company. They have different lobbies, which I think is incredible, first of all because there is never a lobby with cheaters in it, yet you can still create you OWN lobby with a variety of different modes in multiplayer you can do. Although the game is mostly Pay to Win, or Pay to Play, you can still Play for Free without buying anything, and reaching the max level without pay.
     This is pretty much my version of the game in a nut-shell. TL;DR Great game, 8/10 would install again.

You probably want a bit more of a review than that, don't you? Where to start...

Gameplay:
The gameplay is as unbalanced as possibly could be. If the humans manage to hold back the zombies long enough (you won't be getting rid of them by the way, they have shitloads of health and they respawn unless the killing blow is a headshot, which is practically impossible to get because the zombies move around all the time) and manage not to get 2 to 3 people killed and turned into zombies before they get to the camping spots they're basically unstoppable.
If the zombies do manage to kill a few humans at the start of the round with their bullshit instant kill melee-attacks however, those people also get turned into zombies, which means the humans are royally screwed.

Technical issues:
The game is broken as hell. It will often crash on startup, and when it does, it fails to tell Steam that you're not in the game anymore. Yes, your status will say "PLaying Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies" long after you shut the game down (or it crashes), making you look like an obsessive. Starting another game doesn't help, you have to reboot your computer to fix this. So that's fun.

Level design:
Absolutely no effort went into this. They just took your standard olde school Counterstrike maps, made it dark and fogged them up a notch. The low visibillity is one of the most annoying things in the game, because even if you do manage to navigate though a cluttered room in the dark, it will not be without a zombie having viciously torn you a new one.

Free to play elements:
Oh yes, this game has microtransactions. That's right, folks! If you pay money for this you'll get an alternate player model to show people how dumb and bad with money you are!

It may be free, but it's not worth your time. Go buy a propper zombie game if you want one that bad.

While i enjoyed playing in sg/my server back in 2012,2013 and playing on this server for more than 2 years since its release i still kinda wish that i didn't find this cs ''clone'' at all while browsing the net one day. Since the Beta,Launch of csn:z now known as csn:s until early of 2017 the game was in a fine state imo. There were some op weapons but nothing extreme really like it was kinda balanced i guess? Then later on it started to slowly go down hill from there with them adding ridiculous op weapons and thanks to that i lost interest in playing this game. I understand that the company has to make money somehow but at least balance the new weapons that come out by making them slightly more powerful than the previous released weapons and not heavily more powerful. I've tried to come back to this game multiple times as a casual player to see what has changed what's new etc but after playing a certain amount of time it just gets stale and not fun at all. Still i`ll give them credit for doing events often and giving out weapons on trial and for certain amount of days for newer players so that they don't get shit on by veteran players that have loaded inventories.

Overall i don't really recommend playing this game because its grind heavy and also p2w obviously that is unless u just want to chill and play it for fun sometimes then sure be my guest.

Hello, this is my review of Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies.

I liked zombie mode on counter strike 1.6, and zombie escape too. But i fell in love when i got to play it on CS Source i said, holy shit this is AWESOME , half of my hours on CS source are on zombie escape. So one day  i though, this is so good, why do not anybody makes a game about this?. Oh boy. When i saw counter strike nexon zombies i said, hmmmm counter strike and zombies gj valve, i though at the moment. 

So i opened the game and the problems started even before i joined a match, i clicked play and i waited like 10 minutes because an anti-cheat stuff was analyzing me, i was like OK, im sure i wont find bad people or hackers on this game at least. 

The menu is kind of league of legends style, so i did not say anything. My first match was Zombie hero , which a zombie is picked randomly and he needs to infect everybody on the map, and humans need to make a camp spot so they can survive. Nothing wrong, right?.  ALL WRONG, i was playing on italy the only good camp spots were in buildings, i was like "no zombie will get us" but i saw people like falling back and i was like "are you scared or what?" , then i was flying in the sky and fell into the zombies, Why?. EVERY ZOMBIE CLASS has at least 2 GRANADES, Why a zombie would have a granade lol?. 
So i played like 30 min of that, and then i went to the mode i was waiting for, oh glorious zombie escape. I dont remember the map i played, but i noticed that with a knife you dont run any faster, which is a really big  disadvantage! I was like ok, lets get through this. 
HORRIBLE, at least on CS source you had times when you needed to shoot all the zombies that were coming, in that map everybody was running escaping and thats it lol , like a marathon. The map was short really short, and people threw flashbangs in the most important parts so we would mess up. And there was a part in which you needed to be like the first one running because you needed to press a button to make an elevator WOrk and people had 3 seconds to get in . Wow.... I got rekt in that part too many times, even one time i got killed by the elevator... JUst beated it once. I played like 13 rounds.

In conclussion:

Nexon, you should not be proud of ANYTHING. The modders that do not get the money that you are getting right now are more dedicated, they do better maps. And they even work with a BETTER ENGINE.  I just see people playing it because its free to play and i tell them, Counter strike source zombie escape is the best one , and they answer  me, is that a PC game too?.
I think that you should release a second installment with the source engine soon and fix that balance problems (seriously, who needs flashbangs and smoke granades on zombie escape, and zombies MUST NOT HAVE WEAPONS)
AND PLEASE, REMOVE THAT ANNOYING VOICE "THE ZOMBIES WIL LBE BACK" , I KNOW THEY WILL RE-SPAWN!!!!

Graphics: 5/10 (gld source engine on a new game?)
Gameplay: 3/10 (The mod is better than this)
Sound: 1/10 (Some weapons sound cool because that were their original sound in CS, but the new weapons sound awful, and that annoying voice, oh god , and the zombie radio chat is SOOOO ORIGINAL)
Performance: 5/10 (You may say, why 5/10, this game runs on a fucking potato, First, im not getting the frame rate i should, i get 70fps but i do not get more, and there are people out there on the servers playing at 30fps, the gld source engine is one of the best optimized engines, and CS 1.6 did not run like this!)
Overall: 4/10   

This game can still be fixed, if they want to balance it, but they do not care, people play it and they think they are playing something good....

P.D: Needed to close the game as administrator because the quit button and the close button did not worked....

My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through.' I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. Too much flair, too much bullshit, and that subtle thing that reminds you it's a free-to-play game released in asia with the sole attempt of nothing but money.

This is the poor man's Counter-Strike. Hell, I'd probably say Tactical Intervention is the better game, and that's not saying much. CS Nexon: Zombies is a super messy version of 1.6 with clunky UI, annoying flair, stupid cosmetics and microtransactions, and a zombie mode that's both unentertaining and broken to all levels of hell.

First off, you can play the classic mode for the game, which plays like regular Counter-Strike (for the most part). Sounds OK, but this is the only thing that I'd consider "good" in this game, and that's the fact that you can play a free version of demolition with sexy anime girls and absolute messy UI!

Second, everything else in the game is just not interesting. Like hell I'm gonna spend money on other guns, or stupid cosmetics, or characters, they are completely non-sensical and not needed. The game feels like Counter-Strike, except with a ton of bullshit that has absolutely nothing to do with Counter-Strike.

So let's talk about the zombie mode: It's stupid. It's like the Infection gamemodes in Halo except it's on CS maps. As such, being a zombie absolutely sucks because not only do you have to deal with all of the annoying blood flair spreading around with the UI you have to deal with people using familiar and classic chokepoints/spots in the map to destroy the unarmed zombies.

If you don't have CS: GO or any other way to play Counter-Strike, think of another option. My experience with this game kinda reminds me of Brick-Force, and in many ways that's an absolute bad thing. Brick-Force is the pinnacle of everything wrong with free-to-play games, and now Counter-Strike has a free-to-play version that reminds me a lot of Brick-Force.

Just don't play this game. You'll thank me later.

(This review is an old review released late. At the time of this review being presented I have not played CS Nexon since, and quite frankly, I'd rather not play it again)

If anyone played Combat Arms and liked it, you will like this for sure. This game is heavily focused on zombies and the campaign modes are just like in Fireteam in Combat Arms. The challenges are actually tough as well, just like Combat Arms. There are stuff you can buy, but comparing to Combat Arms theres really not much to buy. Theres some, just check in store to see if theres any you like.

To Counter Strike fans, YES there is some original game modes. Such as search and destroy and i think rescue hostages as well. Not to mention returning maps like Dust 2 (I know the majority love that map). This game somewhat look like its trying to steal the original Counter Strikes spotlight lol, BUT i'm sure theres some stuff at the original game has while the other does not. But if you just want to play original Counter Strike game with no mods, this is it for you. Dont like zombies? No problem, they got other modes too than just zombies.

Theres also a level up system too, so you can level up your character and show off to look good in front of other players too.

I recommend this, try it out and I promise it shouldnt waste your time.

Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies is a fun game but I could go on for ages about the problems the game has such as pay to win, repetitive boss attacks and other things. On the pay to win subject, instead of cases you get decoders. You can get these for free however by just playing the game or completing missions. I'm pretty sure you have a high chance of getting a good item. Some of the items have a very creative idea, like the Brick Piece, which is a machine gun made out of Lego and can be rebuilt into to a rocket launcher. There are a lot of gamemodes to choose from, but Deathmatch, oh that's bad. This is where the pay to win part sets in. It lets you use some of your items, so if someone has an OP weapon, you are screwed. So if you want to play that properly, don't play until you get some good items. The other gamemodes are good. You have your classic Defusal/Elimination, it wouldn't be CS without it. Arms Race/Gun Game is where you get a kill to get a better weapon. It gives you a chance to use some guns from decoders. There are many more gamemodes to play as well. I think that this is a very good game and I recommend it, especially if you don't have a good enough computer to play Counter Strike: Global Offensive.

An absolute disgrace to the Counter-strike name.

This game was good in 2009-2013 before the release of "Transcendence weapons"

After that, it was still playable, but when they released "Epic weapons" this game turned into the trash tier asian knockoff of a good game that it is, the only difference being that it SOMEHOW got the counter-strike brand slapped onto it.

Skill doesn't matter anymore. Playing this game is like a vomiting contest and the player with the most putrid and the largest amounts of vomit (epic weapons) always wins unless they fuck up. Doesn't matter how you play as a zombie, the human has to fuck up for you to win.

When they realized this, instead of balancing zombies out to make the game more diverse, they had the brilliant idea of introducing the bloater, which lets you spam zombie grenades to deal 50 damage at a time to a 1K hp human at the cost of your own health. so basically, here's the bloater gameplay: Throw zombie bomb at humans > lose hp and generate zombie bomb > regenerate hp > Repeat until humans are either dead or tired of your shit and use deadly shot and whatever the newest vomit (epic weapon) nexon releases.

One great thing is that the uninstall button works.

Simply put, this is the Korean take Counter-Strike's zombie mode. It has the same old engine as Counter Strike 1.6 as well as the other versions. The gameplay is, as you'd expext, the same like in Counter Strike. The only difference is that the Counter Terrorists are named Survivors and the Terrorists are Zombies. But, where Counter Strike Nexon Zombies lacks in graphics and gameplay, it makes it up with abundant ammount of content, many gamemodes to explore, and provides the player with hours of fun. There is so much content in this game that I'd swear it'll take ages for me to get them all. Sure, most of it has to be payed for but you can still get them by winning theme as prizes. The game provides multiple zombie modes, story modes, and classic free to play FPS game modes. This game is fun to play even when you're alone, though it can be unforgiving and unfair at some points. But with friends it is hours of laughter and shooting guns. If you enjoy the 1.6 and older versions of Counter Strike, you will definetly enjoy Counter Strike Nexon Zombies - because it's not so much different from it, but still provides much fun to the player.

I wouldn't recommend even taking a look at this game, it's just horrendously bad. The interface is let's just say over complicated for a game like this it generally looks bad and the design probably scares off 45% of the people who downloaded the game, if that was the only downside of CSN:Z then the game would be fairly alright but well, it's not. I will just remind that the game is supposed to be focused on the zombie genre, but there's still loads of games based on the CS 1.6 formula(Terrorist vs Counter-Terrorist), the idea was good, but was quickly ruined, they should've use the a normal matchmaker(like the one in CoD) instead of players making their own sessions and waiting 20 minutes for someone to join. After that there is the totally unbalanced gameplay, where humans have a big advantage over zombies when they shouldn't, that totally ruins the 'fun'. Anyways, there is also the problem of really bad sounds and graphics. I know that the game is based on CS 1.6 but seriously! I'm starting to think that The Legend of Zelda is a better game and that is not something to be proud of, textures have low resolutions and are generally horrific the sounds are not better either. So to be honest, if you want to play a good zombie game(for free) get Codename: Cure.

Where should I start with this review? Hmmm.......

This game is basically a more fun version of Counter Strike 1.6, now I know what your going to say, so take off you nostalgia caps and listen to me for a minute. The reason I am saying this is a more fun version of CS 1.6 is because there is actually more to do in this game than in CS 1.6. Shall I list some examples? Ok.

1. Level up system, which gives you more of a motivation to keep playing this game.
2. Rank system, which makes you want to always get better and better.
3. More gun choice, This game has loads of guns and most of them make sense to add in this game.
4. More game modes, I can't really name any at the top of my head. But there are a lot of game modes to choose from.
5. Zombies! Now I don't play zombies often but a lot of people really do like it.

Those are not even all the examples I could list.

Moving on...

I don't like it when the haters or even the people who like this game says it is Pay2Win. It is definitely NOT P2W because I am better than most people who pay in this game and I have not spent a single penny on this game. Free players and spenders obtain guns the same way, the only difference is that for free players, it take a little longer to obtain the weapons because you have to do missions and level up. That is about the only disadvantage you have against spenders in this game, I think the developers did a good job about doing that.

Some bad things about this game is that it is glitchy sometimes. I have only noticed glitches in zombies mode though. When you are a zombie and you are getting shot, you for some reason stop and then you can move, so if you are getting shot by a machine gun, you will have a hard time finding cover or chasing after them to kill them. That is about the only glitch I have found in this game so far.

I will update this if I find anything else I find good or bad about this game.

There are problems with this game, but it is really not as bad as most of the reviews say (Keep in mind, the bad reviews are written mostly by CS: GO fantards)

Pros:
Free to play
NOT pay to win
HUGE arsenal of weapons (from AK-47's to guitar guns)
Many new maps & gamemodes
Not much lag at all (Of course this depends on the computer/laptop you have, but I'd say an average computer can run it smoothly)

Cons:
Run on a 16 year old engine (Hey, thats why its free)
You cannot make your own maps (See above)
Not made by Valve (Not gonna lie NEXON, that isn't cool)
For CS: S and CS: GO players, this might be a bit difficult for you to get used to

Neutral:
There aren't many English-speaking players out there (Of course this isn't much of a probem, I just feel that English-speaking players who are quite tactical and want to convey a plan to the rest of their team may not be able to do so, if they can't speak the language the majority of the server is speaking).

Honestly, I would get this game, its free. I would even say to play this game, but play CS:S, and/or CS: GO too! Why not? They are all good games anyway.

Worst Counter Strike game ever

This game is actually pretty fun to play and I wouldn't say it's Pay2Win either.

Even a good Counter-Strike player can kill anyone with the default 1.6 weapons as opposed to someone with new guns.

While it's true that some weapons won't last forever when you craft them or earn them, there are ways to own them "permanently." So if you get a gun that will only last for a few days, don't give up hope. You'll get a gun that you'll love and will have permanently sooner or later.

The gameplay plays just about the same as Counter-Strike: Condition Zero. With the new addition being zombies of course.

Most of the stuff you buy with real money are just cosmetics and new skins. Not many items that are important will require real money. If you don't mind a little grind. The grind on here is not all that bad either. You can achieve what you want through a few hours of play.

My only gripe is that this game uses server migration. I really hate this because, when the host of the server leaves, another player is selected to be the host. If it randomly selects me, people have to put up with my crappy internet connection and get tons of lag. Server migration is bad because, it makes it unfun having to select a player that's not fit for hosting games, but rather for joining games.

I'd say give this game a shot. It's still fun to play just like Counter-Strike 1.6. Plus it's free so, you'll get your chance of trying out the game before you start spending real money on it.

A friend of mine asked me: "Hey du you want to play the most shit CS game ever?" and i installed CS Nexon Zombies.

Its a F2P CS 1.6, with all the F2P features you can imagin. When you start up the game, you have to decide with game mode you want to play.
There a several Zombie COOP-modes and some shit you already saw in every CS game like DM, TDM, Original CS etc. The COOp modes i played were the worst experiance with any COOP ever. Either you have to run from them or you are shooting wave after wave of them. This gets interrupted by walls you have to shoot down. these got like 30k hp and you need around 2-6 Minutes. Seriously witch cun7 had the idea to make players shoot multiple wall for minutes in a Coop mission. 

The Orininal CS mode is the only one you may play, without getting bored to death. There is even matchmaking, but nobody plays it. The community seems more likely to play it 16v16 on seperate servers, than to play the game like its meant to be played. So don't even think about playing this for original. If you are intreted in cs just buys CSS or CSGO in a few $$.

But the worst thing about this game are the F2P-"Features". These i will just list up.
- non-permanent Weapon shop
- Weapons are aquired via crafting
- Female player skins for 9,99$ 
- Weapons include thing like Grenade launchers ans Gatling-guns (in a CS title WTF?)
- MM dosen't work or nobody is playing it

Just don't play this crap, it's worse than condition zero.

I have so much fun playing this game right when i got it it was a bit confusing but its easy to figure out

I got a decent size arsenal of perm weapons and paid nothing to get them. It's called "Do the events and get rewarded". And best of all, events are free(as in you don't have to pay anything to be a part of them) and usually pretty simple to do. You just have to be able to catch them when they begin, and finish before they end. No worries though, you usually have about 2 to 4 weeks to finish from beginning to end. I like most of the modes they have available to play. Sure, paying can help a bit with weapon selection maybe, but its not going to make your hand/eye coordination any better (unless, you know, you get like some bionic implant in your hand or something O.o). It can get you some better ping though, and thats one major factor that takes a toll on how well you are playing. Kinda like just about any online game. ahmm, i was so afraid to try this game when i saw all those negative reviews O.o
but, i'm glad i did .. as a counter-strike 1.6 player i like this game so much
it's not pay 2 win, you just need to have some skills, there is a lot of new & cool weapons (tbh there is many crappy guns too :p) & a lot of fun mods, there is Families and Clans (but sadly i can't find any "english speaking" one on EU servers).
i like the missions idea but it's still needs a lot of work, i found some bugs but it's not a big deal, i have good ping most of the time (80~60), no lag & i still can play the original 1.6 mod here & ofc it's free :D
what i hate about this game ? the main menu is stuck in a 4:3 resolution (this is really sucks) & it's banned on some countries, some mods are boring/buggy (like when you play soccer sometimes the ball stuck & you can't do anything "you can't win or lose, just leave the room") the guns are for limited time, you have 0.001 (not really but i feel it like that) chance to get a permanent one (this sucks too), & the vote kick was removed so ...
i won't speak about graphics bcs i'm a cs 1.6 player ! it's not bad for me, i like it !
anyways, i recommend this game only to players like me, it's a really nice game
and remember : don't judge it regarding to the bad or good reviews, you need to try it by yourself first
Ps: i know many will thumb-down this review :/ pls don't ..

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

I used to play Counter Strike : Online (wich is pretty much this game only a tiny bit different). Everyone is complaining about this game but I enjoy this game everytime I play it. The fact that it looks old doesn't bother me, neither do little things such as the bots endlessly spamming the mic. I just enjoy this game as something I can always play when I feel like it. I mean it's free to play after all. And if I have to complain about something, it's the complicated weapon enhancement system if you wanna try to craft a +6 or +8 weapon wich will change the weapons colour. Shortly put, this is a game for everyone who just feels like playing counter strike in a different and less serious way, or who wants to go through the nostalgia of playing the old Cs maps. And if you like zombies and have some friends who would be willing to try this game with you, you can enjoy Zombie Shelter mode together.

These trailers make most companies presentations at E3 look truthful.

Expectation:
Large detailed maps.
Epic battles between survivors and the ravenous horde.
Varied content.
Lots of player customization with weapons and costumes.

Reality:
Every map I played was "run from point A to point B". Thanks to this, i now understand "rush B, silver style".
The only people i ever saw shoot were the ones who just started the game.
(see complaint #1.) At least there isn't anything interesting to distract you as you run.
Any item you find or buy is only usable for a limited time, after which it dissapears into subspace.

Conclusion:
I would say there is only one way to quit the game, but the gun you had just dissapeared.

Allow me to enlighten you on my life changing experience of this game.
I launched the game. Well I say the game launched in fact a jpg of some zombies filled half my screen then some daily rewards thing flashed up in and then I opened the options menu to try get it into fullscreen.

I grew up on 1.6. 

this is pure garbage. I don't understand how Valve could let something like this happen. Why the fuck did it need 2 gigs of data? Valve, you should be ashamed you let such a great game go down the shitter like this.

Graphics-
16 years old. Some of the character and gun designs are okay. The zombies themselves are somewhat creative. There's one with a coffin with what seems to be an arm hanging out, grasping at the air. The zombie can hrow the coffin as a projectile. Pretty original. Overall, the graphics are just dated. But the same can be said about CS 1.6. However, there is little to none originality in this game in the way of graphics. Most of the guns, maps, and skins were taken directly from CS. Of course, you can always grind for some of the lame steampunk looking guns and skins, but that would be a massive waste of time you could spend playing much better games.

Sounds-
The annoucers are just fucking awful. It's annoying, muffled, and overall just very amateurish. Most of the sounds are also directly from 1.6. Shocker, I know. Any sounds or voices that aren't directly copied are suprisingly worse. The zombies all sound like shit. The music sets the bar for being absolutely mediocre. Elevator music is less generic.

Community-
You'll find three kinds of people in this game. 
1.) Kids that take the game very seriously, have most guns unlocked, skins up the ass, and will defend the game until the end of time.
2.) Foreigners.
3.) People that recognize the game for the trash it is and quickly uninstall.

Gameplay-
This is what matters most in any game: Is it actually fun?

Sorta. 

If you grew up on 1.6 as I did, and fondly remember the zombie servers, you could find some nostalgic bliss if you can work your way past the awful bullshit. However, the game is just bad. So many things prevented me from liking this game. At the core, it could be fun. It has the potential. But it's not ever going to get there. Everything that made 1.6 zombie servers great is completely non-existent here. 



Final Judgement-
I give the game 2/10 for an easy uninstallation and reminded me to go play 1.6 after 6 years.  Also, you can't fucking curse. So goddamn stupid.

I'm seeing a lot of negativity for this game and there really shouldn't be. I've had a blast playing this game so far and all these 5 hours have been in one session. I DO NOT OWN ANY OTHER COUNTERSTRIKES, so that may be my deciding factor on this game.

Pros: Game is fun and community is nice to play with
there isnt too much competitive play in the zombie modes from what I've seen, but then again, i still dont know how to navigate very well :)
You can jump into literally any game on the list with the click of a button and it's not too hard to find (The little bar at the top :))
the range of weapons is immense and it is very interesting to find many many many MANY different ones with crafting. 
People have said that this game is "Pay to Win" But it most definitley isn't. I havent spent a dime and I've out DPS'd people who have bought there weapons.
The ranking system in the normal Modes is INCREDIBLY well done. For some reason... You look at League ranking system or CS:GO (From what ive heard) and people are in divisions they definiley shouldnt be in. But here, everyone is the same skill level at their own divisions. Except for MAYBE the one person who is better than most because theyve played countersrike before (Only happened about 1-3 times out of 20)
their Hack prevention must be A++ because i havent seen a hacker yet (I was kind of expecting to)


Cons: The game gets quite laggy at times as the servers are hosted by individuals and connects through them. 
The game tend to crash forme sometimes, I'm not sure if this is a global thing, but it is kind of annoying.
Specific weapons are TOO strong compared to others (LMG`s work SO WELL against zombies)
I am running on an older CPU so I have slight frame issues on normal games. 
Explosions are kind of difficult to see. (E.G you walk towards something that is explodING and you die because you cant see it)



Gameplay: I`d rate it about an 8/10.
The gameplay may be better if maybe there was a way to move a little faster (Sprint Such and such)
otherwise i like the gameplay, shooting is fun and switching weapons makes an addicting noise (I DONT KNOW WHY)

I would reccomend this game, But NOT to CS:GO fans. If you are playing CS:GO, STAY THERE! IM WARNING YOU NOW.

total Rating 8.5/10 :D Happy game hunting!

The game took an unreasonable amount of time to start up, and I wasn't even sure it was at first until I checked my Task Manager. After finally getting in, the first game I joined had things going smoothly at first. It was against bots, and I was able to decently get kills. The movement was floaty and awkward, but it's a small free game, I didn't expect too much. Then when the room got about 8 people or so, lag and stuttering set in. I kept dying when trying to simply aim at bots standing still because my reticle would jump around all over the place. I left that game and decided to find a new one, this one ended up being a zombie match. After the first round, someone left the game as the second was starting, and then I heard a repreated loop of "Seven" until the game froze and ultimately froze my entire computer. My computer is quite old and I try to stay away from anything that could harm it like this out of fear of it breaking. That said, I've played more demanding games than this, and this one should've never crashed my entire computer, and it wasn't even a freak accident but the second game I played ever. I could go play free online FPS Unity games games and have less worry than this.

2015-June 26 Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies Review. This was an awkward game for me to play, I did not understand the start menus, so I cannot really explain about all the things you are supposed to be able to purchase in game. I think I might have been earning points like XP or something.  I did not really know..

The first few matches went by without me getting into the actual gameplay, because I was stuck in the menu wondering what I was supposed to do..  I couldn't find my way into the game...

Once in the game, I could not see, the whole game area was too dark, but I was not going to alter my graphics for this one game, since everything is set perfectly for all the other games I play. If it were worth my time and if I had enjoyed the game, I would have pushed the boat out..

Gameplay is fast but no skill is particularly required to shoot and kill others, I did not mind that, but it was also repetitive.  There was no taking-cover aspect in the game, where it seems that you are pitted primarily against the other team AND a zombie independent threat.

You are either a terrorist (team 1 - dressed like a rebel) or a counter-terrorist (team 2 dressed like a soldier), - but I did not see any gameplay where I was -   one-on-one with the other team.  Its confusing - I know, until I explain that the other third team are the zombies. (Team 3).

I always - only saw zombies - or my own team mates none of the other team. That's one of the reasons why I'm confused..   

A zombie boss type monster (I think) who is perhaps an AI attacked me and I turned into a werewolf like zombie, with werewolf-like claws.  I didn't get it at all. What am I a werewolf or a zombie.. ??

Next, if you are a zombie creature you attack the remaining teams and try to infect them. I got shot every time and don't think I managed to get close enough to turn anyone into a zombie. That's where it is too easy to kill approaching persons with your gun.

Other players who were obviously hooked on the whole idea of the game and understood what they were doing, were much more skilled than I was, I don't think I could stick to playing this game, as I found it pointless. But then again, I was constantly on the wrong end of the bullets or got attacked from above or behind by zombies.

I didn't stand a chance..

Now just to tell you my qualification for being able to comment objectively. I play COD and BF and am usually in the top three, if not at the top all the time. So I know what I'm doing and I enjoy these types of game usually. I have a lot of experience with FPS games.

I also like to play horror survival games - like Silent Hill and Undead Nightmare (RDR). Basically, I'm saying, I know what's good and bad in games like this and I did not like this game. If you are into the same kinds of games I am into. You probably won't like this game either..

Confused and disappointed. I don't know what I expected to find. But I do expect the menus in any game to be much easier..  

My advice would be to try this game for yourself, then you will know if my appraisal (or lack of it), is any good. If you think my review is accurate, you can then perhaps read my other reviews I write that I put a lot of care and thought into.

It's a good game as long as you don't play on public servers, where people have overpowered weapons where it's just unfair.

I prefer to play on server with just my friends, we just about always play the game together.
We put a password and we just have fun, we play strategically or just simply do stupid stuff.

I suggest you play on a server with 3+ friends and 0 strangers.

So unless you can't get any friends to play this with, then I suggest you play a different game.

I have played many CS games before, but I mainly played CS:S and CS:GO. And this game is nothing like CS. If you think CS:GO is nothing like CS, just look at this.

Graphics:
The graphics are borrowed from a game from 1999. Graphics in a game don't matter, but it does help if you do manage to UPDATE THEM? There is no excuse to use graphics from 1999, considering this is a game from 2014, but at least the graphics are bearable.
Grade: D-

Animations:
The animations are borrowed from CS 1.6, which would be fine, but this is a tense, action packed game. The slow reload animations meant for a tactical, slow-paced FPS doesn't fit in the game. Sometimes, the animations don't even work, and I'll think the gun broke, only to realize it just didn't display and manage to waste a round into a wall. The death animations for the zombies don't make sense. Most of them are just kneeling to the ground, rising, and falling again. I'm not a master in physics, but I'm pretty sure getting shot by an AWP, a .308 winchester rifle, would at least throw back the zombies instead of forcing them to kneel. CS 1.6 managed to make different animations for getting killed in different place (shot in stomach, shot in head, shot in back etc.) and THAT was made in 1999, so why not this?
Grade: F-

Gameplay:
Terrible. This is nothing like CS. This is fast-paced and action packed, unlike CS' slow-paced, tactical action. The weapons feel too powerful, as even a gun weak like the Glock 17 can kill a zombie in 1 or 2 hits. The start screen is pretty, but user-UNfriendly. I accidently joined a game trying to join a normal game. There are way too many zombies in the co-op game heading at you, and even though I set my gun as the AUG, I still get the machine gun that empties in 5 seconds. Despite it being action-packed, I often got very bored.
Grade: F--

Sound:
Can't really judge this, as the game borrowed many, many sounds from CS 1.6, but the music is very loud. I often couldn't  hear anything when music played.
Grade: F

Verdict:

The game is a clusterfuck of zombies coming at you, with loud music and animations that don't help the game. It doesn't deserve to have "Counter Strike" in the title. Fans of counter strike, this is not your game. I suggest any CS game but this.
Grade: F-

I've been playing this game on and off since 2015 and I can say while it is fun to play and looks great despite it running on Counter-strike 1.6's version of goldsrc's engine.  I just cant recommend it due to gameplay pretty much revolving around decoders which are pretty much this game's version of p2w lootboxes, basically you buy decoders to get new weapons or characters to keep permanently or for a limited time weather it be for 5 days up to a year. decoder's prices are really expensive too like they came out of a damn mobile game.

The new weapon enhancement system is complete trash. old enhancement system was so much better. if something happens to your weapons during enhancement your pretty much screwed, permanent weapons are also sometimes consumed and used as enhancement material which makes enhancement material you get from the store basically pointless and thus you have to fork over more of your $$$ to buy more decoders just to try to get your weapon again, while there is a player auction its barely ever open and even if it is the prices for other player's weapons cost so much mileage to buy, you're better of fishing through decoders to get your desired weapon.

Nexon and its staff are useless and don't really help much at all with people's issues either.

P2W stuff aside. as I said yes this game is enjoyable if your looking for something new and similar to CS 1.6 and l4d2. there are many modes to choose from but most people play either Zombie hero, Zombie Scenario, Original Bomb/Defuse or Deathmatch. so if you wanna play another mode like zombie giant you gotta host a room yourself and hope people join.

So i read the reviews and saw all the negativity regarding it, and i thought: why not put in a review of my own, to try and balance thing a little.
Yes, i know it's basically CS 1.6 with foggy maps and zombie mods( zombie mod servers were my favourite) and Nexon just threw some stuff and mixed it with some CS:GO, like ranking and crafting(which is kinda annoying when you try to craft some good weapons - because it fails miserablly) and i know the size of this game is greater than a fully customized CS you can find on the interwebz, but i don't think it's that bad. I mean yeah, i'm not too thrilled it's the same old CS, and honestly, Nexon could've done better than take some old mods and maps, slap some fancy new names on them and calling them new, but if you just want to relax and play some old CS, and you haven't bought GO yet and want to make an image of how the ranking system is, then this game could do the trick.

This is my first 100% proper review, read it all:
Gameplay 9/10:
CSN:Z throws a lot of stuff at you when you start off but if you play around you get the hang of most of it in about 20 mins at the most, it has classic CS 1.6 gameplay and most modes are easy to get the hang of and very user friendly, for a f2p game it is almost completely impossible to call it p2w as it is supremely easy to get good guns because the default set is not a steaming pile of dog crap, I have found the G11 gold to be quite OP when put into burst fire but the other guns manage to cancel that out. The only problem here is the zombie mode's the normal pvp zombies is fun but when playing as a zombie you can look like a disabled carrot while moving as you take damage.
Graphics 6/10:
The graphics are crap but still good for a nice nostalgia trip, they used the default cs 1.6 map textures, but I cannot pinpoint the gun models, some are new (mp5) and some are 1.6 and CZ (Awp)
Content 10/10:
When you buy a game you expect a ton of content, many games don't give that but CSN:Z gives that for free. Tons of weapons/features/items and more, nuff said.
Customization 9.5/10:
Nobody buys a CS game for the purpose of customization only, but CSN:Z is a game you would expect to give customization and it does.
Settings 6.5/10:
Not high amounts of options but enough needed for a game like this.
Nostalgia 10/10:
Included in CSN:Z is CS 1.6 for free

Verdict 8.2/10:
Great job Nexon you made a f2p fps that is not p2w, you made a zombie game relatively original and a zombie game that  has the ability to do something that is not zombies and CS 1.6 for free.

Okay lets clear things up right here and now.
It's not a bad game, its not a bad game at all. True it has outdated graphics, but it runs smoothly on even my crappy laptop. It's a free game guys, FREE. If you paid for it, then yeah tear it a new one. I can list hundreds of games that you pay for that are much, MUCH worse. The A.I. is really advanced as well, taking shortcuts, camping, and circling around behind you. Now about the "Temporary Guns". Personally I don't like it, this will probably be your along the lines of your first "Crafted" gun. "Oh wow that looks frickin sick, wait I only get this for a week? That's a bunch of bull!". Then you do the mileage thing and play bingo to get things, and its randomized. This is where it starts to decline. The menu is just confusing and all of the unlocking is frankly irritating. That all said i believe it's WELL, WELL worth it to download and play!!!

This game is by far one of the most loved and hated games in my opinion, when I first started out I had LOTS of complaints like "Why do the bullets hold you in place?" or "why do I get killed so fast, where's my health regen". This game is in no way an easy game at first, it takes patience and practice, however most of my complaints were gone after simply changing the way I play. Instead of rushing into battle, go slow and check around corners. Instead of getting shot and dying, stay out of sight. I've noticed that people who play this game for a short ammount of time tend to give this game a negative review however if you give the game a chance you will adapt and find youself having ALOT of fun. One of my personal favorite modes is Zombie Scenario because of it's challenging difficulty. It was fun to accept the challenge and learn how to survive dangerous encounters. Counter Strike Nexon Zombies has become one of my favorite games to play with my friends and on that note I believe that you too will enjoy it. Please remember to keep in mind that this is a free to play game and thus does not have the best graphics but graphics don't make the game, it's the content. There are many different modes to engage in and it's guarented that one of them is for you.

I never was a big fan of the user-made zombie mod included in various Counter-Strike versions, so my expectations weren't very high. 

There is not much difference between the original versions and 'Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies', so the fans will probably like this one too. It's basically the same game but with more/different weapons, different skins and there are also a few new zombies, which have different attacks. 

The developers describe this game as a 'MMOFPS', which obviously is bull****, in my opinion. If this game is a Massive Multiplayer, almost every multiplayer game would be a MMO. 
It does have the same free2play micro-transactions, though. There are lots of skins for you to buy but why would you waste your money on this game, if you can waste it on better games?
