Counter-Strike Nexon is a Counter-Strike game with Zombies. It has literally all the same assets as CS:Source, only as far as I can tell, it has worse chickens. As far as I know, there is only one map, though if there are any more, I bet you that each one, is ripped straight from one of the Counter-Strike entries.

There are many gamemodes, but in my opinion, none of them are worth playing as the game recommends you play Zombie Hero.
How Zombie Hero works is... Call of Duty Infection Mode. Literally. Only instead of people being weapon-locked, they can choose any they like and the Zombie is chosen at random. There are 10 zombie classes (Yes, Normal zombies are just zombies, they don't count because if you include Zombies in your game, you literally need them to exist) and each seem to do something different from one another via special skills. Every zombie class has the same weapons though, effectively.
You can level up your Zombie classes simply by playing. Speed is leveled up by walking around, and I'm sure others are similarily leveled, by simply doing all that is possible. Normal Zombies aren't the exception here.

Sadly... The game, like any "good" Counter-Strike entry, is boring. Games last too long on a single map, and each round only lasts for about 5 minutes. As usual also, every weapon is essentially the same like every military, modern-era FPS, only with specific... buffs and debuffs to certain stats.

The Counter-Strike mechanic of the absurd decrease in accuracy the longer you shoot is here. With Zombies. This could be made to work perfectly well, if the zombies didn't have 5000 health and take more than a clip of an LMG jsut for unupgraded normal zombies without dying.

But don't worry, because everytime you shoot a zombie, they are instantly kept on hold, their momentum utterly removed, no matter where they're hit from. So, so long as you can keep constant bullets on an enemy, most of them cannot move or do anything.

Maps haven't been really altered at all. Maybe the skyboxes have been removed to emulate "night" but honestly, it's probably because they wanted to crank this out and was lazy, even if this has been out for atleast a year and a half now... and skyboxes aren't hard to do. Just look at Starforge and Castle Miner Z.
This means any stupid, high-up places you could get to before, now are the most camped spots for humans.
Essentially maps are the equivalent of taking Assault maps in UT, and simply copy/pasting them into deathmatch. It doesn't work like that.

Going into greater detail, Matches last too long on maps not really designed for continuous play. Said maps would have actually differentiating geometry, but like nearly every map for Counter-Strike games (choose any one of them) they're linear and basic as crap corridoors, usually without roofs.

Alot of gripes with this game, I'll have with every CS title. Repetitive matches, the maps not being designed really too well, mostly all being rectangular rooms with some parts to make the shape barely different. Weapons are all the same essentially, It's visually Counter-Strike and Left For Dead if the maps and zombies looked worse.

Ultimately... it's Conuter-Strike and Left For Dead with all of the fun of Counter-Strike, just with only 80% still remaining. Fun after the first few minutes, until you realize every server is hosting only one map and maybe because the game isn't designed well enough to not hide in places you must crouch-jump to get into in order to win.

It's Free To Play, but has a system that lets you pay to progress faster. If this costed money. It would only be worth 5 dollars.

Altogether the game is fun for the first few minutes, or the first game, or the first 10 rounds, until the CS nature shows with it's repetitiveness, only with actual variations between teams and... well... zombies.

The only real silver lining is that playing as the zombies offers an actually new and fun experience. Unless you've played Left For Dead's versus mode. It's like that, only each class has skills different, and not actual differences, like mechanics differences. You will find yourself ignoring the buy menu and walking up to the zombies, or AFKing until you are turned inevitably.

Honestly the game is a 4/10. I'm already bored of it, I'm likely never to actually play it again. I'm being rather generous as after a match, your pinky finger will start to hurt. Unless you happen to offer yourself to the zombies like I did.

This game is alright,
I mean the F2P model is actually better than most out there as you can play without paying for a permanent M60E4 as crafting can gift you something better etc and also, the crafting is much, MUCH simpler than something like TF2, even though it's guns and not hats.

The only con i could ever think of is that the moving system while your being shot at is rather dumb as you're held in place, just like a... zombie mode. I don't know if this was in the original CS games and i sure as hell know that it isn't in CS:GO.

Oh yeah, zombies. It's slapped on there after all. Really it's just CS:O reskinned and added more zombie modes to playlists etc.

Overall your experience with this game depends if you like the goldsrc engine and the version used with Condition Zero or F2P mechanics in general and the way they work etc.

I'd give this a 7.25/10

EDIT: A few hours later, a paywall so i can craft more! 7/10.

-Some of the controls are pretty awkward
-NO FRIEND SYSTEM

Honestly it's been 7 years since I first installed the game, I've only actively played around 1 or 2 years of that time though. It might just be nostalgia of playing zombie escape on the map skylines trying to speedrun it or playing the classic game mode back when the game had over 5k active players, but I still very much like this game. You could say the game is P2W, especially now that they've added weapons where you don't even have to aim with, but if you can find a good zombie hero or zombie z server without any restrictions you're probably going to do just fine if you haven't spent any money on the game (such as myself). Occasionally you can find a classic server up and it's a pretty fun time, just don't expect the weapons to function like any regular CS weapons because they don't. It's your standard run of the mill Nexon FPS game which has surprisingly not completely died yet, unlike Combat Arms, Counter Strike Online 2, Sudden Attack 2, Titanfall Online, War Rock (maybe still alive?). This game's glory days are for sure forever lost to time, but it really is a fun time killer if you end up liking either zombie z or zombie hero, but if you're NA don't expect to have good ping, there's hardly ever a NA server up.

How to not make a video game:

-Make one team super OP
-Use a 17 year old game engine
-Add microtransactions
-Add crafting (as opposed to actually getting a weapon)
-Make craftable weapons only last a few days
-Make everything overpriced
-Put in tons of camping locations
-Re-use content from a 10 year old game
-Your zombie is an octagon (I wish I was joking)
-Pretend it's a horror game
-Foggify old maps to pretend they are new
-Make a crappy sound play every time someone dies
-Use an over-saturated game idea
-License a completely unrelated series
-Put your company name in the title
-Make it 2GB, because that's the size a game from 17 years ago is supposed to be, right?
-Make the menus incredibly hard to understand
-Make it free to play

And have fun, your crappy game is complete.

I recomend this game. Now I know what your thinking, It's F2P and honestly in most online matches it's P2W, those words alost ALWASY turn me off from the game. However, I had fun with this game. Once I found a few friends who wanted to play the game with me, I enjoyed playing many of the different game modes. I haven't yet bought a single item from the shop and I still enjoy most of the game. If playing the zombie gamemodes isn't very fun or gets old for you, you can still play Counter Strike 1.6 for free.

I know that a lot of people are instantly turned off from the game merely by the name of the developer, Nexon, however I honestly haven't even heard of the company before I heard of this game. I don't really know anything about them but they didn't seem to do such a bad job with this game.

My only complaint is the crafting part of the game.... Stay away from that you can craft stuff but the things you craft only last for 1 or more days unless you pay money, so unless your planning on paying money on this game: Stay away from the crafting section.

Try this game out for yourself, see how you feel. Don't let the F2P aspect ruin it for you, it should be fine unless you keep away from the P2W gamemodes.

If you're looking for an improved version of Counter-Strike 1.6 then you have found it. At the moment, there are only a few mods available - Standard(like normal CS 1.6 pub servers), Deathmatch,  Zombiemod. You are given the choice to pay for cool weapons with real-life money but you really don't have to as you get awarded with weapons everyday you play. In competitive(pub or deathmatch) AK47 is still the best weapon. In zombie-mod there are supply box drops which give you paid weapons for that round for free.

I would say that the only thing missing in this game are the following mods:
War3, War3 + ZM, War3 + DM, SuperHero, SuperHero + DM.

I hope Nexon is reading this and will add the mods I mentioned above because then there will be absolutely no reason to play Counter-Strike 1.6.

Also, unlike Counter-Strike 1.6 decals on client-side match server-side so you can aim pretty accurately.

Overall rating: 9/10. If the mods mentioned above get implemented then this is totally 10/10.

FYI: This game is not pay2win, you can pay for weapons but its not required. This is a free game, Nexon has to pay for the hosting and other stuff somehow.

This game is a shitty cash-in on the ever-popular zombie genre. The graphics suck, the weapons might as well be pop-guns, and the balancing is shit. Seriously, I fire at zombies as a human and they can keep right on coming with no penalty, but when I'm a zombie, the knockback from enemy fire essentially freezes me in place. Also, the hitbox for when a human is "infected" is inconsistent; I can be infected by a zombie when they're two bodies' worth away, but I have to practically be right in someone's face to even try to infect them. In addition, there was a single human left before the zombies won, but I couldn't get to him because models collide with each other, and there was another zombie RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE HUMAN WHO WASN'T DOING SHIT! Because of that and the model collision, I couldn't reach the human, and thus couldn't do shit except wait for the human to kill me! Shitty game. I regret installing it, and if you are smart, you won't install it!

Lets make this clear: lots of people hate this game because, well, its not even a real counterstrike title. It was developed by Nexon Korea Corp. That does not stop it from being a good game. It includes all of the regular CS game modes and some new zombie modes. It has all of the classic maps plus some new ones. Warning: It can be glitchy sometimes. Also do your best to pick servers with few people because of spawn camping. I recommend this game :)

After 6 hours of playing I have come to a conclusion. This game has a lot of adds to the original Counter Strike 1.6, especially the new zombie mods and weapons. It is, somehow, a P2W but that doesn't mean it is not funny anymore. On casual mods (Normal, Death-match, Respawn) the weapons work as skins, since they make the same damage as the replaced weapon. Totally recommended for those who want a free Counter Strike 1.6 copy with premium, no-lag servers and pre-installed zombie mods. I also recommend this game for those who have a lot of time to waste because trust me, Zombie Shelter in 2 (2 vs 0) will take A LOT.

To be honest, My opinions for this game are mixed. But if you are looking for a game to play just to pass the time, then sure play this, but if ur playing it like you would play CS:GO (competitively), aint gonna happen buddy.

[b]Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies[/b]
[i]Throwback to Glitches and Stupid Fun[/i]

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]Stupid Fun
[*]Glitches are Unintentionally Useful
[*]Pay-to-Win Unnecessary
[*]PvP PvE and Survival
[*]Different Zombie Classes/Game Modes
[*]Great Game to BS too
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b][list]
[*]Sometimes Laggy (Only Lagged Once, but friends lagged a few times)
[*]Graphics and CS 1.6 engine seems out of date
[*]Lack of Tutorial for New Modes
[*]User Interface and Inventory may seem difficult to navigate
[*]You'll Die a LOT
[*]Going to have to learn how to play
[/list]

[b]Summary:[/b]
This game has went through significant improvements from it's first release and the pay-to-win aspect is not as apparent as other players make it seem. This game holds a lot of fun game modes and the community is relatively nice as both new and experienced players can easily get into a PvP match with little introduction.

[b]Overview and Experience:[/b]
When my friends and I first downloaded this game, we jokingly wanted to play a game with poor reviews just to see how bad it was, but surprisingly we ended up playing two five-hour sessions considering how fun it was. Honestly, we were expecting an inbalanced game of pay-to-win players and the usual hack sessions that comes with the CS 1.6 experience. Surprisingly however, the game did not seem to have much, if any, people hacking to win.

At first glance, the game seems unfair as zombies can either be blown to oblivion by the surviving humans or humans can be overwhelmed by a zombie spawning amongst a "cheap" spot. To be fair, this game encourages your knowledge of well defended positions and map usage to either survive or flank your enemies.

What really makes this game come to life is the usage of the glitches present and the stupidity that comes from being chased down by a horde of zombies or hanging off a ledge while zombies use their abilities and grenades to pick you off. Essentially the game becomes a glorified hide-and-seek or king of the hill as you try to survive against other players in your favorite CS maps.

Another enjoyable aspect of the game is the mission modes such as Escape and Shelter that puts a different spin on the game with new maps that are custom made to this game. Escape was a fun run and gun mode that has you scrambling to reach the exit in different areas; while Shelter was a survival mode where you protected your base from hordes of NPC zombies as you scrounge for both supplies and money as you build up turret defenses and walls to secure your dwelling.

One of the downsides of the game is the lack of tutorial for some of the new game modes as they only teach you the PvP and survival modes in the beginning. So in some of the PvE modes you're going to either rinse and repeat a lot to understand what you need to do or hopefully have a more experience player show you the ropes, which actually does occur fairly often.

A downside of the game, which in my opinion does not affect gameplay too much, is the need to continutally create weapons and items via blueprints to keep utilizing the higher end ones. However, as powerful as the guns are, they seem to little much in PvP modes as most of the time you would need a whole squad to help kill a zombie.

Another aspect that seems unnecessarily difficult to process is the user interface as it mostly seems crowded and sometimes difficult to find certain objects you want to use such as costumes and guns that are on a limited time usage. Although after a few minutes of use, it becomes relatively understandable to use albeit dated.

[b]Last Thoughts:[/b]
This game feels like a throwback to old school games where you would do the cheapest thing to live. And that's good. Part of the enjoyment comes from unintentionally phasing through floors or on top of objects to find a once-in-a-while hiding spot and compared to most zombie survival games where you must rely on more of the traditional map knowledge and weapons to win.

This game received a lot of poor reviews from when it was first released and even though it seems like a dated game with new modes, it's a lot of fun to play when you just want to BS around and have some stupid fun to your line up.

I can sadly no longer recommend this game. I've been playing since day one (western release not CSO). I loved this game to death. I met so many awesome people through here. It's one of the only few free to play games I spent money on.The maps were fantastic. The variety of game modes was insane. New characters and weapons kept the game fresh. There was a tutorial mode for first time CS players. The gameplay was CS 1.6 at it's finest. So... what happened?

The servers kept getting worse and worse. Servers weren't region locked so people from across the world would join NA servers and lag 24/7. Fast weapon switching was never fixed. Matchmaking was dead from the beginning. They fucked up the server browser. The DLC characters feel overpriced. Some guns are just clealy better than others making the game feel P2W.  No one knowns how to properly host rooms.  There's no Original competitive scene in this game. The main menu is still in a windowed 4:3 resolution.

There's just oo many problems to be fixed. It's kinda too late too cause they are so many big names in the CS community who bashed on the game. The game isn't going to grow. They marketed the game so poorly that no wonder people find this game as a joke. Some people don't even know you can play classic CS in this game. It's fucking stupid.

Sorry Nexon. You tried. Glad you brought this game to the west, but because of poor marketting, you fucked yourself over.

Hopefully you'll release CSO2 in the west and not fuck up next time.

This is a very unique experience and totally changes the dynamics of counter strike. The PvE was somewhat dry in my opinion, and resembled Sven: Co-Op in that you essentially plow your way alongside other players through a linear map fighting back wave after wave after wave of enemy and completing certain tasks (usually blowing up a barrier that has 30,000 health) to get to the next area. There are buy zones interspersed for you to load up on ammo or switch out guns and it usually culminates in a big boss fight. It's kind of droll and there's not much of a challenge.

WHERE THIS REAAAALLLY ****REAAAAAAAAAAAALLLY**** shines however is the PvP mode where some people are zombies and some CTs each round (randomly selected).

Each zombie type has special powers, like an iron maiden it can slam down to stun enemies and hide behind, or a hoard of bats that grabs the human you aim it at and drags him toward you. The humans (CTs) have a slew of all the classic CS guns and some extras, with a much higher ammo capacity. 

This mode can be SUPER intense as you spawn throughout familiar classic CS maps and try to get to high ground with other humans, since one hit from a zombie and you become one and join the hunt. Zombies have thousands of health points, but are slowed down by being hit so a group of humans can often protect themselves or give another a chance to excape, but once the guy next to you takes a scratch he'll kill you. 

Playing with just a couple people is really cool too depending on the map... it becomes more like hide and seek and can be VERY intense. I played with 2 others on the classic estate map and I kept jumping as I was attacked out of nowhere, since the maps are darkened to create a tense ambience. 

This mode makes it SO worth the download and since it is  free game, you've GOT to try it out... I was hooked after a couple rounds. 

Happy hunting! :)

Counter Strike proves, once again, it's core concept is still solid enough to continue on to this very day. While there are plenty of mods around for zombies inside CS 1.6, let alone Source, the game does pitch collectibles, crafting weapons, a neat variety of zombies and bosses, and it overally looks visually appealing and functions well.

However, on the other hand, the crafting system always feels like it's against me, collectible items can sometimes drop in places where you can't get them (though to be fair, the items are locked to a player for a certain time so no item stealing), and weapons you do craft don't last very long without the right materials. The game can get kind of tedious at times, being either too hard to play with basic weapons provided, or too easy with some of the overpowered craftable ones. And even with the super weapons you can craft, some bosses are tedious and generally have the same set-up: boss is big and powerful, hordes attack, do a special thing to avoid an attack. You'll also have to dump a bit of cash to get enough materials to reliably have a good time, though the game is quite generous with points for certain items in the shop.

So...can I recommend it? I guess, tenatively. F2P won't have as much fun unless you kick in a few bucks, and that's up to you if you have the disposible income. Most will probably want to look elsewhere, but it's free, so take a peek. You get a good starter pack, you do get daily rewards and there's nothing to lose from trying.

Two. From what i've experienced, you BARELY find zombie servers.

Three. No Ranking. I was once a very loyal Nexxon customer. I loved Combat Arms. It would *note, WOULD. not will.* pair you with someone of your own rank to save frustration. But then came the Hackers. This game has the same problem as combat arms does now. No ranking. No pairing. Lots of Hackers.

Popular sequels* to the original [i]Counter-Strike[/i] in the past have tried to maintain the magic of the original whilst creating their own legacy. Though they gained moderate success in their time (perhaps due to a lack of true competitors) it is only now we have the clarity to see what a farce these 'sequels' were.

[i]Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies[/i] (CSNZ) reinvents the wheel whilst it's predecessors only put new tires on. In a true blend of 'East meets West meets East turned West national' a brilliant game is born. A true step forward for Counter-Strike history. This is comparable to Hideo Kojima's fusion storytelling of Eastern and Western cliches holds a great mirror to it's references and makes for a truly unique experience.

CSNZ is if John Woo met [strike]Resident Evil[/strike] Dawn of the Dead. It's an instant classic and it's only a matter of time before the player base cultivates and redefines eSports.

I give it [b]10 steams.[/b]

--
*Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, Counter-Strike: Source, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive

I think I gave this game a longer chance than most, but in the end I still can't recommend it. I would be able to look past the graphics if there was balanced gameplay to hold my attention. I could even forgive the limited-time crafted items in the freemium model if there was a reason to use them. Unfortunately, the game is a re-hash of typical FPS game modes without any polish.

I had hope for the couple of unique PVE modes but they were completely unbalanced in favor of the AI. Maybe it was unbalanced because I was playing with only one other friend, maybe it's meant for 4+ players, but I don't find that kind of balancing acceptable. Probably won't come back with more people to try again.

Fun game! Quite unstable though.

There are lots of game modes, some remind me of AVP but they all seem to lack of round timer which made the original CS experience. As a free game it's definitely worth checking out.

My first day playing and it's crashed three times (twice clicking on store, once server disconnected).  Several other bugs were annoying too, such as the re-spawn timer being covered by some text about achieving "First Steps"... The UI has room for improvement as well, I can't find an inventory anywhere of items such as respawn, health, etc.

Very fun game! A different variety of modes with a bunch of maps, a lot of guns and overall fun gameplay. The graphics in 'my' opinion aren't that bad because honestly, graphics don't really matter to me. One thing that could improve though is buyable weapons in the shop and coded box.
Overall, the rating I would give is 9.5/10

This game is an absolute piece of garbage. The pure fact that they'd dare touch even an outdated unsused engine by Valve, the creators of the Counter-Strike franchise is utterly astounding. Nexon is known for it's breed of gamebreaking bugs and terrible games all around.

This game is made on gold source, or gold syrce, however it's spelled. The engine that was used to create the original Team Fortress, Half Life 1, Richochet, the original death match, and Counter Strike and Counter Strike Condition Zero. In theory, this engine is incredibly outdated, but it's still an incredibly powerful, durable engine. I like the engine myself, but I hate this product. CS:NZ is CS 1.6 with a mod. I don't know why they'd release an entire fucking standalone game over a mod, but it's flabbergasting.

CS:NZ is what I can describe it as, an utter horrendous piece of garbage CS 1.6 mod that somehow became a standalone game. Basically, this entire 'mod' or game, whatever you wish to call it, is this:

Zombies! Zombies! Not enough games about zombies yet? Yeah, there is.

Guns! Too many guns! All of them are unbalanced!

Classic Mode! Why would you integrate the original CS 1.6 Matchmaking if you're not going to balance out your weapons for the game mode in the first place? 

All in all I hate this game. Don't support the developers, don't get this game, I only play it for classic mode.

But I think there is a lot of potential in this game, and if Valve are able to make the most of that potential Nexon: Zombies could be a very fun game to play. But until they do so Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies gets a NO from me.

EDIT Dec. 2017: This game seems to have changed drastically and looks like a pile of shit, so proceed with caution. Everything I said here probably no longer applies.

Now you're thinking: "Nexon? Zombies? Free Counter-Strike? Awful."
And I guarantee to you that this game isn't what you're thinking, so please hear this review out.
The asthetic of the game is obviously not appealing, it's rather generic and downright awful, but if you actually check the game out, you'd find that it's literally just Counter-Strike 1.6 with a lot of unneeded crap. Whether or not you like this unneeded crap is up to you. If you don't want this unneeded crap, you can get rid of it. Here's a console command to remove the costumes from your view: "cl_minmodels 1". No quotations. All the characters will stay as classic Counter-Strike. There are also new weapons added into the game, they're not overpowered and are perfectly balanced. If you don't want them, simply join a classic game. Host a game and set weapons to "Classic Only". You can also change the HUD so you won't see "x KILL" or the score counter. With these options, you pretty much got yourself classic Counter-Strike 1.6 for free!

That being said, the rest of the game isn't very good. The ranking system is pointless and extremely time-wasting. The crafting system is random albiet not terrible. The UI is hard to get used to and very clunky. The game is sometimes a b*tch to get launched but not for everyone. The only good game modes are Gun Game, Team Deathmatch, and Classic, although I have a guilty pleasure for "Item Battle" in FUN mode. The Scenario modes are attrocious with braindead A.I., hitscan enemy accuracy, barriers that take way to long to destroy in order to progress, and horrendously long and generic boss fights. The cosmetics and costumization is abysmal and are beyond awful. So this whole game isn't perfect, by any means.

Although, I can't help but reccomend this because of the fact that this has the classic Counter-Strike package, along with other features you may even like. Most people on Steam have Counter-Strike but for those who don't, this is the perfect substitute.

*My review now, almost a month later*
If this game was under some other developer, it would be amazing. Nexon yet somehow manages to slowly make you disgust their games.
At first CSN: Z is a great game but the more you play it, the worse it gets. At some point you just find yourself playing the same maps and same modes all over again without anything changing. 
The game is updated only once a month. And no, it is not a big update. Last update we got 3 new weapons, some new zombies and a stupid luck based event.

This game is going nowhere and it's just slowly dying.

That's pretty much it, I hope it helped you decide whether you want to play the game or not.

I will keep this review super short. There is four facts you need to know.

1. It has pretty much all the features of normal cs 1.6, there is normal gameplay (Without any new weapons or balance, all th same as in old cs), gungames etc, only thing it doesn't have as far as I know is some rare custom maps and kz maps.

2. It's free.

3. You can actually make servers with no hassle, and the ranking system is much better and wider.

4. You can play a whole ton of other things other then the ones you're used to in cs with new weapons etc that fit into the cs atmosphere extremely well if you ask me.

What else do you need to know to get this? It's pretty much free improved CS 1.6 plus other things, duh!!! 

Free original + improved CS 1.6? Automatic 10/10.

Ok this game is amazing. you may think "oh counterstrike from 2001 or so it sucks!". But let me stop you right there! This game has exceeded my expectations. Its not the original counterstrike. its way better! If your computer isnt that amazing but you love counterstrike and shooter games that dont lag. Well then this is your game. You can craft guns with blueprints in this game. And there are different guns added to the game. Every day or so you receive a daily bonus and a free weapon and booster i should say. Then you customize your classes and try out your new gun. One downside is that if you dont go on every day your progress will be lost but thats just the daily bonus not your overall stats and weapons. I would absolutely recommend you try this game out.

I can't really complain on how unbalanced this game can be, it really has changed before it was released on Steam, I didnt really had hours spent on this game, but it was something I wouldnt recommend. But i changed my mind after a few things they made this alot better:

Zombies: Pretty much what the other reviewers say, Players only win if the zombies are noobs, and playing Zombies is really pointess.. Trust me it really is.

Old patch before Steam: What the problem was, at first you got your classic weapns, and thought. the new weapons would be just pay to use it right? Nope.avi! you had to litteratly buy the original guns too, and why?! it was obviously a P2W kind of game that pretty much are money grabbers, I really wouldnt blame people not wanting to play Counter-Strike Online 2 cause it's the same company and will probably pull the same bullshit.

Overall: It's not that the game got any better, But it deffiently improved. It's really playable now And it's not laggy anymore, If you enjoy Counter-Strike and like zombies? This is for you.

The multiplayer is amazing always meeting new people, it's easy to make your own server with you firends, the amount of games you can play are almost unlimted by the time you even get tired of one game mode you'll have 20 hours on the game, now although the multiplayer is good, it's still fun even if you're playing by yourself providing, proably my favoirte game mode bot zombies. With or without firends it's fun, the download time is only around 2 hours and I have a pretty bad laptop so that's really saying something, if you're new to the PC gaming like I am and you enjoy games like call of duty zombies or just zombie games at all, this is the perfect game for you. But like most games it has it has it down side, the bots talk A LOT and if you use skype like I do it kinda gets annoying, and also every now and again it has it's lag spikes, like every game. THIS GAME ALMOST SCREWED MY PC OVER!
The game itself is alright.... It does have many balancing issues. For an online game that's supposed the run from 2014 onwards, the graphics are HORRENDOUS! Has a nice variety of guns you can use. The zombies are also varied as well. It's possible to have fun with it. That's about all I can say about it. I didn't have much experience with it.
Now for the game almost killing my pc part. See that 1.6 hours on my playtime? That is a dirty lie. It runs even when you are not playing it. You also can not get back on the game because of this. I had to log out of my computer profile to close it. When I got back on, it said it cannot find my profile and switched me to an older Windows OS! (I think it was 98 or XP) I then restarted my entire computer and thankfully everything is safe. UNINSTALLED INSTANTLY OUT OF FEAR!
I don't know if this will happen to you but if you really want to play this game, make sure you read the end-user agreement word for word very carefully. I'm pretty sure they are doing some weird crap to my pc right now. 
I cannot recommend this after what I just experience. I also cannot recommend this because the game is not that good at all. Play at your own risk.

My mini-review for Counter Strike Nexon Zombies:
After putting 30 hours into this game, I must say it's a time killer.
Pros:
-CS 1.6 for free
-Fun as hell game modes (Item Battle, Challenge, Gun Deathmatch, Original etc.)
-Weapon crafting
-Cool designs for weapons
-Still brings that old feel of CS.
-Old good zombies, not like now's generic crap.
Cons:
-Jesus, still with the 1.6 engine?
-Unbalanced system
-Awful comunnity full with noobs
-K/D ratio's are complete piece of crap, I probably died over 100 times and it counts them as 300?
-Zombie Scenario is awful, just shooting zombies for leveling up, that's all.
-Let's just say it, every zombie mode in this game is too damn repetitive.
-Microtransactions
-Human Scenario
-Boring daily and special missions.
-Does not count all the matches you played
-Pay to Win
-Rarely can find a pro
-Dumbass Menu
-Barely gives you points to shop after a match no matter what place you ended.
-Some maps are designed pretty bad.
An awful Counter Strike game that somehow still gets me into it.

So much hate on this game...

Sure the game isn't your average Counter Strike Global Offensive, but it's free! Counter Strike normally costs 15‚Ç¨, but in this case it's a free game. You can give it a bash and see if you like it, because you don't have to pay anything.

Many people are also bitching about the "Pay to Win" aspect, but there is none! The default weapons are powerful enough and getting better weapons (or in this case different play style weapons) is easy if you play the game at least for 2h a week. 

The game even has many new game-modes that were not even imagined in Counter Strike 1,6. One of the amazing one's is where you and another team have to build your bases and defend against zombies. Or you can just go and have a fight instantly and see who is better with a knife.

The only big gripes about this game are - ancient graphics and the fact that scoping is a bit delayed and gets annoying over time (especially if you play games like CS:GO), but you don't have to stick to the snipers, because there are many powerful rifles without a scope unlike the legendary AWP.

The game is fair and good and is like the classic Counter Strike 1.6 with a ton of mods. Luckily unlike all those private servers on 1.6, this never crashes or has long joining times, because all of that is implemented into the game.
I don't think this game is supported on VMware Fusion 7 on OSX Yosemite. Everytime I attempt to launch it I get an error "Hack sensor . . . It is not defined."

Good old CS16, with multikill counter and announcer, and some more enhancements.

Zombie Original and Zombie Hero mods are actually quite fun. Yes, you do have to find a safe one-path-only accessible camping spot and try to push zombies army back with your bullets. The success depends on team's reload timing and number of the zombies.. Zombie Hero even adds health regen, respawn until not decapitated and some useful skills for zombies, which adds more challenge for the survivors. Also, when you die in Classic mode, you can only sit and watch for the next round. In Zombies, even though you get infected by a tiny scratch, you get the chance to play as a zombie; every enemy infection counts as a kill and every kill counts :)

Does anyone remember slaughtering knife-only bots with a machinegun? Things got even more amusing with Zombie Scenario and Zombie Shelter modes. Face waves of zombies together with friends or strangers...

Still not enough? There's DM, Team DM, Gun Game, soccer maps, or the immortal Classic mode, all in one free-to-play package. Counter-Terrorists win!

This is basically free cs 1.6 with zombies, new guns, microtransactions and connection problems. so it is a good game but with bad "upgrades". It's pretty fun to play with your friends especially the old gamemodes. The game tries to have some p2w mechanics but awp is still the king and ak47 still kills with a single headshot so buying the newer guns isn't necessary. The overall feel of classic cs 1.6 is still there.

What really kills this game is the connection problems and the fact that you need a decent computer to play some of the zombie modes which still look old and terrible.

I'd actually recommend this game if you were to play with your friends. If you on the other hand plan to play alone know that 90 % of players don't know how to chat.

This will be a more serious review as it has the Counter Strike/F2P "click-bait" name to it. To put it simply, it's a Combat Arms Pay2Win/F2P first person shooter. It has parts of it that are entertaining and parts of it that are abysmal, even worse than CA. Calling it CS is far from the truth.

Most of the modes suck outside of about 2. I recommend their equivalent of Gun Games called Gun Deathmatch (for balance), and the Zombie Scenario: Tracking (if you're interested in purely killing thiings mindlessly). Every other game mode is imbalanced and P2W-favored. The guns are weak unless you pay money or use cheats. Did I mention they use the notorious "Anti-Hack Shield"? It's useless if you're new to it. I'm not saying everyone cheats, it's just a useless system. There are no fidelity options, the game looks like s***. That's sorta a good thing because even bad computers easily push high FPS. But it looks like it was ported from PS2; it's bad. And the low reqs of it cause a lot of game ruiners to play. And no one talks on this game - text or mic. It's by far the leas strategic FPS I've seen and played, both due to gameplay and that communication issue.

It's the best F2P first-person shooter out there, to be honest. But that isn't saying much.. Even if you're very poor, I urge you to pay money for a game that doesn't suck. It definitely isn't worth playing. I left out some key points to keep this shorter, I just hope I prevents people from making the mistake of installing this. I cannot believe Valve backed it or it's called Counter Strike.... I suppose you can't expect much out of Nexon anyway.

I do not see why this game gets all the hate it does. So far as I've played this game is unique in how it is a total conversion for  C.S 1.6 as well it gives the core game to play with most of the original default weapons for free. I ask you the reader how this can be a bad thing even though this game has a cash shop it is almost completely unnecessary becaus when you login daily yu get given some weapons. I have heard of people complaining about the fact that weapons are not permanent well I say to you this why pay more in a cash shop for permanent weapons when you probably will not be playing the game super regular in 3 or 4 months this way with thier setup you pay much less for a weapon .99c as a matter of fact and last a reasonable amount of time less money spent upfront and in your playfield makes a better experience I Think. also the payed weapons have more power right away but the standardized weapons have more parts for deconstructing(I wont get into great detail about mechanics I will let you play and find out I am just proving a concept)so as to give you parts to upgrade better weapons ,also I think they might have more upgrade slots(don't hold me to this as I've only just started weapon customization at the time of this review).Furthermore the gameplay is smooth in almost all different modes and really shines in the orginal modes,this game even offers a deadlyu version of team football kicking the ball can kill an opponent. As one of the only downsides of this game is host connectivity issues causing minor to heavly moderate interruptions in gameplay but nexxon I think is working adding optimization patches to the client as well as there dedicated servers In closing this game can use some slight improvements to its self and mabye some instance balancing as well as promoting the fact that it is not pay 2 win as most people think  Overall this game deserves an 8.8/10

The game runs great. For anyone who has a "cheaper" PC the low graphics help run the game even better.

Despite being made by Nexon; don't know what the problem with that company is to people, but I really like the game although it has some flaws. Let's look at the bright side though, there's a lot of cool weapons, crafting system, inventory system, seasonal events, zombie modes, and a human scenario mode. It even has the old CS 1.6 maps, weapons, and modes! You can even play stuff like Demolition and stuff like that! They also tried balancing a lot of things, although they did kind of a bad job on that since a LOT of the guns are overpowered, then again it IS Counter-Strike.
The nitpicks... well, ingame transactions. I know they tried kind of balancing it like TF2, but it would be nice if you could buy most of the stuff with in-game points rather than real money. Or both options! It is true that it would be nice to support the developers but for the people who don't have a lot of money / don't have money to spare, it's a HUGE disadvantage. Also, it'd be great help if it was easier to obtain the free stuff and give players more than just what they have to get for spending time on their game.
Also, every game has really annoying bots so people who complain towards that need to re-think.
On the subject of nitpicks, it would be cool if it would reward you for more skill than luck. Sometimes it feels like it's luck if you get this drop or that drop. What would be more nice is even more missions than the daily and weekly missions you already have. The honor quests are pretty good, but maybe instead of honor you could get EXP, Points, or blueprint drops. They drop way too many durables.
That'd be all.

*WARNING: This game is a modded version of Counter-Strike 1.6, a game that came out in 1999, so the graphics are way outdated
*I've played quite a bit of Counter-Strike Online before CSN:Z was released, so keep that in mind with this review.
*TL;DR at the bottom for those who are lazy.

A lot of people seem to hate this game but I love it. Honestly how can anyone not like the fact that it Counter-Strike 1.6 with Condition Zero models that is free? Yes, there is a shop that offers character skins and weapon blueprints to use to craft weapons. But you don't have to buy any of that stuff to enjoy this game. I've been playing this version since it's USA release on 10/7/2014 with only buying the Jennifer and Natasha skin pack becuase they are permanent and will not be offered again for a long time. I did not buy any weapon blueprints becuase I know that eventually Nexon will offer the special weapons in the shop for permanent purchase. I've made it to Lvl. 42 without crafting a single weapon. I've played a lot of hours in Zombie Scenario with just the default load-out that is given in CS1.6. All it takes to get a special weapon (in my case) is to ask nicely for somebody to drop one for you if they have one and the money to do so. 9 times out of 10 somebody will drop one for me and hell, there are times where a nice player will just drop weapons for the other players. Maybe I'm just lucky, but there will be times that you'll be brushed off to the side and have to deal with the default weapons. Just ignore it and keep shooting because Zombie Scenario is manageable with competent players all using default weapons.

I completely understand and agree that Zombie Scenario can be tedious and monotonus with the whole "shoot wall, advance, shoot more walls/boxes/door, then fight a boss that has a RIDICULOUS amount of health" but I think the new maps and missions are a breath of fresh air if you play Original mode or Team-Deathmatch often. But whatever, it just reminds me of the deleted scenes from Condition Zero, and I enjoyed those missions in the deleted scenes.

The "Pay-2-Win" mindset that seems to be one of the biggest complaints in many reviews, but everyone needs to understand that nobody is forcing you to spend your real life money to play this game. Those special weapons are USELESS (with the exception of Skull weapons) against humans. They are only effective on zombies. Not only that but those special weapons are rare when it comes to crafting, that's why they're "special weapons". If you've spent money trying to craft them with no success, then stop trying (it may be too late for some of you). They'll eventually be sold for a limited time permanently. The optional skins do have their own stats and perks, but those perks are only available in zombie modes.

I know it's only been a month since it's CSN:Z has been released as I type this review, but I hope that Nexon eventually moves to their "update every 2 weeks" model like they do for CSO to keep this game fresh. I want to play Season 4 of Zombie Scenario. I want to run through the Envy Mask stage already.

PROS:
- CS 1.6 for free
- Weapon blueprints and skins are optional
- TONS of game modes (Original, Deathmatch, Team-Deathmatch, Zombie Original, Zombie Scenario, and much more that even I haven't played yet)
- The fact that the default CS1.6 weapons are all unlocked PERMANENTLY from the get-go. (In Counter-Strike Online, you have to BUY many of the default weapons that last a maximun of 30 days. WHO WANTS TO BUY THE M4 AND CV47 FOR ONLY 30 DAYS?! We should feel lucky that CSN:Z offers all the default weapons for free and permanent.)
- There are additional weapons in this game. (I've played modded versions of CS1.6 with different weapon skins and such; only difference is that you have to earn them in this game instead of changing model files)
- You don't need a monstrous gaming rig to play this game (my laptop is not meant for gaming and it still runs fine)

CONS:
- Microtransactions with a side of rarity in crafting special weapons to go with it (optional)
- Bugs that still haven't been addressed yet since release (windowed lobby, server lag at times amongst others)
- Bosses can have too much health (looking at you Revenant and you, Kraken)
- That damn FLASHLIGHT!!!

TL;DR
This game if fun if you take it for what it is: CS 1.6 with Condition Zero models and a TON of game modes (Classic game modes and new game modes)

Today's Review: Counter-strike Nexon: Zombies

This is the bastard son of what was once a great game. No option, no dedicated servers, it tries valiently to reclaim it's lost throne only to fail miserably and crush your nostalgia. Due to the servers being a Free-to-Play style setup with only Official servers, the hit registry is terrible and the added guns, skins, and modes are an competitive players nightmare. The game seems buggy and stutters a lot, and the guns feel terrible. Sound is often glitched resulting in the direction of gunfire being horribly confusing. Overall, a very vain attempt to bring the classic back to it's former glory but I don't believe any amount of work will ever make give this game the legendary stature it once possessed. R.I.P. Counter-Strike. Please put this disgusting atrocity to rest already.

This actually used to be Counter Strike:Online back in about 2006-2007, which was only available to the asian market (that I beta tested for a while completely lagged as hell).
And about a year ago, they made the sequel, which was Counter Strike:Online 2 (CS:Source for free literally), which has the same basis, but with some adittions like stories, and the ones you see it this.
And from my point of view, I think they should have just skipped the translation and servers for this one and go straight to the CS:O 2 they just made...
Still, this game is 1.6 for free with additional modes, maps, weapons, and characters.
And although it's obviously nothing new, since It's free it's okay to give it a try a couple of times.

Well, after going into the review section, I saw alot of bad reviews. So here is my taste:

If you have played Counter Strike 1.6 you will love this game. It has all the classic game modes (Classic, Deathmatch, etc.), all the maps you love, and that classic valve engine. You can spend hours murdering the many noobs who dont know how to switch weapons, and its all a blast. "But isnt CS 1.6 on Steam?" you are asking yourself. And yes, it is. BUT that costs money, and this is free. You dont even have to play the Zombie mode, you can just enjoy the game for what it is: Counter Strike. The game we all wasted hours of our lives playing back in the late 90's. So all in all, great game, still fun, and I highly reccomend it.

I feel as though this game had potential, but it wasn't used and overall I feel the game had poor design. While I would say if you didn't have 1.6 this could be an alternative given the team deathmatch mode, there are changes in movement and physics that really mess it up. It should have been made in the CS:GO engine for improved graphics and other things (you don't need much to run CS:GO anyway) and I don't think it should really be a standalone game. It is just a mod.

 I played Zombie Escape which involved me following arrows on a map which looked open - but turned out to be very linear, just the same thing every round. It was an ok concept for a game/gamemode, but it lacked any enjoyment for me - and I sometimes found myself stuck in the walls of the map, just waiting for my demise. Then it happened as a zombie, and I couldn't do anything - so I quit the server.

So this review doesn't go on forever, here are my pros and cons about the game:

PROS:

-The game is free so you don't waste any money trying it out (unless you use the microtransactions...)
-Some good concepts for gamemodes which could be improved and expanded upon more 

CONS:

-Some people don't like free to play - so I'm putting that here too. 
-Microtransactons
-COD-Style Levelling 
-Bugs (Stuck in walls, game not starting correctly to name a few)
-Made in the 1.6 engine rather than using something more up-to-date
-Linear arrow following in what could have easily been a more expansive world to play in
-Movement changes from 1.6 make it somewhat unfamiliar to 1.6 players
-Gets repetitve quickly
-It could easily have just been a mod, and some of the gamemodes are probably playable in Gmod
- YOU DON'T MOVE FASTER WITH YOUR KNIFE OUT 

Overall I would say this game is a 4/10 as it's features are rather lackluster. I feel as though Nexon have let us down, as I was somewhat looking forward to this game when I first heard about it. These are just my opinions though, and as the game is free you can try it out if you would like.

This game has a very narrow target audience, this is why it won't appeal to most CS players. It is targeted mostly towards Counter-Strike 1.6 Zombie Mode fanatics.

If you love playing Zombie Mode in the original CS 1.6, this might be your thing. Keep in mind that Nexon: Zombies is exactly that (CS 1.6 Zombie mode), but with a few improvements:
The game has a lot more MMO-ish design than the original. Thankfully, the gameplay is largely unchanged. The biggest changes are in the UI and in the guns. The game also adds a ton of new Zombie Mode content. We're talking more maps, more modes etc. Unfortunately for some dumb reason, there are only TWO zombie models in the game.

If you don't enjoy CS 1.6 Zombie mode all that much, or just play the original modes, this is definitely not your thing.
Players who play mostly bomb defusal scenarios will be hugely disappointed. There ARE classic bomb defusal and deathmatch modes, but they are just there for the sake of filling up the bullet-points.

Pros:
+ It's Free! AND it's NOT pay to win!
+ Freshens up the old and stale Counter-Strike formula a bit
+ New modes, or addition of modes which were not popular with the original CS. (Zombie escape is my personal favourite)
+ The maps are pretty dynamic for a 16 year old engine.
+ New guns
+ Several UI tweaks...

Cons:
- ...which may alienate some of the hardcore fans.
- The classic modes are a bummer.
- Not much variety in terms of character customization (sprays, skins, etc.)
- Toxic community. Like, League of Legends level of toxicity.
- No modding community AT ALL
- For a game that's primarily focused on zombies, the actual zombies themselves are pretty lame. I remember back in the day there were different types of zombies with different kinds of abilities (jumpers, healers, witches)... Instead, Nexon said "F*ck all that" and gave us only TWO (!!!) zombie models.

Potato comparison:
Imagine putting a potato in a cheap microwave for about a minute. When you take it out, some parts of the potato are blazing hot, while others are completely cold. This is what this game is like.

Final score:
6.8/10

If it aint COD, it ain't right... or so a majority of the negative reviewers tell us.

No, this game does not offer cutting edge graphics, it's based on pre-source models perhaps from CS 5 or earlier. If you're the type of person who focuses soley on cosmetic/aesthetic appearances, then by all means feel free to skip this title.

However, if you find yourself less superficial and you tend to focus more on substance/overall gameplay, then you'll want to check this out.

My 20+ hours of play focus mainly on two specific game modes - Scenerio and Shelter.

'Scenerio' is compromised of endless spawns of zombie hordes while you and your team fight your way through destructible barricades in an attempt to reach your 'lost' team. Once you reach the end of a map, you'll find yourself faced with a huge boss that will take your whole team to bring down (be sure to level [in game] appropriately prior to reaching boss). This a fair amount of variation in map layout, so be sure to try out different maps. This mode is heavily cooperative.

'Shelter' is a crafting style game. You and your team must fortify a shelter by harvesting materials. There are 3 skill trees in this mode - Having 1 player each (assuming you have 3 or more) focus and max out a single skill tree is imperative for your survival. Do your best to understand your skill tree and what role you should be playing and things will run fairly smooth. This mode requires even more cooperation than Secenerio and has the highest learning curve - Fair amount of forward thinking required if you are not playing with someone who has already survived shelter mode. The thinking aspect is a large part of the fun for me, take your time and you'll do fine.

There are a ton of other modes that I haven't played. The other few that I have where essentially 'Team Deathmatches' Zombis vs Humans, etc. For a free title, there's no reason why this game doesn't deserve more attention. Though as seen by reviewers, times are changing and apparently there are more superficial individuals in the world who prefer the same regurgitated slop year after year, rather than having new experiences. To each their own.

Lastly, In the main menu of the game you'll find a ton of stuff to do as well. Craft new weapons for use in game, create or join a family (being in a family can offer perks like bonus XP in game, etc), enhance preexisting weapons, etc. Ultimately there is a lot to this game - Attempt to experience as much as you can before you weigh in as an expert with less than 15 minutes of gameplay. I've yet to experience even half of this game.

At first I was pretty skeptical myself, reading all the crappy reviews saying how bad this game is, etc etc. After playing my first game I have to admit, I thought it was a deal breaker and I was about to uninstall it. But then I decided to give it another shot, and I actually had a good time! See here's what people are missing.

1.) It's very different than most FPS games. You can't move when you get shot. Accuracy isn't even added into the game, or atleast very little. But that's what makes it more challenging. More fun. More rewarding to get kills. It matters more that you have to be in the right position, and be clicking that motherfucking mouse as fast as you can.

2.) It's got that old Valve half-life engine. Oldish graphics and sounds that make it actually nostalgic for old time gamers. 

3.) You can't take it seriously. I've played my fair share of counterstrike:source and what not. And I have to say I love both now. Both games are enjoyable with a group of friends. In this game, you're more than likely going to get killed by some BS. 

4.) Nothing is permanent, except for some customizations and what not, but it's not solely dependent on players who pay for their equipment. You can still play "fair". You can still buy things in the shop that are temporary, but attainable. You can still get kills. So to be fair, no, It's not "pay to win". 

All in all, it's glitchy but enjoyable. I mainly play gun deathmatch, (which is essentially gun game in css). Try it out yourself.

Taking a tried-and-true foundation (Counter-Strike) and adding their own tweaks to personalize the package, the Nexon bunch have made something simple and fun to get in to; not only do you  get the familiar game modes from CS, you also are gifted with a variety of new game modes and maps too.  Add some zombie goodness into the mix topped off with a few other neat game modes / maps - looking at you "Hidden," and your angry Irish sounding, club wielding, invisible fairy killer as a prime example - and you've got the makings of a pretty good evening waster.

The game is certainly not state of the art graphics-wise and that is okay as there are a slew of newer, prettier games to be had.  What this does do, though, is allow those with older machines  a chance to try something "new." with little fear of not being able to run it.  Having said that, what is in the game isn't atrocious looking by any stretch.  Dated, maybe, but not horrifically ugly in appearance.

The item crafting stuff, missions and unique flavor of it all, to me, win out over the perceived "flaws," of having not-so-hot graphics.  I can honestly say that I've had some reasonably good fun with this game.

The seeming lack of an in-game tutorial is my only gripe, and odds are I've just not looked hard enough or looked in the right places as I've been too busy trying to kill that damned Irish fairy lately.  I've got a shotgun just for you, mister.

What can I say except, "try it."

Do yourself a favor and avoid this game, this is not like CounterStrike at all.

   I've played CS:1.6 and CS:CZ which are very good games and worth the asking price. This on the other hand is if you took those two games and mixed them with Battlefield Play4Free, and then took a huge dump on it.
The User Interface is all over the place and can be hard for new players to understand how to use it, and it litters you with all kinds of promotions and ads for items in the game. Although, once you finally understand how to navigate your way through the insane UI, you will quickly find out that it really is just a butchered version of CS:1.6 with micro transactions all over the place. The re-desings of the old CS maps are not all that great, everything feels way larger than it should feel and the new alternate versions of the maps are really nothing special. The audio is also like CS:1.6, only louder and in lower quality, even with all the audio options set to maximum.
  
  Now for the big one, that being the zombie mode. To put it simply... it's very bad. It really feels like nothing more but the original zombie mod from all the other CS games, and dumbed down to it's simplest form. Either, run away from the zombies with no tactics or pre thinking what so ever, or run around shooting the zombies with no tactics or team work what so ever, and the zombie shelter mode is just so boring, with no pun intended, brain dead zombie ai walking around aimlessly while your turrets fill them with holes and send them back to their boring hell where they belong, or to heven if they are lucky enough. 

  Not to mention that this version of CounterStrike has no modding features what so ever, because all the events are actually rooms instead of independent servers. Instead, you choose from a couple main servers depending on your geographical location in real life. Because you know, CounterStrike was never known for all of it's mods and community made game modes it has.(To anyone who doesn't understand, that last sentence was sarcasm.)
I really am trying to find somthing good about to say about this game, other than you can choose from female characters, which is good. But saddly you can only get those if you give them 9.99 USD, which completely destroyed any positives or upcommings for this game.
There are some other things I forgot to mention like crafting and perks, but I have to be honest with you, I really couldn't bare anymore than fourty minutes with this game. Come to think about it, I would have probably have never heard about this game if it weren't for a Youtube I saw while watching a video. I wouldn't have even bothered with it if it weren't for the fact that it was a "Free to Play" version of CounterStrike.

  My final words to you are, if you think this is the Free to Play version of CounterStrike that you have been all waiting for, it really isn't, not even close. If you want to play CounterStrike, then buy any of the other CS games there are, but don't waste your time on this. I hate to say it but, this game is a disgrace to the CounterStrike community.

 3/10 not recommended unless you are really looking for a Free to Play First Person Shooter.

Review updated from positive to negative after nearly 6 years since I posted original review in which I recommended this game. However, because of a lot of bad things happening with current state of CSN:S (formerly Counter Strike Nexon Zombies), I would like to warn new and old players about this game:

First of all, after spending thousands of dollars and having over 8000 hours on this game I came into conclusion that this game is just not worth the money or the time because of current situation and direction the game is going. Over the years, the game is full of pricey microtransactions (depending on your region) and other pay to win items which are required in order to enjoy the game fully such as newly released weapons, classes locked behind a steep paywall. Of course there are people who will defend this game saying that you can play the game without spending money, which is true but at the same time you will be utterly destroyed by players who own more powerful paid weapons in PVP modes. It's possible to play this game and not spend any money, however a lot of grinding is required in order to obtain most things, just not the latest gear. Most players also tend to abuse in game bugs and exploits and farming rank in order to be on top, and Nexon isn't doing anything about those bugs nor the people abusing them.

Second of all, this game lost significant playerbase due poor choices made by Nexon and because of toxic players ruining other players experience with name calling, racism and just ganging up on players and even resorting to harassment which is against Nexon's Terms of Service, however even when provided evidence against people breaking rules, Nexon does nothing, even when submitting multiple reports of abuse with proof. There are even people who got banned and silenced trying to help report people breaking the rules which is just unacceptable. Nexon isn't known for being a good company, and one can do quick search online about it but it's even worse that their customer support is non-existent, contacting their support can take weeks and not even solve any issue that players might have. 

Overall, I would strongly suggest avoiding this game because it's unfair, time consuming, plagued with bugs, exploiters, griefers, abusers, rank farmers and the game is lacking proper customer support.

This is a totally rip-off from South Korea. It was originally introduced to china in ca. 2008 (and it's still based on CS 1.6, which could explain its devastating video quality from last century). Because there were too many Chinese playing non-steam (pirate) CS 1.5 / 1.6 back then, from which Valve can't make any profit. Nexon bought the copyright of developing an online mod for CS specially distributed in Asia and made it into a MMO game,  so that the player must pay more or less during the gameplay like unbalanced weapons or items to drive you to "upgrade" your character in order to compete others. Now this kind of scam spreads to Europe, I must warn you guys 'cause it will finally cost you money if you get into it (like some of my classmates). I think no one could explain this more clear than a Chinese like me.

Awesome game, Cs 1.6 bored me to death with constant spawnkilling and cheaters + the Russians and high skill cap is retarded compared to this game.
Now..this game is like a starter's edition for noobs like me who haven't played Cs 1.6 24/7 or something like that.
So i'll give the pros and cons to make this short.
Pros:
-Better textures and graphics slightly better
-More maps
-More weapons
-Only skins are pay2win but i don't care at least you can't buy S grade weapons for money or something like that cuz the weapons are always random when crafting.
-More new players like me and fun to play with them.
-No microphone spammers
-No cheaters
-Cool modes like "Zombie shelter" and "FUN" which hype me up to play with friends.
-"Family" (Clan) system.
-Ranking system.
-Crafting,Synthesize,Disassemble,Enhancement systems.
Cons:Some problems with fps lag on certain modes, for example:My friend played Zombie Shelter and had intense lag and couldn't do anything without looking at the ground inside the main shelter...hasn't found a fix yet, it's really weird.
I recommend this game to many players newbies and veterans alike, cuz this is the improved version of Counter Strike in my opinion.

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is dissapointing.

PROS:
 - Updated Graphics
 - More guns
 - Survival Mode

CONS:
 - Unbalanced Zombie mode
 - Pay 2 win
 - Time consuming

OVERVIEW:
     CSN: Zombies just doesn't live up. I can't tell if this game is trying to be a Call of Duty rip-off or not. Dead serious. In CSNZ, you can partake in multiple gamemodes that you feel you want to play. There's Original, which is basic CS 1.6. There's different kinds of Zombie modes, but I only played one. I had a huge problem with this Zombie mode. It is WAY too unbalanced. A CT has 100 HP, and can be turned into a Zombie in 1 hit. A Zombie has 2000 HP (with the exception of the 7000 HP host zombie) and can take a LONG time to kill. This game is a grindfest. I only won 2 rounds as Humans due to hiding. The last mode I want to talk about is Survival. This game should have never been called Zombies. It should've been about this Survival mode, because it is the best thing in this game and the only reason i'd go back to play (besides playing with new guns in Original mode). In Survival mode, it's purely you and your teammates and whatever cash you can scavenge. Waves of different kinds of HUMAN enemies will try to kill you. Regular gunmen, big ass armored soldiers with miniguns, Survival has it all, including a Boss battle at the end of each one. As you kill more and more soldiers you can buy bigger and better guns and equipment. Survival missions technically have a story line, but you will be more inveloped in the gameplay than someone who only gives lines during the middles of waves. It can become really chaotic and what balances this factor out is a super quick regeneration system. It's just like CoD. Hide back and wait, but it only takes a couple of seconds. Normally, this kind of thing doesn't go good in my book. I've always thought regenerating health as a character was kind of a cheat. The way I prefer it is how it works as a pickup in Quake. But it works with Survival mode. It fits right in and makes the mode so much more fun.

Now that i'm done with the gamemodes. Let's move on to the rest of the game. There is a shop to buy things with your points you've collceted for either playing for an extended amount of time or for completing a mission or match. Now this isn't a problem. You may want to buy new guns with these points. Oh wait. YOU CAN't. THERE ARE NO SINGLE GUNS LISTED IN THE SHOP. ONLY THING AVAILABLE IS WEAPON PACKAGES THAT COST REAL USD. I can't overexagerate how stupid companies are when they place a pay 2 win system in their games. And these guns can be seriously overpowered in some matches. It really shows that games like these don't care about your experience, but your money.

Let me explain my overall gameplay feeling. I can't enjoy Zombie mode, so i'm gonna skip that. Original mode is actually not all that bad. At first I was confused, but it was a quick adjustment. I think Original mode allows for players to pick up new guns they bought and try to test them against other players, to see if it was really worth the purchase. You can play on all the old CS 1.6 maps, including dust2 and italy, And with the game's updated player graphics, it actually feels really nice. Survival mode is amazingly fun and the only reason you should actually sit down and play this game.

I don't recommend this game. Only because of it's poor Zombies mode, which is how the game was advertised, and because of the Pay2Win system. If this game got rid of some things, it'd be a fun addition to the CS series, but I can't find all my fun in it. Yes, Survival is great and all, but that doesn't mean i'm gonna sit there 24/7 gunning down massive waves of enemies. Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies tries it's best to fit in with the rest of the franchise, but some factors just kick it to the curb.

*UPDATE* (As of 10/26/14)
I've read peoples messages, comments, etc. And all I keep finding is the complaint of needing to play for more than an hour before writing a review. First off, I played a good 50 minutes. Sorry if I was 10 away from the 1 hour mark. Second, I don't remember the point where playtime resulted in a fun game. If there are so many reviews on this game, with low playtime, wouldn't that hint you that it wasn't an overall enjoyable experience, causing us to put down the game?

I'm still sticking with all my points. I really don't see any reason to change what I feel about them. The game dissapointed me, so I only sat through 50 minutes of it. I have more fun playing L4D2 than this.

the gameplay is almost the exact same as 1.6, but theres more features such as clans, crafting, and an official zombies mode. the only thing that sucks is that there arent any dedicated servers. scoping with the awp has ~0.5 second delay and its kinda impossible. when youre joining a lobby all the playes suck, making it likely that this is their first counter strike game. one thing i dont like about it are the new weapons; sure they look cool but they dont fit in with the counter stike groove. overall, nexon did a solid job on reviving the counter strike legacy. they left most original features untouched, such as the "original" gamemode. original is basically legacy counter strike, and because of that, is why i play this more than 1.6. here its easier to create an organized clan, and to get up to the competitive ladder instead of having to spend money on esea, cevo, or altpug. as ive mentioned before, this game does a good job of keeping the counter strike legacy alive, and may be a good "starter" edition of counter strike for new players. if youre new, this is a fun and competitive game. if youre a veteran, this is still a fun and competitive game. overrall, id recommend it to newcomers who want to get more familiar with the counter strike franchise, and to hardcore veterans who want to refresh their experience with 1.6.

This game destroyed whatever was remaining of my soul, there is no place to start with how terrible it was. I'm not sure if I should address the horrible interface, gameplay, and overall concept, or the fact that this game was probably made inside a dormant volcano on an island used for a toxic waste dump. I was scarred forever after one "match" I use the term match lightly because I had no idea what was occuring, other than I was mindlessly running about in a box with worse graphics than a windows 95 screen saver, and wretched, shameful attempts at gunshot audio constantly blaring. Taping 'Counter-Strike" into the title makes me scared to play Counter-Strike ever again, not because it had anything to do with this disgrace, but because I may have flashbacks to the nightmarish experience I sat through with this.

This game should have an achievement for being able to spend more that 25 seconds in the main menu, Forget free to play, they should have to pay the user to play this game.

You uninstall button will scream for use, your hard drive will cry in pain every moment this game remains on it. Do the right thing.

I feel this game is a great addition to the CS games, it not only has the original CS1.6 mode, but has tons of new weapons that you can craft and many different multiplayer modes to chose from and some great CO-OP. Though not as fun alone, when you have these people called "friends" it makes for a great experience. Though yes some improvements can be made, such as a round start timer for the original mode (I haven't seen one myself), less structure health on Tracking mode,  the hidden should be more like source, where he remains only slightly visible and you have to watch for certain things to find him, and plus no respawns in that mode (Reason I mention the hidden stuff there is because it makes it way to fast pace). Anyways thats my 2 cents on this game. Play for yourself, everyones opinion is there own... even if its wrong :D

I forgot to mention that the Menu UI is terrible and needs to be the same as the in game video settings. Also there should be more resolution settings (such as 1360x768 for me).

Not sure why some people give this game a bit of hate.  Honestly, I think this game is another fantastic addition to the franchise.  The multiplayer modes and maps take us all the way back to CS 1.6, the good ole days!! But the most remarkable part of this game is easily the zombies!  In this game, they take an old idea (zombies) and add so many new modes and ways to play that it becomes utterly addicting.  There are a few bugs out there, but this game isn't pay to win at all, and the gameplay is not only classic, but fantastic!  With some patching and more work, I would go as far to say this would be the Free to Play Game of the Year.  97/100

This is similar to many in-game-transaction (free) game we used to have back in the days. Which is why I say when you play this game, ignore everything BUT the open lobby of games to play.

This game is an artwork; it contains the mechanic and the dynamic of the original CS we all are used to and loved. The swarming of the zombies are a piece of work as well as your teammates who decides "everyman for himself" and get the entire team zombified are real jerks to work with. However, try playing this with friends or people with mics. The experience increases tenfold as you scream, laugh, and sacrafice yourself in vain for the greater good of buying your fellow humans a couple of seconds before hunting the same teammates down again.

Oh, did I mention that despite many of the in-game-transaction, the game is balanced? The -in-game purchases unlocks a couple of guns unavailable to us but everything in its arsenal are more than enough to satisfy an avrg gamer.

Happy Shootings everyone!

The recoil in this game... NEEDS ALOT of work. When im aiming down the sights with my revolver with my scope, and the dots right on the guy, and i still see the bullet wiz to the right or left or any direction and hit the wall behind him. I Freak out. Because I was aiming at him. Not moving. Crouched. Still missed, and it still happens here and there. I feel like the recoil in this game has specific percentages on how much your moving, if your crouched, and the crosshair does NOTHING to impact how and where you shoot. So fix it, seriously.

Family is a cool and new thing thats in this game. Its like a clan, only CS own little way of saying what it is. Manage it and send out notifications EXC. Join other familys, have storages that people can access....... The one thing that NEEDS to be set differently is the time on where you can join one family. What i mean by this is that when your in a family, you leave for some reason or another, and you wanna join another family. You HAVE to WAIT 2 weeks untill you can join another family. My friend was in a family before just to see how it is and all that, then he left and I invited him to my own that I made myself. He couldnt join and we were both pissed the fuck off, it doesnt tell you that you have to wait. It lets you go and makes you regret the decision. Fix that Please

The maps are cool, some are really small but hey, whatever ya know.

Game types are different from what ive seen in alot of games ~
Beast- Fight at a church and kill other people. Theyl drop these stones that anyone can grab, get three of them and turn into this big beast they call the yeti. Multiple people can use it at once and itl become a one big beast fight in the middle of the map to see who the fastest clicker is. Its decent

TDM/Original/Bot TDM/ Arms race / DM

 Basic gamemodes that most FPS shooters have, same concept, different game, different guns, different maps.

Other gamemodes that are ok

Scenerios

` Basicly just one building, or area, where you the player choose your weopons and and fight big waves of bosses, and bots of couse. Each with there own set of health, weakpoints , weopons and killing styles. There are currently only 2 scenerios, Zombie and Human.

Weopons

` Theres quite a few for a just launched game. So Clap clap on that. Recoil needs help.

Melee

` Its decent, make sure to aim the crosshair right at the guy your trying to wrek. Otherwise youl miss and get humililiated.

Disc space isnt that much, maybe 3 GB, Good for a remake of a game


One other thing. Theres thing called Zombie Shelter.... WTF were you thinking when you made that gametype. Theres no tut, i had no idea what i was doing. Money making is shit, and when people leave on like round 5, and your all by yourself you might as well just quit. Cause when u die you lose everything, including money you took 5 hours to get. So when you see a match with that. Keep scrolling.
