The best game I have ever played in twenty years of computer gaming, bar none (and I have played a LOT of games). Eight years on I can still recall how profoundly that game gripped me, and I am not an overly emotional person. You will care about the characters, you will be moved, you will make choices that tell you more about yourself. It sounds trite, I know, but it really is that good. If only someone would make more of these...insightful, intelligent, devastatingly creative. Fallout is the only RPG to come close. A word of warning: You MUST read all the text, explore all the dialogue options, if you are to gain the most from the game. A decent intelligence and wisdom score is recommended.....although so is a decent score in everything else....the game does the best job of making usually superflous statistics genuinely useful that I have ever seen. Still very much worth playing.

Counter Strike Nexon : Zombies (CSNZ)

CSNZ is an offshoot of the CS (Counter Strike) 1.6 version.
Playable on Steam.Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies takes on the gameplay of the classic 
tactical shooter, but introduces a number of new PvP and PvE game modes. 
As the title suggests, it is about a "undead threat." Besides terrorists and 
counter-terrorists, the 
various types of zombies romp on known maps such as "de_dust" also new scenarios.
There is also a crafting system, which allows to customize weapons and upgrades. 
There are new female and male characters.
And Nexon wants to provide "ongoing new content".

Who was spoiled by other shooter might have some problems with the graphics of CSNZ.
But we must not forget the CSNZ based on the classic CS version.And it's free to play.
A good engine like CryEngine/Unreal Engine 4/Unity/Havok Vision Engine cost money, if 
Nexon would have used this engine, 
the game would not be free and it would not be based on the classical CS version.

The zombie mode is quite nice. The control getting used to but CS fans 
may have no problems with it.The graphics, as mentioned earlier, is based on the classic CS version, 
and has been slightly revised.Graphic was "rounded"- Edges "smoothed".
Compared to the classic version, it gives the whole a modern "touch".

This makes the game appealing.

You will find well-known maps and get the retro-feeling back.
A journey into a more modern Dust or Italy.

It is of course also possible to play normally without zombies, which makes the game more interesting.
Zombie or normal gameplay. 
For me the game is too slow and sluggish.But long-established CS lovers will love it.


It's a long time since I played CS1.6, but it was "all" taken over to CSNZ who 
played CS1.6 know here how to place purchases etc.

My conclusion, it is a welcome change.And it's fun to remember the old CS1.6 times.
This game has been well implemented.

The changes that were made on Maps, new game modes etc are also great realized.


Personally, I'll probably rarely or never play.

Because I can not and will not get used to this graphic, 
the gameplay is too slow and sluggish to me.

However, I think it is worth a try, everyone should have tested it once.

A bizarre, horrifying nightmare of nostalgia.

There are so many things wrong with this game that don't make sense, it introduces problems never seen in CS 1.x to give you a demented experience that's a shadow of the game it blatantly rips off.

[list]
[*] It always needs to run elevated, the first Steam game I've seen to do so, probably because it uses an exotic anti-cheat system that no one's heard of.
[*] If you choose a name that's taken you'll get a connection terminated error that forces you to quit to the desktop. 
[*] Because of this, I now have "Steam" has a nickname, there's no availability check and like other gimmicky F2P titles you need to pay to change your name... probably, I don't really know or care. "Steam" is a perfectly okay name with me for a game I'll never play.
[*] The interface is locked to 1024x768, regardless of your specified in-game resolution. This doesn't sound like a big deal, but it is.
[*] The console doesn't accept most commonly used GoldSrc commands, and looks like some horrid half-assed bespoke job that was never meant to be used.
[*] North America and Oceania are considered the same region for the purposes of matchmaking.
[*] 250ms is considered "Ideal" ping.
[*] I don't know if there are dedicated servers, but the game I just played had it's hoster switch and everyone dropped out. So, yeah, P2P CS.
[/list]

Some of what I've just mentioned may be inaccurate, but whatever, I'm still giving this review more effort than the people who rolled out this rubbish.

A lot of people shit on this game for the connection issues. I was able to play just fine after they fixed it, and it is a lot better than i expected it to be. I had low expectations, but now i can see it is truly going to be a decent game. I mean, its free, you really have nothing to complain about. Here's a few things i like, and then ill do the pros and cons-

It has that "P2W" feel (guns lasting a few days) without actually using any real life currency. i personally like it. the crafting system determines how long the gun will last, and then you can upgrade the gun itself. its pretty creative, and iv'e never seen anything like it. The level design is fairly decent, maps tend to be pretty small besides the zombie co-op gamemode (forgive me, i forget the name of the gamemode) but overall, it feels like a counter strike game with a lot more variety.

PROS:
-Customize buy menu with countless guns
-upgrade your guns
-p2w feel without real life currency
-ZOMBIES
- plenty of AI and Non AI gamemodes
-decent clan system
-has that classic counter strike feel without it feeling like just a mod
-in-game leveling system (level up your speed, attack, ammo, etc) as well as overall leveling system (unlock and craft more/better guns)

CONS:
-took some time for servers to come up
-occasional server crash (only happened 1 time out of my total play time)
-takes some time to get used to crafting, upgrading, etc
-rounds can be LONG. I played ONE ROUND that lasted more than 2 hours (co-op)
-Penalties for quitting a round (when you shoot mindlessly at AI for over an hour without any progress, you get bored quickly)
-getting new guns is determined by chance
-overall pretty small maps (personal preference)
-some guns are OP
-takes a few tries to actually log in upon start up (give it a few tries if it doesnt work the first time)

Overall, i would reccommend this game to anyone who's a fan of Counter Strike, or even just survival horror games althogether. The replay value is very high, and seeing how this is a beta, that says a lot. It's worth a try, its relatively small (i believe around 2-4GB) and it doesn't take a supercomputer to run. it's a fun game in my opinion, and ill definitely be partaking when it has its full release. Hope this review helped!

Now when I first played this earlier I've never experienced any connection issues while half of the nexon game community did. I have played the game with no issues and this is what I have to say. This game is in beta still and knowing that it has a lot of issues which is understandable I do believe this f2p is unbalanced. The only weapon you can survive with mostly is any LMG and grenades unless you play the hero and get that special rifle that kills zombies pretty quickly. Exploits all over and the zombies have a very high chance of winning every round because they can bottleneck your ass pretty easy.

It's still a great concept, but the actual CS mod still does a better job than this. I would not recommend this to everyone, but if you want to try then give it a try. I don't think this will be a game you play all the time though. Just stick with the original zombie mod for CS 1.6, CS:S, and CS:GO.

Interesting  game and idea, based off the CS:S zombie mod.  The build mode looks like it could potentially be fun.  As of beta, clipping issues are horrible.  Latency is less than 100, and i can't tell if I'm hitting the zombies or not.  i NEVER see damage coming, so it's impossible to avoid.  Overall it just runs terribly. Also, there's no real 'instructions' on the 'build mode'.  Someone managed to get a gun, told me i needed to find an ATM.  I did, but couldn't do anything with it.  Something the intially looked/sounded awesome quickly turned into frustration, and i lost interest completely.

The main menu is even worse.  It's in an awful resolution, and there's so much information on the screen you can't take it all in.  As a novice logging into the game for hte first tiem, i just didn't even care to figure it out.

I can think of some things better worth your time than playing this game.  Getting your eyes gouged out with a spoon, sitting on a cactus, and being sandwiched in between two speeding cars come to mind foremost.  In fact, reading the reviews people have written about this game was vastly superior to playing the game.

The menu screen is locked at 1024x768, guaranteed to fuck anyone with multiple monitors over.  My windows shift around after going into the menu, and it's very annoying to constantly have to move them back to their original position after playing a game.

The FOV is locked to 90, which is horrendously short.  Come on, what is this, the latest Call of Duty title?  

You start with a very limited amount of ammo, which isn't NEARLY enough to take out a single zombie player, let alone the many zombies that will inevitably be running at you.  The zombies can take WAY too much damage.  And to top it all off, if they so much as touch you, you're a zombie now too.  You never had a chance from the beginning.

The only way to win is not to play, which honestly is the best option.

Yeah. I recommend this. This game isn't half bad, knowing how its in Open Beta Testing. It does have a few things that threw me off, like it lags a little bit, and it is very glitchy. Otherwise, it's the best steam shooter game I have. Why? Creativity. Soccer? Check. Homing snowmen robots that have squeaky shoes and self destruct, and have evil faces? Check. Counter-Strike 1.6 Graphics? Yes. Awesome weapons?? To me, yes. Cool maps, from CS1.6? Yes. I recommend it to anyone who has a low budget and really wants CS 1.6 or something. Also, disagree with me all you want, negative comments, I love this game. I also to plan to play waaay more hours.

I'm going to say this first and foremost: it's still in beta. Those who are giving the game negativity and getting connection errors don't realize that the game will improve with time; right now it's getting a huge amount of traffic because of so many people wanting to play this under-the-radar release on the first day. The Counter-Strike name is HUGE, so of course when there's a free version of a huge game, people will flock to play it. (But also, Nexon servers aren't the best.)

It's a port of Counter-Strike Online from Asia, so it's basically a free version of CS 1.6 but now with added features (like the cool crafting system) and having zombies as the main selling point. I had a fun time playing the game, even if it was for a short while. I'd recommend it for those who want just a quick burst of fun or if you've never played any CS game before. Best of all it's free, so if you don't like it you can easily uninstall it and come back to it another time when the beta is over if you want.

The only thing I would ask for improvement are the menus and easier ways to access what you want when you're in a session. Right now it feels clunky.

PS: Seeing all the F2P nubs not knowing how to crouch-jump is hilarious.

Poor graphics, poor gameplay, shitty weapons, and overall not too great.

The greatest flaw in the first person shooter/MMO market, in my opinion, is the reliance on item timers.  I don't know a single person who has bought one of these money sinks, and I don't think I'd like to know anyone that gulliable.  This stuff... this product you're selling us is already nonexistant... the least you can do is make the items permanent.

Listen, almost 65% of the people that Downvoted this game only down voted it because their servers were having issues. I've gotta say, I played this game for a good hour with the servers only shutting down once for 5 minute maintnence, and I hopped right into a Original Defusal game on Inferno. I felt right at home. This game is basically CS: 1.6 F2P, with a few added items that may look a bit familiar if you played Combat Arms or Crossfire in your childhood. 700+ Hours on CS:GO, and this game FELT like a CS title. (Keep in mind, this game is in beta) This game has all of the original 1.6 maps, as well as a zombie mode. I haven't gotten a chance to play it, but I'm going to say it's probably like Crossfire's/Combat Arms zombie game mode, which is pretty cheap but aye, you're not paying anything for it. If you're a fan of CS and wanna try something new because you're tired of the Dust 2 Comp over and over again on CS:GO, give this a shot. It takes a bit of getting used to, but in the end, it's (Almost) the same CS 1.6 we loved years ago.

This game isn't as bad as people are saying it is. You can definitely tell it needs work but it is in Beta. Are the graphics good? No they look like the original Counter-Strike. Is it revolutionary? No. Are you going to spend money on it? Probably not. But it's a free game that's a pretty good diversion if you're bored. It plays just like the zombie servers on Counter-Strike for the most part but if you don't have a Counter-Strike game, well then here you go. You don't have to pay for it or spend any money on it, so don't expect it to be perfect and if you don't like it just uninstall it.

Its a carry over of the original CSO modification of Condition Zero advertised as a micropayment version of CS for Asian countries. Im SO HAPPY ITS FINALLY HERE. It has all of the game modes as before, sparing no maps, and they even reworked the microtransaction system so it isn't Pay2Win anymore, but all weapons are in stock (Before you had to buy a hand ful of them from the store with points) and you can onyl craft special weapons. While you can buy/pay for consumable bonuses (in which are almost always used in team work mode)

A very fun game with a lot to offer :)

I GOT TO SAY FIRST: I'm reviewing this from the point of view of someone that never played Counter-Strike or couldn't afford it.
I'm agreeing with some other reviews where people say that there is a lot of connexion problems (not in my case btw) so I can understand that it as bad "notes" on steam because of that; but maybe that will be patch later... Who knows ?
And also, I think the game is not that bad for a Free To Play. I mean: it's not like a sh*tty Pay To Win; here you can play some original maps from the original Counter-Strike series even without buying anything and you won't be always kill by the guy who buy his broken LMG 3$ a day. Not here.
So overall: it's not that bad if you want to play a CS without buying one.
But I recomend buying the CS series. 'Cause it's still better than this.

I know it is open beta, so the game isn't finished yet.

Bugs so far: 
- Main screen is stuch on low res, messing up your screen settings. However ingame its all good to 1920 x 1080 which I use.
- Connection issues

Complaints that can't be fixed:
- it being half-life 1 engine, which these days is just not done. Unlike Quake Live which is a more smoot hand fluid engine, the half-life 1 engine isn't smooth enough these days for fast paced action. It's slow and clumsy and no scriptwriting can fix that.

As for the game being free to play: if you haven't played any Counter Strike game before and really want to have the good old experience, this might be just for you!

This review at first was negative. I was mad because of the network problems and i wasn't able to play but after they fixed the problem I started to play around the game and to see its content.
The game turned out to be preety fun i don't know why people hate it.There are some really fun game modes you have to try out.Theres zombie scenario game mode which is your casual "go do that while killing zombies" zombie shelter was a real surprise to me because it offers actual base building,yes you and your team have to build a "shelter" and protect it from another team and zombies,while you gather other resources which will grant you victory.theres also your casual survival gamemode "survive against zombies". Thats all i have to say about this game.

Well, here are the things I liked about this game: .... 
Seems a bit short doesn't it? Well, that's because this game wouldn't even start up. It kept crashing on the main screen: 'connection to server terminated'. Those words will forever be engrained in my psyche, lodged deep within the recesses of my brain, only to be brought back to the forefront when I hear that ear splitting music playing, triggering some sort of mental breakdown akin to a Vietnam vet having flashbacks of his buddy's leg getting blown off in front of him. If you try to lower the volume of the music and apply it, next time you launch the game it's reverted back to it's old ways like a recovering heroin addict falling off the wagon. You'll want to do heroin after this so that analogy is very appropriate. This game was made with the intent to waste time, and waste my time it did. Those precious 30 minutes I spent downloading this piece of shit could've been better spent watching the autopsy of a loved one. Thanks a bunch you incompetent pricks.

Ok, now that the server issuses have been fixed, I am giving a more accurate review.

Is this game any good? Well, it depends. The concept behind this game is solid, but it has a poor implementation. Out-dated graphics, for instance. Also, it tries to be a CoD: BO2 Zombies or modded CS:GO. In my opinion, it doesn't live up to either of those games. Black Ops 2 is really fun, I played Zombies a lot on my console, but it's worth the time you'd put into it. This, at the moment, isn't.

If you want to play it, go ahead. It's your time, and not mine.

This game is a shitty game that calls itself Counter Strike the only thing CS related are the maps and the name. It seems like the just copied CS 1.6 and added some mods which you can find on any CSS or CS:GO custom server and they are better then this game. Also it startet crashing and deleting my settings for the first five minutes until i finally could choose my username which is unchangeable and isn't the same as your steam username and must not contain any characters that are not numbers or letters. following this you can't set the graphics higher then 1280x1024  so there is no option for hd quality and in this times it should be standard to have hd graphic settings. Given the fact that this game is free to play it probably will be full with hackers in the next days and they can create new accounts over and over again. Also given the fact that there is an shop for weaponparts this seams to become pay to win even if the publisher states that you can get all the parts by playing the game, but the question there is how long does it take you to get one part and how fast can you buy it? 
Ending this review  i have to say i spend more time writing the review than having to play the game without dieing because of how bad this game is and that it calls itself Counter Strike.
I think this is a very dark day in the CS history and i hope this game doesn't become very popular.
